original: 'di ni mthong ste me long la //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ste me long la //
translated: This is seen, like a young girl’s reflection in a mirror.

original: pra phab gzhon nu ma yis bzhin zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la gzugs kyi phung po me long lta bu'i ye shes so //🔽dngos kun mnyam pa nyid gyur nas //
analyzed: pra phab gzhon nu ma yis bzhin zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la gzugs kyi phung po me long lta bu'i ye shes so // dngos kun mnyam pa nyid gyur nas //
translated: This is the form aggregate as mirror-like wisdom.🔽All things become sameness,

original: dngos po gcig tu mi 'gyur gnas //
analyzed: dngos po gcig tu mi 'gyur gnas //
translated: and abide in the one thing that does not change.

original: mi 'gyur ye shes las byung ba //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ye shes las byung ba //
translated: Arising from unchanging wisdom,

original: chad pa ma yin rtag pa'ang min //
analyzed: chad pa ma yin rtag pa'ang min //
translated: it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: zhes pa ni tshor ba'i phung po mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni tshor ba'i phung po mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: This is the feeling aggregate as the wisdom of equanimity.

original: ming gi bdag nyid yi ge kun //
analyzed: ming gi bdag nyid yi ge kun //
translated: All letters, which are the nature of names,

original: aa yig rigs las yang dag byung //
analyzed: aa yig rigs las yang dag byung //
translated: arise from the class of the letter A.

original: mi 'gyur chen po'i gnas thob pa //
analyzed: mi 'gyur chen po'i gnas thob pa //
translated: Attaining the state of great immutability,🔽there is neither name nor that which has a name.

original: ming med ming can dag kyang med ces pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ming med ming can dag kyang med ces pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the perception aggregate as the wisdom of individual investigation.

original: skyes pa ma yin pa yi chos //
analyzed: skyes pa ma yin pa yi chos //
translated: For phenomena that are not produced,

original: 'du byed bral ba rnams la yang //
analyzed: 'du byed bral ba rnams la yang //
translated: and are free from compositional activity,

original: sangs rgyas nyid med byang chub med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid med byang chub med //
translated: there is no buddhahood, no enlightenment,

original: sems can med cing srog nyid med //
analyzed: sems can med cing srog nyid med //
translated: no sentient beings, and no life force.

original: ces pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: ces pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
translated: This is the aggregate of formation, the wisdom of purposeful activity.

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das //
translated: The reality of consciousness is past.

original: ye shes dag pa gos pa med //
analyzed: ye shes dag pa gos pa med //
translated: Wisdom is pure, unstained.

original: rang bzhin 'od gsal la chos rnams ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'od gsal la chos rnams ni //
translated: The nature of phenomena is luminous,🔽Abiding in the domain of the basic space of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bgrod par gnas zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bgrod par gnas zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the aggregate of consciousness, the wisdom of the utterly pure basic space of phenomena.

original: de bzhin du bsdus pa'i rgyud las kyang le'u lnga pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brgya rtsa gcig pa la sogs pa gsum gyis 'khor @264b lo'i mtshan ma la sogs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsdus pa'i rgyud las kyang le'u lnga pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brgya rtsa gcig pa la sogs pa gsum gyis 'khor @264b lo'i mtshan ma la sogs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Similarly, the Compendium of Practice, in the first three of the one hundred and one verses of the fifth chapter, speaks of the characteristics of the wheels and so forth and the characteristics of the aggregates of the tathagatas.

original: 'khor lo srid gsum kun nas dang ba zhes pa'o bde ba rin chen 'di yi chags pa nyid dag ni //
analyzed: 'khor lo srid gsum kun nas dang ba zhes pa'o bde ba rin chen 'di yi chags pa nyid dag ni //
translated: The wheel is the purity of the three worlds, the attachment of this jewel of bliss.

original: padma'o nyon mongs zad pa ral gri rdo rje dag kyang ye shes sku chen rnam par mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: padma'o nyon mongs zad pa ral gri rdo rje dag kyang ye shes sku chen rnam par mi phyed pa'o //
translated: The lotus is the exhaustion of the afflictions. The sword and the vajra are the great wisdom body, which is indivisible.

original: mi shes gcod pa gri gug mchog gi rigs drug rnams te 'di dag rnams kyis bskyed pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: mi shes gcod pa gri gug mchog gi rigs drug rnams te 'di dag rnams kyis bskyed pa gang yin pa //
translated: The flaying knife is the severing of ignorance. These are the six supreme families.

original: phung po khams dang dbang po la sogs mkha' bzhin ro mnyam de dag rnams kyang de bzhin rig par bya //
analyzed: phung po khams dang dbang po la sogs mkha' bzhin ro mnyam de dag rnams kyang de bzhin rig par bya //
translated: Whatever is generated by these, the aggregates, elements, sense faculties, and so forth, is equal in taste to space. They should also be known in that way.

original: gang du nges par rigs kyi gzugs ni nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni chen po'i gzugs su gsungs //
analyzed: gang du nges par rigs kyi gzugs ni nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni chen po'i gzugs su gsungs //
translated: Wherever the form of the family is definitely impaired, that is said to be the form of the great one.

original: gang du 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni tshor ba chen por gsungs pa ste //
analyzed: gang du 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni tshor ba chen por gsungs pa ste //
translated: Wherever the suffering of samsara is impaired, that is said to be the great feeling.

original: gang du 'khor ba'i 'du shes nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni rdo rje'i 'du shes chen po'o //
analyzed: gang du 'khor ba'i 'du shes nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni rdo rje'i 'du shes chen po'o //
translated: Wherever the perception of samsara is impaired, that is the great vajra perception.

original: gang du 'khor ba 'phel ba nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni rdo rje'i 'du byed kho na'o //
analyzed: gang du 'khor ba 'phel ba nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni rdo rje'i 'du byed kho na'o //
translated: Wherever the increase of samsara is impaired, that is the vajra formation itself.

original: gang du gnyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de yang rnam par shes par gsungs //
analyzed: gang du gnyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de yang rnam par shes par gsungs //
translated: And where there is a loss of consciousness, such as in sleep, that is also consciousness.

original: gang du shes pa min pa'i dngos po nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni thub pa'i ye shes nyid //
analyzed: gang du shes pa min pa'i dngos po nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni thub pa'i ye shes nyid //
translated: And where there is a loss of a thing that is not consciousness, that is the wisdom of the Sage.

original: 'di rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs dam pa'i rgyal ba mchog ni rnam pa drug ste rigs drug rnams //
analyzed: 'di rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs dam pa'i rgyal ba mchog ni rnam pa drug ste rigs drug rnams //
translated: These are the six aspects of the supreme victors, Vairochana and so forth, the six families.

original: gzhan ni khams drug dbye ba rnams te sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' zhi ba rnams //
analyzed: gzhan ni khams drug dbye ba rnams te sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' zhi ba rnams //
translated: The other divisions are the six elements: earth, water, fire, wind, space, and peace.

original: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying por gyur pa gsol pa 'debs pa dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brgya drug cu
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying por gyur pa gsol pa 'debs pa dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brgya drug cu
translated: Similarly, in the Praise in Hundred and Eight Names, the Blessed One, Vajra Holder, the unchanging wisdom, the essence of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, is supplicated with 162 verses.

original: rtsa gnyis kyis de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: rtsa gnyis kyis de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu bstan to //
translated: It is fully taught by the Tathagata.

original: de la de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang zhes pa la sogs pa nas lus btud nas ni spyan sngar 'dug ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug go //
analyzed: de la de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang zhes pa la sogs pa nas lus btud nas ni spyan sngar 'dug ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug go //
translated: The sixteen verses beginning with Then the glorious Vajradhara and ending with bowing his body, he sat down in front of him are the verses of request.🔽The six verses beginning with Then the Bhagavat Shakyamuni and ending with the Bhagavat said, 'Excellent!''

original: de nas bcom ldan sh'akya thub ces pa la sogs pa nas bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni lan gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug go //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan sh'akya thub ces pa la sogs pa nas bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni lan gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug go //
translated: are the verses of reply.

original: slar yang de nas zhes pa la sogs pa nas rigs chen @265a * //🔽gtsug tor cher gzigs nas //
analyzed: slar yang de nas zhes pa la sogs pa nas rigs chen @265a * // gtsug tor cher gzigs nas //
translated: The two verses beginning with Then again and ending with

original: zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni rigs drug la gzigs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni rigs drug la gzigs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
translated: are the verses on the vision of the six families.

original: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing zhes pa la sogs pa nas aa ra pa tsa n'a ya te na ma: zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rim pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing zhes pa la sogs pa nas aa ra pa tsa n'a ya te na ma: zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rim pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo //
translated: The three verses beginning with The field endowed with the six kings of mantra and ending with I pay homage to the one who is in Arsha are the verses on the stage of perfect enlightenment by the net of illusion.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa nas theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhi'o //🔽sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che zhes pa la sogs pa nas rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa che zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes la bstod pa rkang pas dman pa'i tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa nas theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhi'o // sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che zhes pa la sogs pa nas rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa che zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes la bstod pa rkang pas dman pa'i tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa
translated: Thus, the fourteen verses from “The Blessed Buddha” up to “The supreme vehicle” are the praise of the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm.🔽The twenty-four verses from “The great Buddha Vairocana” up to “The great vajra hook and noose” are the praise of the wisdom of the extremely pure realm of phenomena, with one verse lacking a line.

original: lnga'o // rdo rje 'jigs byed 'jigs par byed ces pa la sogs pa nas sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bstod pa rkang pas lhag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu'o //
analyzed: lnga'o // rdo rje 'jigs byed 'jigs par byed ces pa la sogs pa nas sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bstod pa rkang pas lhag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu'o //
translated: The ten verses from “The vajra-frightening frightener” up to “The supreme among those with sound” are the praise of mirror-like wisdom, with one verse having an extra line.

original: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid ces pa la sogs pa nas ye shes me lce 'od rab gsal zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis so ;
analyzed: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid ces pa la sogs pa nas ye shes me lce 'od rab gsal zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis so ;
translated: The praise of discerning pristine awareness is the forty-two verses from “The suchness of the utterly pure selflessness” up to “The flame of pristine awareness, shining with light.”

original: /'dod pa'i don grub dam pa ste zhes pa la sogs pa nas nor bu chen po rin chen tog ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: /'dod pa'i don grub dam pa ste zhes pa la sogs pa nas nor bu chen po rin chen tog ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The praise of the pristine awareness of equality is the twenty-four verses from “The supreme accomplishment of the desired aim” up to “The great jewel, the crest jewel.”

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rtogs bya ba zhes pa la sogs pa nas 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog ces pa'i mthar thug ba ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa bcva lnga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rtogs bya ba zhes pa la sogs pa nas 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog ces pa'i mthar thug ba ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa bcva lnga'o //
translated: The praise of the pristine awareness of successful activities is the fifteen verses from “The realization of all buddhas” up to “Mañjuśrī, the most glorious of the glorious.”

original: mchog sbyin rdo rje mchog khyod 'dud ces pa la sogs pa nas ye shes sku nyid khyod la 'dud ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni /
analyzed: mchog sbyin rdo rje mchog khyod 'dud ces pa la sogs pa nas ye shes sku nyid khyod la 'dud ces pa'i mthar thug pa ni /
translated: The praise of the pristine awareness of the realm of reality is the twenty-one verses from “Homage to you, O Teacher, the best of teachers” up to “Homage to you, O embodiment of pristine awareness.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ye shes kyi bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ye shes kyi bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
translated: The five verses of praise to the five exalted wisdoms of the tathagatas.

original: tshigs su bcad pa brgya drug cu rtsa gnyis po 'di rnams kyi theg pa thams cad las phyung nas bcom ldan 'das kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa'i snying po kun du bzang po mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa kun
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa brgya drug cu rtsa gnyis po 'di rnams kyi theg pa thams cad las phyung nas bcom ldan 'das kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa'i snying po kun du bzang po mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa kun
translated: These one hundred and sixty-two verses were extracted from all the vehicles and offered to the heart of the bhagavān vajra holder, Samantabhadra, the supreme unchanging great bliss, the one who pervades the whole realm of space,

original: nas snang bar byed pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa zab cing rgya che ba'i gzugs @265b 'chang ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba thog ma dang tham med pa bdag dang bdag gi ba'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par
analyzed: nas snang bar byed pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa zab cing rgya che ba'i gzugs @265b 'chang ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba thog ma dang tham med pa bdag dang bdag gi ba'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par
translated: the one who is the accumulation of the wisdom of pure appearance, the one who holds the form of the profound and vast, the one who is naturally luminous, the one who is without beginning or end, the one who is free from the concepts of self and other, the one who is free from the concepts of subject and object, and so on.

original: rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba dus thams cad pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mkhyen pa 'khor ba'i bag chags las rnam par grol ba 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bral ba spros pa med pa'i ngo bo rang gi🔽ngang gis 'jug cing 'phel ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs sna tshogs pa rnams kyi rten bum pa bzang po dang dpag bsam gyi shing dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa thub pa chen po
analyzed: rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba dus thams cad pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mkhyen pa 'khor ba'i bag chags las rnam par grol ba 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bral ba spros pa med pa'i ngo bo rang gi ngang gis 'jug cing 'phel ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs sna tshogs pa rnams kyi rten bum pa bzang po dang dpag bsam gyi shing dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa thub pa chen po
translated: It is free of the stains of conceptual thought, it is present at all times, it is free of defilement, it is the knowledge of the nature of all phenomena, it is free of the habitual tendencies of samsara, it is free of coming and going, it is the nature of the absence of conceptual elaborations, it is the support for the various kinds of concentration and powers of retention that arise and increase naturally, and it is like a fine vase, a wish-fulfilling tree and a wish-fulfilling gem in fulfilling the wishes of all sentient beings.🔽🔽

original: rnams kyi yang spyod yul ma yin pa sems can gyi phung po chen po mchog tu zhi bar mdzad pa sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu gzugs brnyan lta bu sgra brnyan lta bu ste /
analyzed: rnams kyi yang spyod yul ma yin pa sems can gyi phung po chen po mchog tu zhi bar mdzad pa sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu gzugs brnyan lta bu sgra brnyan lta bu ste /
translated: It is free from the stains of conceptual thoughts, it is present at all times, it is free from defilements, it knows the nature of all phenomena, it is free from the habitual tendencies of samsara, it is free from coming and going, it is the nature free from conceptual elaborations, it is the support for the various kinds of concentration and powers of retention that naturally engage and increase, it is like a wish-fulfilling gem, a wish-granting tree, or a vase of plenty that fulfills the wishes of all sentient beings, it is the domain of the great sages, it is the pacification of the great mass of sentient beings, it is like an illusion, like a dream, like a reflection, like an echo.

original: srid pa gsum gyis mchod par bya ba rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes rang gi rig pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba 'di nyid ni rnal 'byor pas dor bar mi bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyis mchod par bya ba rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes rang gi rig pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba 'di nyid ni rnal 'byor pas dor bar mi bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This very supreme unchanging bliss of the yogin’s self-awareness, the wisdom to be worshipped by the three worlds, should not be abandoned by the yogin. This is the definitive statement of the Tathāgata.

original: 'di bsgom pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i ye shes kyi le'u las de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di bsgom pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i ye shes kyi le'u las de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The cultivation of this is taught by the Tathāgata in the Wisdom Chapter of the Root Tantra of the King:

original: du ba la sogs bsgom byas shing //
analyzed: du ba la sogs bsgom byas shing //
translated: Having cultivated the meditation on smoke and so forth,

original: sems ni g-yo ba med byas te //
analyzed: sems ni g-yo ba med byas te //
translated: and made the mind unmoving,

original: dbu ma sbyang ba byas nas ni //
analyzed: dbu ma sbyang ba byas nas ni //
translated: having purified the central channel,

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur bsgom par bya //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur bsgom par bya //
translated: one should cultivate the supreme unchanging.

original: padmar rdo rje rab bkod nas //
analyzed: padmar rdo rje rab bkod nas //
translated: Having arranged the vajra in the lotus,

original: srog ni thig ler gzhug par bya //
analyzed: srog ni thig ler gzhug par bya //
translated: one should enter the life-force into the drop.

original: 'khor lo thig le thig le yi //
analyzed: 'khor lo thig le thig le yi //
translated: The drop of the wheel, the drop of the drop,

original: g-yo ba rdo rjer dgag par bya //
analyzed: g-yo ba rdo rjer dgag par bya //
translated: the movement should be blocked in the vajra.

original: rtag tu rtag rengs rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: rtag tu rtag rengs rnal 'byor pas //
translated: The yogin should always be constantly rigid,

original: rtag tu steng du khu bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu steng du khu bar 'gyur //
translated: always above, the semen will be.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the practice of the great seal,

original: rdo rje 'bebs pas byin gyis brlabs //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bebs pas byin gyis brlabs //
translated: blessed by the vajra descent.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur skad cig ni //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur skad cig ni //
translated: The supreme unchanging instant🔽is the great king, complete with twenty-one

original: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang // drug brgya rdzogs pas rgyal po che //
analyzed: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang // drug brgya rdzogs pas rgyal po che //
translated: thousand and six hundred.

original: rdo rje sems dpar rang nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpar rang nyid 'gyur //
translated: You will become Vajrasattva yourself.

original: zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i ye shes kyi le'u yi rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa dang pos mya ngan las 'das pa mtshan ma med par gsungs pa 'di lta ste //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i ye shes kyi le'u yi rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa dang pos mya ngan las 'das pa mtshan ma med par gsungs pa 'di lta ste //
translated: And in the first verse of the five-part praise in the chapter on wisdom in the king of tantras, the Bhagavān says that nirvāṇa is signless:🔽Where there is no beginning, end, or middle, no place, death, existence, sound, smell, taste,

original: bu med cing 'ching dang grol dang byed po med //
analyzed: bu med cing 'ching dang grol dang byed po med //

analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa mtshan ma med cing byed pa rnam bral yon tan med pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to nirvana, which is signless, free from action, and devoid of qualities.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje ste thabs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje ste thabs so //

original: de nyid las tshigs su bcad pa lnga pas shes rab mtshan ma med par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid las tshigs su bcad pa lnga pas shes rab mtshan ma med par gsungs pa /

original: gcig dang du ma dag kyang gcig cing mnyam dang mi mnyam pa yang mnyam pa g-yas g-yon mdun rgyab dang // steng 'og kun nas dkar ljang sna tshogs kha dog chen po gcig gi gzugs te thung du ring po dang // shin tu ring po yon tan med ces yon tan dang bcas bud med skyes pa'ang skyes pa bud med min //

translated: One and many are one, and equal and unequal are equal, right and left, front and back, above and below, all around, white and green, various, and of one great color, short and long, and very long, devoid of qualities and endowed with qualities, female and male are neither female nor male.

analyzed: gang zhig kun gyi rten gcig bha ga bzang mo mchog gi bha ga khyod la 'dud de khyod la 'dud ces pa //

analyzed: sems dpa' ni padma dang shes rab ste de ltar rdo rje sems dpa'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i ye shes kyi le'u las gsungs pa /

original: chu skyes rdo rje shes rab thabs //
analyzed: chu skyes rdo rje shes rab thabs //

original: rten dang brten par brjod pa ste //
analyzed: rten dang brten par brjod pa ste //

original: de dag gnyis ni snyoms zhugs pa //
analyzed: de dag gnyis ni snyoms zhugs pa //

analyzed: rdo rje rnal 'byor rnam bzhi pa //

analyzed: dus 'khor de la phyag 'tshal bdag / ka l'a par ni sprul pa'i rgyal //

analyzed: pad dkar chu skyes 'dzin rang nyid //

original: ces pa'o // bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa zhes bya ba'i mdor bsdus chen po ste gsum pa'o /

translated: This concludes the third great summary called “The Attainment of Supreme Unchanging Wisdom” from the Stainless Light, a commentary on the Condensed Tantra of the Glorious Kālacakra, the King of Tantras, which is an explanation of the twelve branches of the tantra.

original: // / stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga dang // thig le stong pa 'gyur med drug la //
analyzed: // / stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga dang // thig le stong pa 'gyur med drug la //

original: btud nas aa sogs ka sogs rnams kyi //
analyzed: btud nas aa sogs ka sogs rnams kyi //
translated: Having bowed to the vowels a, etc. and the consonants ka, etc.

original: dbugs kyi grangs ni dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbugs kyi grangs ni dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: I will explain the enumeration of the vital airs.

original: li sogs zhes pa la sogs pa la 'dir li yig la sogs pa dbyangs brgyad po gang dag dbyangs phyed kyis ni rnam par dman pa rnams yul dang yon tan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: li sogs zhes pa la sogs pa la 'dir li yig la sogs pa dbyangs brgyad po gang dag dbyangs phyed kyis ni rnam par dman pa rnams yul dang yon tan du gyur pa ste /

original: li ni dri'i yon tan du gyur pa dang au ni gzugs kyi yon tan du gyur pa dang ri ni ro'i yon tan du gyur pa dang ai ni reg bya'i yon tan du gyur pa dang @266b aa ni sgra'i yon tan du gyur pa dang aam ni snying
analyzed: li ni dri'i yon tan du gyur pa dang au ni gzugs kyi yon tan du gyur pa dang ri ni ro'i yon tan du gyur pa dang ai ni reg bya'i yon tan du gyur pa dang @266b aa ni sgra'i yon tan du gyur pa dang aam ni snying
translated: Li is the quality of smell, u is the quality of form, ri is the quality of taste, i is the quality of touch, a is the quality of sound, aṃ is the quality of the heart,

analyzed: stobs kyi yon tan du gyur pa dang aa: ni rdul gyi yon tan du gyur pa dang a'am ni mun pa'i yon tan du gyur pa ste shin tu ring po'o //

analyzed: gzhom du med pa phyed kyi dbyangs ni ha zhes pa ste 'dis dman pa rnams ni phyed dang bcas pa bdun no //

analyzed: de ltar dbyangs phyed kyis ni rnam par dman pa de rnams phan tshun dbye bas phye ba zhes pa ni so sor phyed dang bcas pa bdun gyi dbye bas phye ba ste kun 'byung gi bden pas bsgyur pa de rnams thams cad rkang pa dang bcas pa lnga
translated: Those differentiated by the division of seven individual half tones, all of them transformed by the truth of origin, are fifty-six with their feet.

analyzed: bcu rtsa drug tu 'gyur te rkang pa dang ro dang mda' rnams zhes so //

translated: Those short ones also arise from the zodiacs of Aries and so on, in the exhalations of the central channel of a child, and then they move correctly in the mandala of the left channel.

analyzed: ring po rnams kyang de bzhin du dus sbyor gnyis pa glang la sogs pa mnyam pa la dang po skyes pa'i dbu ma'i dbugs 'bab pa rnams so //

original: 'dir gal te li la sogs pa gsungs pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: 'dir gal te li la sogs pa gsungs pa de lta na yang /

translated: Here, the life force should be grasped by the correspondences of the elements of space, and so on, and earth, and so on, by the rules of the five qualities, and so on, of the navel, and so on, in the unequal and equal transits by the divisions of short and long.

original: // slar yang thun mtshams gsum pa la ni shin tu ring po yul dang yon tan dbu ma'i dbugs rnams 'bab ces pa ni /
analyzed: // slar yang thun mtshams gsum pa la ni shin tu ring po yul dang yon tan dbu ma'i dbugs rnams 'bab ces pa ni /

original: 'dir gal te 'pho ba'i dus su byis pa skyes par gyur na de'i tshe dbu ma la srog shin tu ring por gyur nas g-yon dang g-yas la yang dag par rgyu ste 'di rnams sngar brjod pa'i yi ge thams cad kyi yang dag par rgyu bar rig par

translated: Here, if a child is born at the time of the transit, then at that time the life force in the central [channel] becomes very long, and it moves correctly in the left and right [channels]. These should be understood as the correct movements of all the syllables mentioned previously.

original: bya'o // 'dir li yig gi dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bya'o // 'dir li yig gi dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du ring po dang shin tu ring po rnams kyang rig par bya ste phan tshun dbye ba rnams kyis so //

analyzed: da ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dbugs kyi dbyangs rnams gsungs pa ka la sogs pa'i yi ge zhes pa ste ka tsa ta pa ta sa drug po rnams kyi ka yig la sogs pa'i yi ge sum cu po rnams ni sum cu'i rab tu dbye bas rab
translated: ca, ṭa, ta, pa, ya, and sa🔽are clearly distinguished🔽into nine hundred by the thirty divisions.

analyzed: tu gsal bar dgu brgya nyid du 'gyur te yi ge re re la yang phan tshun yang dag par sbyar ba'i dbye bas sum cur 'gyur ro //

analyzed: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du kha la sogs pa rnams rig par bya ste rab tu gsal bar dgu brgya nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it should be known that the ka and so on are clearly distinguished into nine hundred.

original: slar yang dgu brgya po de rnams dbyangs drug gi ni dbye ba zhes pa ni aa ai ri au li aam zhes pa 'di rnams kyis phye ba mkha' mkha' dus dang mda' rnams zhes pa brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur te dus sbyor gsum gyi rtsa gsum
analyzed: slar yang dgu brgya po de rnams dbyangs drug gi ni dbye ba zhes pa ni aa ai ri au li aam zhes pa 'di rnams kyis phye ba mkha' mkha' dus dang mda' rnams zhes pa brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur te dus sbyor gsum gyi rtsa gsum
translated: Again, those nine hundred are divided by the six long vowels, that is, by a, i, r, u, l, and am, making fifty-four hundred.

translated: The three nāḍīs of the three junctions are from midnight until sunrise.🔽Then, the divisions by the six long vowels are from sunrise until noon, and the previous number of vāyu and syllables are for the three nāḍīs of the three junctions.

original: slar yang thung du'i dbyangs drug dag gis phye ba rnams ni nyi ma gung nas mtshan mo'i dus te de la nyi ma nub pa'i mthar thug par dus sbyor gsum gyi rtsa gsum la grangs sngar bzhin no //

translated: Again, the divisions by the six short vowels are from noon until midnight, and the previous number of vāyus and syllables are for the three nāḍīs of the three junctions.

original: de bzhin du mtshan mo'i phyi ma'i cha la mtshan mo phyed ji srid par dus sbyor gsum gyi rtsa gsum la dbyangs dang bcas pa snga ma'i grangs rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan mo'i phyi ma'i cha la mtshan mo phyed ji srid par dus sbyor gsum gyi rtsa gsum la dbyangs dang bcas pa snga ma'i grangs rnams so //
translated: Likewise, in the latter part of the night, for as long as the night is half over, the three nāḍīs of the three junctures are endowed with vowels, the former number.

original: de ltar nyin zhag so so'i dus su dbugs ni 'byung dang 'jug pa mkha' mkha' drug dang zla ba mig rnams 'bab ces pa ni drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig go //

translated: Thus, in each day and night, the vāyu that moves in the space of the six spaces, the moon, and the eyes is said to be twenty-one thousand and six hundred.

original: 'di rnams kyi dbus nas snga ma stong pa rnams bsdus nas ni mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod par dbu ma dag la sbyar bar bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi dbus nas snga ma stong pa rnams bsdus nas ni mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod par dbu ma dag la sbyar bar bya zhes pa ni /
translated: From among those, the former empty ones are gathered in the middle and applied to the central nāḍīs, both in the even and uneven.

original: 'dir sngar brjod pa'i dkyil 'khor so so la rkang pa dang bcas pa'i bcu gcig ste de rnams kyang @267b chu srin la sogs pa'i dbye bas dkyil 'khor so so'i mthar da yig la sogs pa'i dbye bas dbu ma dag la sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa'i spros pa
analyzed: 'dir sngar brjod pa'i dkyil 'khor so so la rkang pa dang bcas pa'i bcu gcig ste de rnams kyang @267b chu srin la sogs pa'i dbye bas dkyil 'khor so so'i mthar da yig la sogs pa'i dbye bas dbu ma dag la sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa'i spros pa
translated: Here, the eleven with the legs, previously mentioned, are in each maṇḍala. Also, those are applied to the central nāḍīs, both in the even and uneven, by the divisions of the maṇḍala, such as Meṣa, and so on, by the divisions of the da, and so on.🔽The elaboration is as follows:

original: chen po 'di ni mang ba nyid kyi phyir ma bris te mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyas 'grel zla ba bzang pos mdzad pa'i stong phrag drug cu pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chen po 'di ni mang ba nyid kyi phyir ma bris te mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyas 'grel zla ba bzang pos mdzad pa'i stong phrag drug cu pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: This great one is not written because of its abundance, but it should be known from the sixty-thousand-verse commentary on the Supreme Original Buddha composed by Sucandra.

original: gang gis rab tu 'bad par bya ba 'dis 'jig rten las 'das par byed pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te aa sogs ka sogs 'di ni ba spu dang skra'i grangs ji snyed par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gis rab tu 'bad par bya ba 'dis 'jig rten las 'das par byed pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te aa sogs ka sogs 'di ni ba spu dang skra'i grangs ji snyed par 'byung ngo //
translated: By this exertion, there is not the slightest bit of supramundane activity, and this a-ādi, ka-ādi occurs as many times as there are body hairs and head hairs.

original: da ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bdun po rnams kyi phyi ma brgyad pa'i phyed gang yin pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bdun po rnams kyi phyi ma brgyad pa'i phyed gang yin pa de gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the latter half of the eighth of the seven and a half is stated:

original: phyi rol zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir phyi rol du ni zhes pa 'jig rten gyi khams su gang zhig chu tshod brgyad pa'i phyed kyi dbyangs su gyur pa sgra gcan longs spyod dag las gzhan du gnas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir phyi rol du ni zhes pa 'jig rten gyi khams su gang zhig chu tshod brgyad pa'i phyed kyi dbyangs su gyur pa sgra gcan longs spyod dag las gzhan du gnas zhes pa ste /
translated: External, etc. Here, external means in the world-realm, that which becomes the vowel of the eighth hour, Rāhu, abides elsewhere than the enjoyments.

original: 'dir sgra gcan gyis zla ba so so'i dus la yul lnga'i mtshan nyid chu tshod lnga dang de bzhin du snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i mtshan nyid gsum ste khyim gyi 'khor lo'i dbus nas de rnams longs spyod cing de rnams las phyed dang bcas pa'i bdun
analyzed: 'dir sgra gcan gyis zla ba so so'i dus la yul lnga'i mtshan nyid chu tshod lnga dang de bzhin du snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i mtshan nyid gsum ste khyim gyi 'khor lo'i dbus nas de rnams longs spyod cing de rnams las phyed dang bcas pa'i bdun
translated: Here, Rāhu enjoys the characteristics of the five objects for five hours each month, and similarly the three characteristics of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: ni longs spyod do //
analyzed: ni longs spyod do //
translated: From the center of the wheel of the houses, he enjoys these seven and a half hours.

original: chu tshod phyed ni longs spyod par mi nus te /
analyzed: chu tshod phyed ni longs spyod par mi nus te /
translated: He cannot enjoy half an hour.

original: de ni sgra gcan longs spyod dag las gzhan du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sgra gcan longs spyod dag las gzhan du gnas pa'o //
translated: He is in a place other than the enjoyment of Rāhu.

original: de ni rang gi lus la dbugs phyed de ma skyes pa'i byis pa'i lte ba dang dpral ba dag gi dbus su dbyug pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rang gi lus la dbugs phyed de ma skyes pa'i byis pa'i lte ba dang dpral ba dag gi dbus su dbyug pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: In his own body, he is half a breath, in the middle of the navel and forehead of an unborn child, in the form of a stick.

original: phyi rol du 'byung ba mid pa'i phyir dbugs phyed du brjod do //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'byung ba mid pa'i phyir dbugs phyed du brjod do //
translated: Because he swallows the exhalation outside, he is called half a breath.

original: sngags kyi dbye bas ni dbyangs phyed do //
analyzed: sngags kyi dbye bas ni dbyangs phyed do //
translated: By the division of mantra, he is half a vowel.

original: de ni nges par mun pa dang bral 'jig rten thams cad snang ba ste mngal ni zla ba drug la mngon par shes pa lnga'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nges par mun pa dang bral 'jig rten thams cad snang ba ste mngal ni zla ba drug la mngon par shes pa lnga'i phyir ro //
translated: That is certainly free from darkness, the illumination of the entire world, the womb for six months, because of the five superknowledges.

original: snga ma phyed ni mun pa dang bcas srid pa gsum po mtha' dag stong pa gang du thim pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma phyed ni mun pa dang bcas srid pa gsum po mtha' dag stong pa gang du thim pa'o //
translated: The first half is with darkness, the three existences, where everything dissolves into emptiness.

original: shi ba'i mthar bzhi pa bor nas shin tu gnyid log pa la zla ba drug gi bar du 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: shi ba'i mthar bzhi pa bor nas shin tu gnyid log pa la zla ba drug gi bar du 'jug par byed do //
translated: At the end of death, having discarded the fourth, one should enter into deep sleep for six months.

original: de nas rmi lam gyi gnas skabs thob pa'i mngal ni phyi ma'i dbyangs phyed la 'jug go //
analyzed: de nas rmi lam gyi gnas skabs thob pa'i mngal ni phyi ma'i dbyangs phyed la 'jug go //
translated: Then, having attained the state of dream, one should enter into the womb for the latter half of the vowels.

original: de'i phyir de mun pa'i gnas skabs phye nas snying por 'jug la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de mun pa'i gnas skabs phye nas snying por 'jug la /
translated: Therefore, having opened the state of darkness, one should enter into the heart.

original: mun pa bral ba lte ba'i 'khor lo la gnas pa ni dus kyi 'khor @268a * //
analyzed: mun pa bral ba lte ba'i 'khor lo la gnas pa ni dus kyi 'khor @268a * //
translated: Free from darkness, abiding in the navel cakra, is the sole possessor of the yoga of the Kālacakra.

original: lo'i rnal 'byor ldan pa gcig pu ste srog gi rlung bkag pa'i phyir snying po'i gnas skabs su song ba zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: lo'i rnal 'byor ldan pa gcig pu ste srog gi rlung bkag pa'i phyir snying po'i gnas skabs su song ba zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Because the life-force wind is blocked, one has gone to the state of the heart. This is the completion of the yoga of the yogis.

original: da ni skyes pa'i byis pa rnams kyi cha nyams pa la sogs pa gsungs pa zla ba dman zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du nang la'o //
analyzed: da ni skyes pa'i byis pa rnams kyi cha nyams pa la sogs pa gsungs pa zla ba dman zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du nang la'o //
translated: Now, the deficiency of the child who is born, etc., is stated: “The moon is deficient, etc.” Here, as with the external, so with the internal.

original: nyin zhag so sor zla ba'i tshes ni chu tshod drug cur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyin zhag so sor zla ba'i tshes ni chu tshod drug cur mi 'gyur te /
translated: The lunar day does not complete sixty minutes in each day.

original: chu tshod gcig gis dman zhing de yang nang du khu ba'i'o //
analyzed: chu tshod gcig gis dman zhing de yang nang du khu ba'i'o //
translated: It is deficient by one minute, and that is the internal one.

original: nyi mar lhag gang zhes pa ni nyi ma'i longs spyod la ste nang gi le'u las sngar brjod pa'i chu tshod gnyis so //
analyzed: nyi mar lhag gang zhes pa ni nyi ma'i longs spyod la ste nang gi le'u las sngar brjod pa'i chu tshod gnyis so //
translated: “The sun is in excess” is in the enjoyment of the sun, which is two minutes as stated previously in the internal chapter.

original: khyab bdag ces pa ni byang chub kyi sems te de'i mchog gi cha ye shes kyi chos can ma ni zla ba'i cha nyams pa'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag ces pa ni byang chub kyi sems te de'i mchog gi cha ye shes kyi chos can ma ni zla ba'i cha nyams pa'o //
translated: The “lord” is the bodhisattva, and the deficiency of his portion is the deficiency of the portion of the moon, which is the subject of the knowledge portion.

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos can ma ni nyi ma'i longs spyod nyams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos can ma ni nyi ma'i longs spyod nyams pa'o //
translated: The deficiency of the enjoyment of the sun is the subject of consciousness.

original: de 'dir ni thun mtshams bzhi la ste thun dang thun la nyin dang mtshan mo'i dbang gis bgrod cing dus sbyor phyed pa'i rab tu dbye ba yis /
analyzed: de 'dir ni thun mtshams bzhi la ste thun dang thun la nyin dang mtshan mo'i dbang gis bgrod cing dus sbyor phyed pa'i rab tu dbye ba yis /
translated: Here, they are in the four periods, in the periods, by day and by night, by the division of the half-periods.

original: sum cu rtsa drug dus kyi pho nya zhes pa ni 'khor lo gsum gyi sdom pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams te de rnams rigs ldan ma'i sbyor ba la thun mtshams kyi dbye ba dang / thun tshod kyi dbye ba dang dus sbyor byed pa'i dbye bas yang dag par rgyu'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug dus kyi pho nya zhes pa ni 'khor lo gsum gyi sdom pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams te de rnams rigs ldan ma'i sbyor ba la thun mtshams kyi dbye ba dang / thun tshod kyi dbye ba dang dus sbyor byed pa'i dbye bas yang dag par rgyu'o //
translated: The thirty-six are the messengers of time, the dakinis of the three wheels' binding. They move correctly by the division of the periods, by the division of the periods, and by the division of the half-periods, in union with the yoginis.

original: phyi rol du longs spyod dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa dang bdag po nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du nang du ste nyi ma 'char ba'i dbye ba dang srog 'byung ba'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: phyi rol du longs spyod dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa dang bdag po nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du nang du ste nyi ma 'char ba'i dbye ba dang srog 'byung ba'i dbye bas so //
translated: Just as externally there is enjoyment, dissolution, domination, and ownership, so also internally, by the division of the sun's rising and the division of the life-force's arising.

original: 'dir phyi rol du gling bzhi rnams las gang du nyi ma 'char ba der longs spyod pa dang gang du mtshan mo phyed pa der thim pa dang gang du nyin mo phyed pa der dbang byed pa dang gang du nyi ma nub pa der bdag po'o //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du gling bzhi rnams las gang du nyi ma 'char ba der longs spyod pa dang gang du mtshan mo phyed pa der thim pa dang gang du nyin mo phyed pa der dbang byed pa dang gang du nyi ma nub pa der bdag po'o //
translated: Here, of the four continents, where the sun rises is the enjoyment, where it is midnight is the dissolution, where it is noon is the domination, and where it sets is the ownership.

original: rigs ldan ma mtshan mo rab tu zhugs pa nas mtshan phyed kyi bar ni rnal 'byor pa'i longs spyod do //
analyzed: rigs ldan ma mtshan mo rab tu zhugs pa nas mtshan phyed kyi bar ni rnal 'byor pa'i longs spyod do //
translated: The night of the yoginī is from the beginning of the night until midnight, which is the enjoyment of the yogin.

original: nyi ma shar nas nyi ma gung gi bar ni dge slong rnams kyi longs spyod de nyin mo'i dus su'o //
analyzed: nyi ma shar nas nyi ma gung gi bar ni dge slong rnams kyi longs spyod de nyin mo'i dus su'o //
translated: From sunrise until noon is the enjoyment of the monks, which is the daytime.

original: des na nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can //
analyzed: des na nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can //
translated: Therefore, the day is the enjoyment of the Bhagavān Vajrī.

original: mtshan mo shes rab longs spyod slad ces pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo shes rab longs spyod slad ces pa nges pa'o //
translated: The night is for the enjoyment of wisdom.

original: des na nyi ma shar nas nyi ma gung gi bar du dge slong rnams kyi sha dang bral ba'i zas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na nyi ma shar nas nyi ma gung gi bar du dge slong rnams kyi sha dang bral ba'i zas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, from sunrise until noon, the monks should eat food that is free of meat.

original: nyi ma nub nas nam phyed kyi bar du rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis dam tshig gi mchod ston bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma nub nas nam phyed kyi bar du rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis dam tshig gi mchod ston bya'o //
translated: From sunset until midnight, the yoginīs and yogins should perform the feast of the sacred pledge.

original: de las 'das na nyan thos dang sngags pa'i sdom pa nyams pa ste de nyams pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul dang dngos grub nyams @268b so ;🔽/ de ltar thun mtshams kyi dbye bas rnal 'byor ma bzhi po rnams kyi longs spyod pa dang thim pa la sogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du thun tshod kyi dbye bas dur khrod kyi rnal 'byor ma brgyad po rnams kyi ste mtshan mo phyed nas nyi
analyzed: de las 'das na nyan thos dang sngags pa'i sdom pa nyams pa ste de nyams pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul dang dngos grub nyams @268b so ; / de ltar thun mtshams kyi dbye bas rnal 'byor ma bzhi po rnams kyi longs spyod pa dang thim pa la sogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du thun tshod kyi dbye bas dur khrod kyi rnal 'byor ma brgyad po rnams kyi ste mtshan mo phyed nas nyi
translated: If one transgresses that, the vows of the śrāvakas and the vows of the mantrins are damaged. Because of the damage to those, the magical powers and the spiritual powers are damaged.

original: ma gung gi bar du lugs dang mthun pas shar dang lho dang nub dang / byang rnams su thun tshod bzhi'i dbye ba rnams la yang dag par rgyu'o //
analyzed: ma gung gi bar du lugs dang mthun pas shar dang lho dang nub dang / byang rnams su thun tshod bzhi'i dbye ba rnams la yang dag par rgyu'o //
translated: In that way, just as the enjoyment, dissolution, and so forth of the four yoginīs are in accordance with the divisions of the periods, in the same way, the enjoyment, dissolution, and so forth of the eight yoginīs of the charnel grounds are in accordance with the divisions of the periods. From midnight until noon, in the four periods, they move in an easterly direction, in accordance with the natural order, in the east, south, west, and north.

original: nyi ma gung nas mtshan mo phyed kyi mthar thug par lugs dang mi mthun pas dbang ldan dang rlung dang bden bral dang me'i phyogs rnams su'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gung nas mtshan mo phyed kyi mthar thug par lugs dang mi mthun pas dbang ldan dang rlung dang bden bral dang me'i phyogs rnams su'o //
translated: Brahma, and Fire.

original: de bzhin du dus sbyor phyed pa'i dbye ba ste thugs kyi 'khor lo la sdig pa dang gzhu'i dus sbyor phyed pa'i dbye bas bzhi po rnams g-yas skor gyis yang dag par rgyu zhing chu srin dang bum pa g-yon skor gyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus sbyor phyed pa'i dbye ba ste thugs kyi 'khor lo la sdig pa dang gzhu'i dus sbyor phyed pa'i dbye bas bzhi po rnams g-yas skor gyis yang dag par rgyu zhing chu srin dang bum pa g-yon skor gyis so //
translated: Similarly, the half-periods are divided into four by the division of the half-periods of Scorpio and Sagittarius, and they move clockwise in the wheel of the mind, and Aquarius and Pisces move counterclockwise.

original: de bzhin du gsung gi 'khor lo la nya dang lug dang glang dang 'khrig pa'i phyed kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung gi 'khor lo la nya dang lug dang glang dang 'khrig pa'i phyed kyi dbye bas so //
translated: Similarly, in the wheel of speech, they move by the division of the half-periods of Pisces, Aries, Taurus, and Gemini.

original: de bzhin du sku'i 'khor lo la karkata dang seng ge dang bu mo dang srang gi dbye bas yang dag par rgyu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sku'i 'khor lo la karkata dang seng ge dang bu mo dang srang gi dbye bas yang dag par rgyu'o //
translated: Similarly, in the wheel of the body, they move by the division of Cancer, Leo, Virgo, and Libra.

original: srog gi dbye bas pho nya mo sum cu rtsa drug gi yang dag par rgyu ba ste de rnams kyang dus kyi pho nya mo'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbye bas pho nya mo sum cu rtsa drug gi yang dag par rgyu ba ste de rnams kyang dus kyi pho nya mo'o //
translated: The movement of the thirty-six messengers by the division of the life-breath is also the messengers of time.

original: de bzhin du 'khor lo sdom pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor lo sdom pa las gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, the Cakrasaṃvara Tantra says:

original: dbu ma mchog gi dbugs dang ni //
analyzed: dbu ma mchog gi dbugs dang ni //
translated: With the supreme central channel

original: dri dang chu dang ldan pa yis //
analyzed: dri dang chu dang ldan pa yis //
translated: and with feces, urine, and so on,

original: rigs ldan ma ni rtag mchod bya //
analyzed: rigs ldan ma ni rtag mchod bya //
translated: the yoginī should always be worshipped.🔽In particular, the messenger at the special time🔽is worshipped with the thirty-six messengers.

original: khyad par dus la pho nya mo zhes pa la 'dir bshang ba dang gci ba dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i rtsa 'gog pa dang mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde bas rigs ldan ma ste rdo rje phag mo mchod par bya zhing brjod pa'i khyad par gyi dus
analyzed: khyad par dus la pho nya mo zhes pa la 'dir bshang ba dang gci ba dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i rtsa 'gog pa dang mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde bas rigs ldan ma ste rdo rje phag mo mchod par bya zhing brjod pa'i khyad par gyi dus
translated: Here, the yoginī, Vajravārāhī, is worshipped with feces, urine, and so on, and with the supreme unchanging bliss that stops the channels of the moon and sun.

original: kyi pho nya mo sum cu rtsa drug rnams mchod par bya ste srog yang dag par rgyu bas phyi rol dang nang du'o //
analyzed: kyi pho nya mo sum cu rtsa drug rnams mchod par bya ste srog yang dag par rgyu bas phyi rol dang nang du'o //
translated: The thirty-six special messengers at the special time are worshipped by the movement of the life-force externally and internally.

original: 'dir lte ba'i 'khor lo'i zlum skor dang po la 'dab ma bzhi ste de rnams las shar gyi 'dab ma ni bdag gi gdan dang lho ni gzhan gyi gdan dang / nub ni sngags kyi gdan dang byang ni de kho na nyid kyi gdan no //
analyzed: 'dir lte ba'i 'khor lo'i zlum skor dang po la 'dab ma bzhi ste de rnams las shar gyi 'dab ma ni bdag gi gdan dang lho ni gzhan gyi gdan dang / nub ni sngags kyi gdan dang byang ni de kho na nyid kyi gdan no //
translated: Here, the first circle of the navel cakra has four petals. Among them, the eastern petal is the seat of self, the southern petal is the seat of other, the western petal is the seat of mantra, and the northern petal is the seat of reality.

original: de bzhin du kha'i sgo ni rtse mos 'bigs pa'i dur khrod de shar du'o //🔽sna bug g-yas pa ni ro bsreg pa ste lhor ro //🔽thur sel gyi sgo ni rnag gi dri ste nub tu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha'i sgo ni rtse mos 'bigs pa'i dur khrod de shar du'o // sna bug g-yas pa ni ro bsreg pa ste lhor ro // thur sel gyi sgo ni rnag gi dri ste nub tu'o //
translated: Likewise, the mouth is the charnel ground of piercing with the peak, in the east.🔽The right nostril is the cremation ground, in the south.🔽The anus is the charnel ground of putrid smell, in the west.

original: sna bug g-yon pa ni rul pa ste byang du'o //
analyzed: sna bug g-yon pa ni rul pa ste byang du'o //
translated: The left nostril is the charnel ground of decay, in the north.

original: de bzhin du rna ba g-yon pa ni byis pa shi ba ste dbang ldan du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba g-yon pa ni byis pa shi ba ste dbang ldan du'o //
translated: Likewise, the left ear is the charnel ground of the death of a child, in the northeast.

original: rna ba g-yas pa ni drag po'i g-yul te bden bral du'o //
analyzed: rna ba g-yas pa ni drag po'i g-yul te bden bral du'o //
translated: The right ear is the charnel ground of violent battle, in the southwest.

original: mig g-yas pa ni sprul gyis zos pa ste @269a * //
analyzed: mig g-yas pa ni sprul gyis zos pa ste @269a * //
translated: The right eye is the charnel ground of being eaten by a snake,

original: rlung du'o // mig g-yon pa ni lhag ma can te mer ro //
analyzed: rlung du'o // mig g-yon pa ni lhag ma can te mer ro //
translated: in the west. The left eye is the charnel ground of the remainder, in the north.

original: de bzhin du snying kha'i 'khor lor rtsa brgyad po rnams kyi ming ste shar gyi rtsa snang ma ni p'urnna gi ri dang / lho'i rtsa dmar ser ni dz'a lan dha ra dang nub kyi rtsa rgyal ba ni aotti ya na dang byang gi rtsa ai d'a ni aar bu da ste phyogs rnams su'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying kha'i 'khor lor rtsa brgyad po rnams kyi ming ste shar gyi rtsa snang ma ni p'urnna gi ri dang / lho'i rtsa dmar ser ni dz'a lan dha ra dang nub kyi rtsa rgyal ba ni aotti ya na dang byang gi rtsa ai d'a ni aar bu da ste phyogs rnams su'o //
translated: Likewise, in the heart cakra, the names of the eight channels are as follows: The eastern channel, Shining, is Pūrṇagiri; the southern channel, Reddish Yellow, is Jālandhara; the western channel, Victorious, is Oḍiyāna; and the northern channel, Idā, is Arbuda, in the directions.

original: de bzhin du phyogs bral rnams su ste dbang ldan du ku h'a ni go dh'a wa ri dang rlung du aa lam bush'a ni r'a me shva ri dang bden bral du p'u sh'a ni de w'i ko ta dang mer glang po che'i lce ni m'a la wa ka'o🔽// de bzhin du mgrin pa'i 'khor lo'i zlum skor dang po la rtsa brgyad po rnams ni zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang tshan do ha dang / nye ba'i tshan do ha'i mi rnams kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bral rnams su ste dbang ldan du ku h'a ni go dh'a wa ri dang rlung du aa lam bush'a ni r'a me shva ri dang bden bral du p'u sh'a ni de w'i ko ta dang mer glang po che'i lce ni m'a la wa ka'o // de bzhin du mgrin pa'i 'khor lo'i zlum skor dang po la rtsa brgyad po rnams ni zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang tshan do ha dang / nye ba'i tshan do ha'i mi rnams kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, in the directions without doors, in the northeast is Kuha, in the northwest is Alambusani, in the southwest is Pushan, and in the southeast is Malavaka.🔽Likewise, on the first circle of the throat cakra, the eight channels are to be known by the names of the countries and subcontinents, such as Jambudvīpa and Videha.

original: de bzhin du dpral ba'i zlum skor dang po la yang rtsa brgyad po rnams ni 'dus pa dang nye ba'i 'dus pa dang / dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi ming rnams kyis rig par bya'o zhes pa ni 'khor lo sdom pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpral ba'i zlum skor dang po la yang rtsa brgyad po rnams ni 'dus pa dang nye ba'i 'dus pa dang / dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi ming rnams kyis rig par bya'o zhes pa ni 'khor lo sdom pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Likewise, on the first circle of the forehead cakra, the eight channels are to be known by the names of the countries and subcontinents, such as Saṃkashya and Avaraṃshi.🔽This is the system of Cakrasaṃvara.

original: 'di rnams kyi sa bon ni mthar gnas ya ral wa rnams sku'i 'khor lo'i shang la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi sa bon ni mthar gnas ya ral wa rnams sku'i 'khor lo'i shang la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su'o //
translated: The seeds of these are the final ones, the ya, ra, la, and va, in the directions of the throat cakra, and so on.

original: de bzhin du w'a l'a r'a y'a zhes pa ni dbang ldan la sogs pa phyogs bral rnams su'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du w'a l'a r'a y'a zhes pa ni dbang ldan la sogs pa phyogs bral rnams su'o //
translated: Similarly, the va, la, ra, and ya are in the directions of Isana, and so on.

original: ha h'a ham ha: ni me dang rlung dang dbang ldan dang bden bral gyi dur khrod rnams su'o //
analyzed: ha h'a ham ha: ni me dang rlung dang dbang ldan dang bden bral gyi dur khrod rnams su'o //
translated: The ha, ha, kham, and ha are in the cremation grounds of Agni, Vayu, Isana, and Nairrta.

original: de bzhin du aar aa la ao ni gsung gi 'khor lo'i phyogs rnams su'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du aar aa la ao ni gsung gi 'khor lo'i phyogs rnams su'o //
translated: Similarly, the ar, al, au, and am are in the directions of the speech cakra.

original: aoo a'a la aar aee ni phyogs bral rnams su'o //
analyzed: aoo a'a la aar aee ni phyogs bral rnams su'o //
translated: The o, a, la, and ar are in the intermediate directions.

original: aa a'a aam aa: ni shar dang nub dang byang dang lho'i dur khrod rnams su'o //
analyzed: aa a'a aam aa: ni shar dang nub dang byang dang lho'i dur khrod rnams su'o //
translated: The a, a, am, and ah are in the cremation grounds of the east, west, north, and south.

original: aa ri li au ni thugs kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs rnams su'o //
analyzed: aa ri li au ni thugs kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs rnams su'o //
translated: The ri, li, and ui are in the directions of the mind cakra.

original: a'u l'i r'i a'i zhes pa ni phyogs bral rnams su'o //
analyzed: a'u l'i r'i a'i zhes pa ni phyogs bral rnams su'o //
translated: The u, la, ra, and i are in the intermediate directions.

original: snying po'i padma'i 'dab ma la aa a'a ni shar dang nub tu'o //
analyzed: snying po'i padma'i 'dab ma la aa a'a ni shar dang nub tu'o //
translated: On the petals of the heart lotus, the a and a are in the east and west.

original: aam aa: ni byang dang lho ru ste phyag bcu gnyis pa la'o //
analyzed: aam aa: ni byang dang lho ru ste phyag bcu gnyis pa la'o //
translated: A and A: in the north and south, for the twelve-armed one.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, the Bhagavān has said in the Root Tantra:

original: ye shes rnam shes sbyor ba las //
analyzed: ye shes rnam shes sbyor ba las //
translated: From the union of wisdom and consciousness,

original: lte ba'i dbus na gnas pa'i sems //
analyzed: lte ba'i dbus na gnas pa'i sems //
translated: the mind that abides in the center of the navel,

original: srog gi yon tan brgyad kyis bcings //
analyzed: srog gi yon tan brgyad kyis bcings //
translated: bound by the eight qualities of life,

original: bdag skyes rnams kyis dar srin bzhin //
analyzed: bdag skyes rnams kyis dar srin bzhin //
translated: is born as the self, like a silkworm.

original: sa dang rmi lam gnyid log skabs //
analyzed: sa dang rmi lam gnyid log skabs //
translated: In the states of earth, dream, and sleep,

original: rnam gsum ye shes dbye ba las //
analyzed: rnam gsum ye shes dbye ba las //
translated: from the division of the three wisdoms,

original: srog chags rnams kyi zhal gsum sems //
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyi zhal gsum sems //
translated: the mind of beings is threefold.

original: bzhi pa'i dus las zhal bzhi'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i dus las zhal bzhi'o //
translated: In the fourth state, there are four faces.

original: de bzhin rnam shes sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam shes sbyor ba yis //
translated: Similarly, from the union of consciousness,

original: lnga drug yul gyi bdag nyid @269b can ;
analyzed: lnga drug yul gyi bdag nyid @269b can ;
translated: there are five and six faces, the nature of objects.

original: / sems ni zhal lnga zhal drug pa //
analyzed: / sems ni zhal lnga zhal drug pa //
translated: The mind is five-faced and six-faced.

original: sems min sems su gzung bya ste //🔽lte ba'i dbus gnas thig le dang // tsheg drag de dag kha sbyor la //
analyzed: sems min sems su gzung bya ste // lte ba'i dbus gnas thig le dang // tsheg drag de dag kha sbyor la //
translated: The mind is not the mind, but is to be grasped as the mind.

original: ye shes rnam shes sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: ye shes rnam shes sbyor ba yis //
translated: In the union of wisdom and consciousness,

original: byang chub sems ni rnam par gnas //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni rnam par gnas //
translated: the bodhicitta abides in the union of the bindu and the vital drop🔽in the center of the navel.

original: srog rgyu'i dbye bas thun mtshams dang // thun dang dus sbyor phyed rnams la //
analyzed: srog rgyu'i dbye bas thun mtshams dang // thun dang dus sbyor phyed rnams la //
translated: The messengers are thirty-six, by the division of the life-force in the periods,

original: sum cu rtsa drug pho nya mo //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug pho nya mo //
translated: the periods, and the half-sandhis.

original: byis pa rnams ni gzhug phyir gsungs //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni gzhug phyir gsungs //
translated: They are taught for the sake of introducing the childish.

original: zhes pa ste re zhig rtsa sum cu rtsa drug po 'di rnams la srog 'bab pa las dus kyi pho nya mo ste lus zad par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa ste re zhig rtsa sum cu rtsa drug po 'di rnams la srog 'bab pa las dus kyi pho nya mo ste lus zad par byed pa rnams so //
translated: These thirty-six channels are the messengers of time, because the life-force flows in them, and they cause the body to waste away.

original: de'i phyir de rnams su 'gro ba'i srog dgag par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams su 'gro ba'i srog dgag par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the definitive meaning is that the life-force that moves in them should be blocked.🔽Now, the thirty-two secret channels of the bodhicitta are taught: “The double of the lords of men, ” and so on.

original: da ni gsang ba'i rtsa byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa sum cu rtsa gnyis gsungs pa nyis 'gyur mi bdag ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir nyis 'gyur mi bdag ces pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te gsang ba'i 'khor lo la ye shes kyi dbye bas gnas🔽pa rnams so //
analyzed: da ni gsang ba'i rtsa byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa sum cu rtsa gnyis gsungs pa nyis 'gyur mi bdag ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir nyis 'gyur mi bdag ces pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te gsang ba'i 'khor lo la ye shes kyi dbye bas gnas pa rnams so //
translated: Here, the “double of the lords of men” is thirty-two, because the gnosiss of the secret cakra are present there.

original: de rnams las bcu drug ni chags pa'i phyogs dkar po la cha'i dbye bas gnas so //
analyzed: de rnams las bcu drug ni chags pa'i phyogs dkar po la cha'i dbye bas gnas so //
translated: Of those, sixteen are present in the white, passion-side channels.

original: bcu drug ni chags bral gyi dbye bas nag po'i phyogs la ste zla ba'i cha nyams pa'i dbye bas sngar brjod do //
analyzed: bcu drug ni chags bral gyi dbye bas nag po'i phyogs la ste zla ba'i cha nyams pa'i dbye bas sngar brjod do //
translated: The sixteen are on the dark side, by the division of the passionless, and were previously mentioned by the division of the waning of the lunar phases.

original: de bzhin du kye'i rdo rje las /
analyzed: de bzhin du kye'i rdo rje las /
translated: Similarly, in the Hevajra Tantra,

original: mi phyed ma dang phra gzugs ma //
analyzed: mi phyed ma dang phra gzugs ma //
translated: the “indivisible,” the “subtle form,”

original: mdzes ma g-yon pa thung du ma //
analyzed: mdzes ma g-yon pa thung du ma //
translated: the “beautiful,” the “short left,”

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis ni rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis ni rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: and so forth, the thirty-two channels are the supports.

original: 'di nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams rten pa'i chos can ma ste thur sel gyi rlung dang yang dag par sbyor ba las so //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams rten pa'i chos can ma ste thur sel gyi rlung dang yang dag par sbyor ba las so //
translated: These are the dharminīs, the dakinis, who are supported, because they are in union with the downward-voiding vāyu.

original: 'di rnams kyi sum cu rtsa gsum gyi bdag nyid he ru ka'am 'dus par 'gyur te gsang ba'i rgyud kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi sum cu rtsa gsum gyi bdag nyid he ru ka'am 'dus par 'gyur te gsang ba'i rgyud kyi phyir ro //
translated: The thirty-three of these become the Heruka or the gathering, because of the secret tantra.

original: de'i nyis 'gyur ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo la rnal 'byor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi 'khor lo ste dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nyis 'gyur ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo la rnal 'byor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi 'khor lo ste dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab par byed pa'o //
translated: The double of that is the sixty-four yoginīs of the emanation cakra, which is the cakra that causes the five maṇḍalas to descend.

original: gza' rnams kyi yar brgyad kyi dbye ba la ste slar yang snying kha'i padmar gza'i rtsa goo r'i la sogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: gza' rnams kyi yar brgyad kyi dbye ba la ste slar yang snying kha'i padmar gza'i rtsa goo r'i la sogs pa brgyad do //
translated: The eight planets are the eight channels of the heart lotus, beginning with Gaurī.

original: dpral bar bdag med ma la sogs pa bcu drug go //
analyzed: dpral bar bdag med ma la sogs pa bcu drug go //
translated: On the forehead are the sixteen channels beginning with Nairātmya.

original: de bzhin du du ma'i tshigs kyi phyogs la zhes pa sum brgya drug cu'i tshigs kyi phyogs la lo'i nyin zhag gi grangs kyi rtsa rnams te de rnams kyi brten par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams so //🔽de ltar rnal 'byor ma stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis po rnams kyi rten dang brten pa'i dbye @270a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du du ma'i tshigs kyi phyogs la zhes pa sum brgya drug cu'i tshigs kyi phyogs la lo'i nyin zhag gi grangs kyi rtsa rnams te de rnams kyi brten par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams so // de ltar rnal 'byor ma stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis po rnams kyi rten dang brten pa'i dbye @270a * //
translated: In the same way, in the many joints, in the three hundred and sixty joints, there are the same number of channels, and the yoginīs who reside in them.

original: bas rtsa rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams te srog dang thur sel rab tu rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bas rtsa rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams te srog dang thur sel rab tu rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
translated: Thus, the channels are as many as the seventy-two thousand yoginīs, and the yoginīs are as many as the channels, because the life and downward winds move in them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung spros pa med pa'o //
translated: This is the unelaborate speech of the Bhagavān.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya gsungs pa rig byed dus zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rig byed dus zhes pa ni drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya gsungs pa rig byed dus zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rig byed dus zhes pa ni drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Here, the “time of the Vedas” is sixty-four.

original: de'i mthar 'khor ba pa rnams kyi zla ba'i cha nyams pa gang yin pa de'i chos mi mthun pas zla ba'i cha ma nyams pa ni dbugs kyi lhag ma ste dbugs drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi mtha' ma dbugs kyi chos can ma srid gsum skyed par mdzad
analyzed: de'i mthar 'khor ba pa rnams kyi zla ba'i cha nyams pa gang yin pa de'i chos mi mthun pas zla ba'i cha ma nyams pa ni dbugs kyi lhag ma ste dbugs drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi mtha' ma dbugs kyi chos can ma srid gsum skyed par mdzad
translated: The remainder of the breath is the remainder of the breath, the last of the sixty-four breaths, which is the opposite of the waning of the lunar portion of transmigrators.

original: ma mkha' 'gro ma ni sna tshogs gzugs so //
analyzed: ma mkha' 'gro ma ni sna tshogs gzugs so //
translated: The dakini is the form of the variety.

original: zla ba'i dbus su dman pa gang de mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i zhes pa byang chub sems kyi rang gi phyag rgya rnam gnyis 'gyur te gcig ni kun rdzob kyi chos can ma sgyu 'phrul chen mo drag chen mo //
analyzed: zla ba'i dbus su dman pa gang de mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i zhes pa byang chub sems kyi rang gi phyag rgya rnam gnyis 'gyur te gcig ni kun rdzob kyi chos can ma sgyu 'phrul chen mo drag chen mo //
translated: That which is inferior in the middle of the moon is the supreme lord of the victors, the two kinds of one’s own mudra of bodhicitta: the one is the great illusion, the one with the attribute of the relative, the great fierce one, the one who causes the creation of the three existences.

original: 'byung dang sdug par byed pa mo'o //
analyzed: 'byung dang sdug par byed pa mo'o //
translated: She is the one who causes the emanation and withdrawal of the three existences.

original: gnyis pa ni byang chub sems kyi shes rab chen mo sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral bsangs rgyas sgyu 'phrul zhi ba chen mo spro ba dang sdud pa nyams par byed pa ste de ni zag
analyzed: gnyis pa ni byang chub sems kyi shes rab chen mo sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral bsangs rgyas sgyu 'phrul zhi ba chen mo spro ba dang sdud pa nyams par byed pa ste de ni zag
translated: The second is the great wisdom of the mind of enlightenment, the perfection of wisdom of the buddhas, free from arising and destruction, the great peace of the magical emanation of the buddhas, the one who causes the emanation and withdrawal of the world.

original: pa med pa'i dbye bas thur sel la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: pa med pa'i dbye bas thur sel la gnas pa'o //
translated: That is the downward-clearing wind, abiding in the division of the uncontaminated.🔽The one abiding in the sun is the one with the eight divisions,

original: gang zhig nyi ma la gnas de ni brgyad dbye zhes pa ni srog la gnas pa rdul gyi chos can ma'o ;
analyzed: gang zhig nyi ma la gnas de ni brgyad dbye zhes pa ni srog la gnas pa rdul gyi chos can ma'o ;
translated: the one abiding in the life-force, the feminine particle-natured one.

original: / de ni brgyad kyi dbye bas te sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa'i yon tan gsum dang yul lnga'i dbye bas yon tan brgyad kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: / de ni brgyad kyi dbye bas te sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa'i yon tan gsum dang yul lnga'i dbye bas yon tan brgyad kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: That is the one with the eight divisions, the one with the nature of the eight qualities, the three qualities of waking, dreaming, and deep sleep, and the five objects.

original: de yang dkyil 'khor du padma'i 'dab ma brgyad po rnams la gnas so zhes pa ni brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dkyil 'khor du padma'i 'dab ma brgyad po rnams la gnas so zhes pa ni brtags pa'o //
translated: And that is located in the maṇḍala on the eight lotus petals.

original: lhag ma sngar brjod pa'i 'khor lo'i lha mo yongs su brtags pa mchog tu 'jig spar byed pa gzhan de rnams mtha' dag phyi dang lus la'o zhes pa ni rtsa la yang dag par rgyu ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma sngar brjod pa'i 'khor lo'i lha mo yongs su brtags pa mchog tu 'jig spar byed pa gzhan de rnams mtha' dag phyi dang lus la'o zhes pa ni rtsa la yang dag par rgyu ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: The rest of the goddesses of the wheel, as previously described, are all imagined on the outside and in the body.

original: da ni gza' rgyu ba'i longs spyod kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams gsungs pa spen pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni gza' rgyu ba'i longs spyod kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams gsungs pa spen pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the enjoyments of the moving planets are said to be the dakinis.

original: 'dir phyi rol du nyi ma'i rab tu rgyu bas zla ba gnyis kyis nyi ma'i dus so //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du nyi ma'i rab tu rgyu bas zla ba gnyis kyis nyi ma'i dus so //
translated: Here, externally, the movement of the sun is the time of the sun by two months.

original: nang du dus sbyor gnyis kyis srog gi dus so //
analyzed: nang du dus sbyor gnyis kyis srog gi dus so //
translated: Internally, the time of the life-force is by two periods.

original: de yang g-yon dang g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor bcu 'bab pas 'gyur te skyed pa dang sdud pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: de yang g-yon dang g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor bcu 'bab pas 'gyur te skyed pa dang sdud pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: That is due to the flow of the ten mandalas of the left and right, by the division of creation and dissolution.

original: des na dus la spen par zhes pa spen pa'i longs spyod pa bug pa zhes pa chu tshod dgu khyim gyi 'khor lo @270b la longs spyod de de rnams kyang mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: des na dus la spen par zhes pa spen pa'i longs spyod pa bug pa zhes pa chu tshod dgu khyim gyi 'khor lo @270b la longs spyod de de rnams kyang mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: Therefore, in the time of Saturn, the enjoyer of Saturn is the “hole,” which is nine hours, enjoying the wheel of houses. Those are also dakinis.

original: de bzhin du sgra gcan gyi longs spyod la nyin zhag ces bya zhes pa bcva lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra gcan gyi longs spyod la nyin zhag ces bya zhes pa bcva lnga'o //
translated: Likewise, Rāhu’s enjoyment is called “day and night,” that is, fifteen.

original: lha yi bla ma'i phyed bcas mig dang mig gi grangs zhes pa phyed dang bcas pa'i nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: lha yi bla ma'i phyed bcas mig dang mig gi grangs zhes pa phyed dang bcas pa'i nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: “The half of the lord of gods plus the number of eyes” is twenty-two and a half.

original: gcig tu gyur pa ni phyed bcas drug dang rig byed du 'gyur zhes pa ste phyed dang bcas pa'i bzhi bcu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa ni phyed bcas drug dang rig byed du 'gyur zhes pa ste phyed dang bcas pa'i bzhi bcu rtsa drug go //
translated: “The single one is the half plus six and the Vedas,” that is, forty-six and a half.

original: de rnams mchog gi rgyal bdag thugs kyi rdo rje las ni skyes zhes pa ni thugs kyi thig le las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams mchog gi rgyal bdag thugs kyi rdo rje las ni skyes zhes pa ni thugs kyi thig le las skyes pa'o //
translated: “Those are born from the mind vajra of the supreme king,” that is, born from the mind drop.

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.🔽“The earth-born empty nāga moon” is the proliferation. The attainment of its maṇḍala is the sixty-part water measures.

original: sa skyes stong pa klu zla zhes pa ni spros pa ste de'i dkyil 'khor gyis thob pa gang yin pa drug cu'i cha yis de snyed kyi chu tshod rnams so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: sa skyes stong pa klu zla zhes pa ni spros pa ste de'i dkyil 'khor gyis thob pa gang yin pa drug cu'i cha yis de snyed kyi chu tshod rnams so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definite number.

original: thun mong gi brgya brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: thun mong gi brgya brgyad cu'o //
translated: The common [number] is one hundred and eighty.

original: 'dir gang du bkra shes kyi longs spyod dman pa der nyi ma'i rkang pa'i longs spyod la zla ba'i longs spyod zla ba gcig bsnan pas dbrog par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang du bkra shes kyi longs spyod dman pa der nyi ma'i rkang pa'i longs spyod la zla ba'i longs spyod zla ba gcig bsnan pas dbrog par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, where the measure of the sun’s enjoyment is less than the measure of the sun’s enjoyment, the measure of the moon is subtracted from the measure of the sun by adding one month.

original: 'dir zla ba nyi shu rtsa gsum ni bkra shis kyi rang gi nyin zhag go //
analyzed: 'dir zla ba nyi shu rtsa gsum ni bkra shis kyi rang gi nyin zhag go //
translated: Here, twenty-three months are the sun’s own days.

original: zla ba bcva brgyad ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa ste de ni mi 'thad do //🔽des na 'dri gza' rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi nyin zhag rnams kyis ji ltar gyur pa lo brgyar 'gyur te zla ba brgyad dang nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig lhag pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba bcva brgyad ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa ste de ni mi 'thad do // des na 'dri gza' rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi nyin zhag rnams kyis ji ltar gyur pa lo brgyar 'gyur te zla ba brgyad dang nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig lhag pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Eighteen months are the world’s renown, but that is not tenable.🔽Therefore, the days of the maṇḍala of the planets are as follows: They become one hundred years, with eight months and twenty-one days added.

original: de ltar sa skyes stong pa chu zla nyi ma gza' lag bsangs mjug rings la yang stong pa klu mkha' gcig ces pa stong brgyad cu ste gza' lnga po 'di rnams kyi longs spyod gcig tu gyur pa las mkha' mig mig dang gcig tu gyur pa zhes pa
analyzed: de ltar sa skyes stong pa chu zla nyi ma gza' lag bsangs mjug rings la yang stong pa klu mkha' gcig ces pa stong brgyad cu ste gza' lnga po 'di rnams kyi longs spyod gcig tu gyur pa las mkha' mig mig dang gcig tu gyur pa zhes pa
translated: Thus, the empty earth, the moon, the sun, the ascending node, and the descending node are also empty. The one thousand of the nāga and the sky are one thousand eight hundred. These five planets have the same measure. The sky and the eye are one eye.

original: nyi shu lhag pa'i nyis brgya dang stong phrag gcig go //
analyzed: nyi shu lhag pa'i nyis brgya dang stong phrag gcig go //
translated: Two hundred more than twenty, and one thousand.🔽Those are born from the pure speech of the supreme lord,

original: de rnams mchog gi khyab bdag gi ni dag ba'i gsung las byung zhes pa gsung gi thig le las skyas pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams mchog gi khyab bdag gi ni dag ba'i gsung las byung zhes pa gsung gi thig le las skyas pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of which is that they are born from the bindu of speech.

original: gang zhig zla ba'i dus kyi longs spyod mkha' mkha' ro mo zhes pa drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag gis chu tshod kyi longs spyod do //
analyzed: gang zhig zla ba'i dus kyi longs spyod mkha' mkha' ro mo zhes pa drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag gis chu tshod kyi longs spyod do //
translated: The enjoyment of the moon is the enjoyment of the sky, the sky, the taste, the female, and the six hundred more than one thousand hours.
