original: de rnams sku yi rdo rje dag las phyung zhes pa ni sku'i thig le las byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams sku yi rdo rje dag las phyung zhes pa ni sku'i thig le las byung zhes pa'o //
translated: Those are born from the vajra body, the meaning of which is that they are born from the bindu of the body.

original: dgu po rnams kyi mtha' dag gcig tu gyur pa ro drug klu dang dus rnams dag ste zhes pa brgyad drug cu rtsa drug lhag pa'i stong phrag bzhi dang phyed kyi chu tshod de bzhin nyid ces pa ni /
analyzed: dgu po rnams kyi mtha' dag gcig tu gyur pa ro drug klu dang dus rnams dag ste zhes pa brgyad drug cu rtsa drug lhag pa'i stong phrag bzhi dang phyed kyi chu tshod de bzhin nyid ces pa ni /
translated: The totality of the nine is the six tastes, the nāgas, and the times, which are the sixty-six more than four thousand and five hundred hours.

original: dus gcig la mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi grangs so //
analyzed: dus gcig la mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi grangs so //
translated: The reality of those is the enumeration of the dakinis in one time.

original: de rnams ni mkha' 'gro dus kyi @271a * //
analyzed: de rnams ni mkha' 'gro dus kyi @271a * //
translated: Those are the dakinis of the time.

original: gzugs can mtha' dag lus la gnas shing lha la sogs pa srog chags rnams kyi srog ni phrog byed ma ste dus gcig la'o //
analyzed: gzugs can mtha' dag lus la gnas shing lha la sogs pa srog chags rnams kyi srog ni phrog byed ma ste dus gcig la'o //
translated: All the corporeal beings reside in the body, and the life of the living beings such as gods is taken away by the Rākṣasī, in one day.

original: dus drug po rnams la ni brgya phrag gcig dang dgu bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i nyi khri dgu stong ngo zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma'i grangs te sems can rnams kyi gza' rgyu ba'i nang du 'dus pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: dus drug po rnams la ni brgya phrag gcig dang dgu bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i nyi khri dgu stong ngo zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma'i grangs te sems can rnams kyi gza' rgyu ba'i nang du 'dus pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: In the six times, there are twenty-nine thousand and one hundred and ninety. This is the number of the Rākṣasīs, included in the planetary movements of living beings. This is the conclusion.

original: de phyir nyin zhag so so'i dus su rang gi lam ni dgag pa byas nas de rnams bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de phyir nyin zhag so so'i dus su rang gi lam ni dgag pa byas nas de rnams bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in each day, having blocked one’s own path, one should practice them.

original: de rnams kyi srog dang thur sel 'gags pas thig le bzhi 'gag go zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi srog dang thur sel 'gags pas thig le bzhi 'gag go zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: By the cessation of their life and apāna, the four bindus cease. This is the conclusion.

original: ji srid ces pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsungs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: ji srid ces pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsungs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: As long as, etc. The two verses are easy to understand.

original: da ni zla ba'i rkang pa la sgra gcan 'jug pa gsungs pa nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni zla ba'i rkang pa la sgra gcan 'jug pa gsungs pa nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, Rāhu’s entry into the lunar mansion is stated: The sun, etc.

original: 'dir nyi ma'i rkang pa ni ro dang dus dang ri bong can zhes pa sngar brjod pa bcu gcig po rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir nyi ma'i rkang pa ni ro dang dus dang ri bong can zhes pa sngar brjod pa bcu gcig po rnams so //
translated: Here, the lunar digits are the eleven mentioned previously, beginning with corpse and time.

original: zla ba'i rkang pa ni 'byung dang 'byung ba mngal zhes pa la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa lnga ste 'di rnams gcig tu bsdoms pa ni sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba'i rkang pa ni 'byung dang 'byung ba mngal zhes pa la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa lnga ste 'di rnams gcig tu bsdoms pa ni sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The solar digits are the twenty-five beginning with element and element womb. The total of these is thirty-six.

original: de rnams yon tan brgyad kyis bsgyur pa ni nyis brgya brgyad cu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams yon tan brgyad kyis bsgyur pa ni nyis brgya brgyad cu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: When these are multiplied by the eight qualities, they become two hundred and eighty-eight.

original: de ltar sred pas bsnun pa rnams zhes pa ni brgyad kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar sred pas bsnun pa rnams zhes pa ni brgyad kyis so //
translated: Thus, “struck by craving” is by eight.

original: yan lag rnams kyis zhes pa dus sbyor bcu gnyis kyis bgos pas thob pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni zla ba'i rkang pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag rnams kyis zhes pa dus sbyor bcu gnyis kyis bgos pas thob pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni zla ba'i rkang pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: “By the limbs” is divided by the twelve houses, yielding twenty-four, which are the lunar digits.

original: lhag ma'i rkang pa nyi shu rtsa lnga pa ni sgra gcan 'jug pa la yang mjug rings za zhes pa ni nang du yid kyi dbang po dang khu ba'i khams kyi rkang pa stong pa'i yan lag gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma'i rkang pa nyi shu rtsa lnga pa ni sgra gcan 'jug pa la yang mjug rings za zhes pa ni nang du yid kyi dbang po dang khu ba'i khams kyi rkang pa stong pa'i yan lag gang yin pa'o //
translated: The remaining twenty-five lines are about Rāhu’s entry. “The tail is eaten” means that the leg of the mind faculty and the semen element is empty.

original: thun mtshams bzhi po kun dang thun brgyad po rnams dang nyin zhag so so'i dus su srog chags rnams kyi yan lag bcu gnyis rnams zhes pa ni de rnams dus sbyor bcu gnyis so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: thun mtshams bzhi po kun dang thun brgyad po rnams dang nyin zhag so so'i dus su srog chags rnams kyi yan lag bcu gnyis rnams zhes pa ni de rnams dus sbyor bcu gnyis so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “In all four periods, in all eight periods, in each day and night, the twelve limbs of living beings” means that they are the twelve two-hour periods.

original: dus sbyor re re la ni dbugs rnams dag kyang nyis 'gyur dgu brgya zhes pa brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyi srog rnams 'bab pa de rnams yan lag gcig tu gsungs so //
analyzed: dus sbyor re re la ni dbugs rnams dag kyang nyis 'gyur dgu brgya zhes pa brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyi srog rnams 'bab pa de rnams yan lag gcig tu gsungs so //
translated: “In each two-hour period, the breaths are also nine hundred and sixty” means that the eighteen hundred breaths are said to be one limb.

original: de ltar phyi rol du zla ba gcig dang dbyug gu brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyis yan lag gcig go //
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol du zla ba gcig dang dbyug gu brgya phrag bcva brgyad kyis yan lag gcig go //
translated: Thus, externally, one month and eighteen hundred staffs are one limb.

original: zla ba gnyis dang brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug gis dus so //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis dang brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug gis dus so //
translated: Two months and thirty-six hundred are one period.

original: de ltar yan lag gnyis @271b gnyis kyis dus drug rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar yan lag gnyis @271b gnyis kyis dus drug rnams so //
translated: Thus, the six times are by two members each.

original: dus gsum gyi 'dzin pa ste zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan gyi longs spyod kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi 'dzin pa ste zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan gyi longs spyod kyi dbang gis so //
translated: The three times are by the power of the enjoyment of the moon, sun, and Rāhu.

original: de ltar yan lag gnyis gnyis rnams la nyin zhag dang po la ma reg pa dang nyin zhag gnyis pa la 'du byed ste de bzhin du rga shi'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de ltar yan lag gnyis gnyis rnams la nyin zhag dang po la ma reg pa dang nyin zhag gnyis pa la 'du byed ste de bzhin du rga shi'i bar du'o //
translated: Thus, in the two members each, in the first day, ignorance and in the second day, formations, and so on up to old age and death.

original: slar yang nyin zhag bcu gsum pa la ma rig pa dang bcu bzhi pa la 'du byed de de bzhin du nag po'i dgu pa la rga shi'o //🔽slar yang bcu pa la ma rig pa dang bcu gcig pa la 'du byed de /
analyzed: slar yang nyin zhag bcu gsum pa la ma rig pa dang bcu bzhi pa la 'du byed de de bzhin du nag po'i dgu pa la rga shi'o // slar yang bcu pa la ma rig pa dang bcu gcig pa la 'du byed de /
translated: Again, in the thirteenth day, ignorance and in the fourteenth day, formations, and so on up to old age and death in the ninth day of the dark half.

original: de bzhin du rim pas dkar po'i drug pa la rga shi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim pas dkar po'i drug pa la rga shi'o //
translated: Again, in the tenth day, ignorance and in the eleventh day, formations, and so on up to old age and death in the sixth day of the bright half.

original: slar yang bdun pa la ma rig pa dang brgyad pa la 'du byed de nag po'i gsum pa la rga shi'o //
analyzed: slar yang bdun pa la ma rig pa dang brgyad pa la 'du byed de nag po'i gsum pa la rga shi'o //
translated: Again, in the seventh day, ignorance and in the eighth day, formations, and so on up to old age and death in the third day of the dark half.

original: slar yang bzhi pa la ma rig pa dang lnga pa la 'du byed de de bzhin du rim pas gnam stong la rga shi'o //
analyzed: slar yang bzhi pa la ma rig pa dang lnga pa la 'du byed de de bzhin du rim pas gnam stong la rga shi'o //
translated: Again, on the fourth day, ignorance; on the fifth day, conditioning; and so on in sequence until on the thirtieth day, old age and death.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyis dus la yongs su bskor ba lngar 'dod do //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyis dus la yongs su bskor ba lngar 'dod do //
translated: The five are asserted to be the periods of the natures of earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: de ltar phyogs gcig ni thud du dang zla ba ni ring po ste dus ni shin tu ring po'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs gcig ni thud du dang zla ba ni ring po ste dus ni shin tu ring po'o //
translated: Thus, one side is short, the month is long, and the year is very long.

original: phyogs ni snying stobs kyi chos can dang zla ba ni rdul gyi chos can te dus ni mun pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: phyogs ni snying stobs kyi chos can dang zla ba ni rdul gyi chos can te dus ni mun pa'i chos can no //
translated: The side is of the nature of sattva, the month is of the nature of rajas, and the year is of the nature of tamas.

original: de ltar rnam pa lnga po rnams kyi dus su yang ni kun nas zla ba gnyis gnyis dag la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lnga po rnams kyi dus su yang ni kun nas zla ba gnyis gnyis dag la 'gyur /
translated: Thus, in the periods of the five, there are two eclipses of the moon.

original: zla ba gang du zla ba'i cha gcig nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni zla ba gnyis po dag las zla ba gsum pa'i dang po kho na la'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zla ba gang du zla ba'i cha gcig nyams pa nyid du gyur pa de ni zla ba gnyis po dag las zla ba gsum pa'i dang po kho na la'o zhes pa ste /
translated: When one part of the moon is destroyed, that is the first day of the third month from the two months.

original: nyin zhag drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis cha zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyin zhag drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis cha zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the parts are destroyed by sixty-four days.

original: zla ba drug dang dus gsum gyis ni 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla ba drug dang dus gsum gyis ni 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: One should know that the sun and moon are held in three times six months.

original: rten cing 'brel pa yan lag bcu gnyis kyis zhes pa ni 'dir dang po'i dus ni snying stobs kyi chos can dang gnyis pa ni rdul gyi chos can dang gsum pa ni mun pa'i chos can te des na mun pa 'jug go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel pa yan lag bcu gnyis kyis zhes pa ni 'dir dang po'i dus ni snying stobs kyi chos can dang gnyis pa ni rdul gyi chos can dang gsum pa ni mun pa'i chos can te des na mun pa 'jug go //
translated: Here, the first period is the quality of sattva, the second is the quality of rajas, and the third is the quality of tamas.

original: de bzhin du zla ba la yang khams drug gi dbye bas ye shes kyi khams kyi mthar thug par zla ba drug ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba la yang khams drug gi dbye bas ye shes kyi khams kyi mthar thug par zla ba drug ba'o //
translated: In the same way, in the moon, there are six months, divided into the six elements, ending with the element of wisdom.

original: de ltar nyi ma'i dus kyi dbye ba rkang pa'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis zla ba'i dbus su rab tu zhugs zhes pa gnam stong la'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyi ma'i dus kyi dbye ba rkang pa'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis zla ba'i dbus su rab tu zhugs zhes pa gnam stong la'o //
translated: Thus, by the division of the time of the sun, the moon enters the center of the sun on the full moon.

original: reg pa'i yan lag dbus der sgra gcan rgyu ba de yis zla ba nyi ma dag ni 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: reg pa'i yan lag dbus der sgra gcan rgyu ba de yis zla ba nyi ma dag ni 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: In the middle of that, Rāhu moves, and he holds the sun and moon.

original: nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su zhes pa nyi ma 'dzin pa las nyin mo'i dus dang zla ba 'dzin pa la mtshan mo'i @272a * //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su zhes pa nyi ma 'dzin pa las nyin mo'i dus dang zla ba 'dzin pa la mtshan mo'i @272a * //
translated: In the time of day and night, the time of the solar eclipse is day, and the time of the lunar eclipse is night.

original: dus su ste 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus su ste 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the proper time, which will be explained.🔽Whatever herbs are seen by Rahu, they bestow success.

original: sgra gcan dag gis bltas pa'i sman rnams gang yin de rnams grub pa ster zhes pa 'dzin pa'i dus su shing la sogs pa mtshon gyis bsnun pa rnams 'bras bu smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra gcan dag gis bltas pa'i sman rnams gang yin de rnams grub pa ster zhes pa 'dzin pa'i dus su shing la sogs pa mtshon gyis bsnun pa rnams 'bras bu smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the moon is in the asterism of the sign of the tree, the fruits of trees are ripe.

original: 'dir man ngag ni zla ba so sor nyi ma'i longs spyod la skar ma gnyis dang chu tshod bcu gcig byin pas zla ba drug la skar ma bcu gnyis dang chu tshod drug cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir man ngag ni zla ba so sor nyi ma'i longs spyod la skar ma gnyis dang chu tshod bcu gcig byin pas zla ba drug la skar ma bcu gnyis dang chu tshod drug cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Here is the instruction: For each month, give two stars and eleven hours to the sun's enjoyment. In six months, it becomes twelve stars and sixty-six hours.

original: zla ba'i cha nyin zhag gsum gyi chu tshod bcu gsum phri ba nyid kyis lhag ma lnga bcu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: zla ba'i cha nyin zhag gsum gyi chu tshod bcu gsum phri ba nyid kyis lhag ma lnga bcu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: By subtracting thirteen hours of the moon's part in three days, the remainder is fifty-three.

original: 'dzin pa'i gnam stong gi longs spyod la nyi ma'i rkang pa sbyin pa'am dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i gnam stong gi longs spyod la nyi ma'i rkang pa sbyin pa'am dor bar bya'o //
translated: To the enjoyment of the moon's empty asterism, give or subtract the sun's padas.

original: de nas sgra gcan gyi longs spyod la chu tshod bzhi bcu rtsa lnga dman par byas nas lhag mas skar ma'i long spyod la sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sgra gcan gyi longs spyod la chu tshod bzhi bcu rtsa lnga dman par byas nas lhag mas skar ma'i long spyod la sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having subtracted forty-five hours from Rahu's enjoyment, the remainder is to be applied to the enjoyment of the stars.

original: gang gi tshe snga mar gdong gis nyi ma bzung ba de'i tshe phyi mar mjug ma'i longs spyod kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe snga mar gdong gis nyi ma bzung ba de'i tshe phyi mar mjug ma'i longs spyod kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: When the head holds the sun in the former [calculation], then the tail's enjoyment will be [in the latter calculation].

original: de bzhin du zla ba yang nya la'o zhes pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid grub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba yang nya la'o zhes pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid grub pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the moon is in the full moon. This is the rule of the eclipse.

original: phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du nang du nyin zhag so sor dus sbyor drug pa la rig par bya'o zhes pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du nang du nyin zhag so sor dus sbyor drug pa la rig par bya'o zhes pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Just as it is externally, so it is internally, in each day, in the six periods, it should be known by the yogis.

original: 'di ni byis pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin te bstan bcos kyi sgo nas ni brjod par mi nus so ;
analyzed: 'di ni byis pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin te bstan bcos kyi sgo nas ni brjod par mi nus so ;
translated: This is not to be understood by the childish, and it cannot be expressed by means of the treatises.

original: / da ni bkra shis la sogs pa rnams kyi zhing rnams gsungs pas skyes zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / da ni bkra shis la sogs pa rnams kyi zhing rnams gsungs pas skyes zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the fields of the auspicious and so forth are stated, beginning with born.

original: 'dir sa skyes la sogs pa'i gza' rnams ni lug la sogs pa'i khyim la zhing can te lug las skyes dang glang la pa sangs dang 'khrig pa la gza' lag dang ; karka ta la zla ba dang seng ge la nyi ma dang bu mo la slar yang gza' lag dang srang la pa sangs dang sdig pa las skyes dang gzhu la sngags pa zhes pa phur bu dang chu srin la nyi skyes zhes pa spen pa dang /
analyzed: 'dir sa skyes la sogs pa'i gza' rnams ni lug la sogs pa'i khyim la zhing can te lug las skyes dang glang la pa sangs dang 'khrig pa la gza' lag dang ; karka ta la zla ba dang seng ge la nyi ma dang bu mo la slar yang gza' lag dang srang la pa sangs dang sdig pa las skyes dang gzhu la sngags pa zhes pa phur bu dang chu srin la nyi skyes zhes pa spen pa dang /
translated: Here, the planets such as Mars are the owners of the signs of the houses such as Aries. Aries is Mars, Taurus is Venus, Gemini is Mercury, Cancer is the moon, Leo is the sun, Virgo is Mercury, Libra is Venus, Scorpio is Mars, Sagittarius is Jupiter, Capricorn is Saturn, Aquarius is Saturn, and Pisces is Jupiter.

original: bum pa la yang spen pa zhes pa zhes pa slar yang spen pa dang nyal sngags pa ste nyin zhag so so'i dus su dus sbyor bcu gnyis 'char ba la zhing can rnams ni dus kun du longs spyod par byed pa po rnams so zhes pa'i don to
analyzed: bum pa la yang spen pa zhes pa zhes pa slar yang spen pa dang nyal sngags pa ste nyin zhag so so'i dus su dus sbyor bcu gnyis 'char ba la zhing can rnams ni dus kun du longs spyod par byed pa po rnams so zhes pa'i don to
translated: The owners of the signs are the enjoyers of the twelve houses that arise at the time of each day.

original: // 'dir zhi ba'i las la zla nyi'i khyim ste zhes pa zhi ba la karka ta dang seng ge'i khyim gnyis so //
analyzed: // 'dir zhi ba'i las la zla nyi'i khyim ste zhes pa zhi ba la karka ta dang seng ge'i khyim gnyis so //
translated: Here, for pacifying activities, the houses of the moon and the sun. For pacifying activities, there are two houses, Cancer and Leo.

original: rgyas pa la gza' lag gi khyim @272b 'khrig pa dang bu mo gnyis so //🔽dbang la pa sangs kyi khyim glang dang srad gnyis so //🔽dgug pa la sa skyes kyi khyim lug dang sdig pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rgyas pa la gza' lag gi khyim @272b 'khrig pa dang bu mo gnyis so // dbang la pa sangs kyi khyim glang dang srad gnyis so // dgug pa la sa skyes kyi khyim lug dang sdig pa gnyis so //
translated: In the extensive [rite], the two houses of the moon, the male and female, are [used].🔽In the powerful [rite], the two houses of Mercury, the bull and the female, are [used].🔽In the summoning [rite], the two houses of Venus, the sheep and the scorpion, are [used].

original: bskrad pa la sngags pa'i khyim gzhu dang nya gnyis so /
analyzed: bskrad pa la sngags pa'i khyim gzhu dang nya gnyis so /
translated: In the banishing [rite], the two houses of Saturn, the archer and the fish, are [used].

original: bsad pa la spen pa'i khyim chu srin dang bum pa gnyis so //
analyzed: bsad pa la spen pa'i khyim chu srin dang bum pa gnyis so //
translated: In the slaying [rite], the two houses of Rāhu, the capricorn and the water-bearer, are [used].

original: gal te rang gi zhing 'dir ni zhing can du skar ma'i longs spyod kyi dbang gis gal te gyur na de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: gal te rang gi zhing 'dir ni zhing can du skar ma'i longs spyod kyi dbang gis gal te gyur na de'i tshe'o //
translated: If [the rite] is performed in one's own field, if the field-possessor is [there] by the power of the enjoyment of the stars, then at that time [the rite should be performed].

original: gzhan gyi dus su gza' gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i khyim ni sngar brjod pa'i las rnams la de'i 'bras bu ster bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dus su gza' gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i khyim ni sngar brjod pa'i las rnams la de'i 'bras bu ster bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: In another's time, the house blessed by another planet will not give the result of the previously mentioned rites. This is the rule.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi dbye bas zhi ba la sogs pa gsungs pa zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir zhi ba la bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal dkar po nyi ma shar ba nas thun mtshams yang dag par rgyu ba'i dbang gi dang
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi dbye bas zhi ba la sogs pa gsungs pa zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir zhi ba la bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal dkar po nyi ma shar ba nas thun mtshams yang dag par rgyu ba'i dbang gi dang
translated: Now, the peaceful and so forth are explained by the divisions of the Bhagavān's face.🔽The peaceful and so forth are as follows: Here, the Bhagavān's white face is the sun rising, the time of the session, and the movement of the empowerment.🔽🔽

original: por zhes pa thun dang po la sngon du gtso bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: por zhes pa thun dang po la sngon du gtso bor 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, the division of the Blessed One's face is stated as peace, etc. Here, in peace, the Blessed One's face is white, and from the rising sun, by the power of the proper movement of the periods, first means in the first period, it becomes primary.

original: des na zhi ba la zhes pa zhi ba'i yul la sngags dang bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams kyis sngar bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu thun tshod gcig gis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: des na zhi ba la zhes pa zhi ba'i yul la sngags dang bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams kyis sngar bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu thun tshod gcig gis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in peace means that the result previously accomplished by means of mantras, meditation, and so on, in the object of peace, should be accomplished in one period.

original: dkar dang gser mtshungs thun tshod lag pa la zhes pa ni 'khor ba'i dbang gis thun tshod gnyis pa la nub dang byang gi phyed phyed ni sngon du gtso bor 'gyur te ;
analyzed: dkar dang gser mtshungs thun tshod lag pa la zhes pa ni 'khor ba'i dbang gis thun tshod gnyis pa la nub dang byang gi phyed phyed ni sngon du gtso bor 'gyur te ;
translated: The white and gold-like hand in the period means that by the power of samsara, in the second period, the western and northern halves become primary.

original: bsres pa des rgyas pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bsres pa des rgyas pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: By that mixture, one should accomplish increase.

original: nub kyi zhal ser po ni nyi ma gung nas thun tshod gcig la gtso bo ste /
analyzed: nub kyi zhal ser po ni nyi ma gung nas thun tshod gcig la gtso bo ste /
translated: The yellow face in the west is the principal one from noon to one watch.

original: des me yi thun la zhes pa thun tshod gsum pa la rengs pa'i yul la dngos grub ster ro //
analyzed: des me yi thun la zhes pa thun tshod gsum pa la rengs pa'i yul la dngos grub ster ro //
translated: By that, the fire watch means that it bestows power over the object of paralysis in the third watch.

original: thun tshod bzhi pa la gser dang nyi mtshungs zhes pa ser po dang dmar po bsres pa gtso bo ste des rmongs par bya'o //
analyzed: thun tshod bzhi pa la gser dang nyi mtshungs zhes pa ser po dang dmar po bsres pa gtso bo ste des rmongs par bya'o //
translated: In the fourth watch, yellow like gold and the sun is the principal one, a mixture of yellow and red, and by that, one should stupefy.

original: de bzhin du thun lnga pa la zhal dmar po gtso bor 'gyur te dgug pa la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thun lnga pa la zhal dmar po gtso bor 'gyur te dgug pa la'o //
translated: Likewise, in the fifth watch, the red face becomes the principal one, and it is for summoning.

original: drug pa la dmar po dang nag po bsres pa gtso bo ste des dbang du bya ba bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: drug pa la dmar po dang nag po bsres pa gtso bo ste des dbang du bya ba bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In the sixth, the principal one is a mixture of red and black, and by that, one should accomplish subjugation.

original: de bzhin du bsad pa la nag po'i zhal te ri bo la'o zhes pa mtshan mo phyed nas thun tshod bdun pa la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsad pa la nag po'i zhal te ri bo la'o zhes pa mtshan mo phyed nas thun tshod bdun pa la'o //
translated: Likewise, for killing, the black face, that is, the mountain, is in the seventh watch, from midnight to one watch.

original: bskrad la nag dang dkar 'dir klu la zhes pa thun tshod brgyad pa la mtshan mo'i mtha' nas nyi ma 'char ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: bskrad la nag dang dkar 'dir klu la zhes pa thun tshod brgyad pa la mtshan mo'i mtha' nas nyi ma 'char ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: For banishing, the black and white is the eighth watch, from the end of the night until sunrise.

original: de ltar gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo thun tshod 'khor ba'i dbye bas zhal brgyad pa @273a * //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo thun tshod 'khor ba'i dbye bas zhal brgyad pa @273a * //
translated: Thus, when the Bhagavān Kālacakra is eight-faced by the division of the passing of the watch,

original: yin pa de'i tshe thun mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas zhabs bzhi dang thun phyed kyi dbye bas phyag bcu drug tu 'gyur ro zhes grub po //
analyzed: yin pa de'i tshe thun mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas zhabs bzhi dang thun phyed kyi dbye bas phyag bcu drug tu 'gyur ro zhes grub po //
translated: then at that time, by the division of the four watches, there are four feet, and by the division of the half-watches, there are sixteen arms.

original: de ltar phyag gi dbye bas nyin mo la las brgyad po rnams dang mtshan mo la yang ste thun phyed kyi dbye bas so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyag gi dbye bas nyin mo la las brgyad po rnams dang mtshan mo la yang ste thun phyed kyi dbye bas so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, by the division of the arms, there are eight actions during the day and also during the night, by the division of the half-watches.

original: thun mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas las bzhi ste snga dro'i thun mtshams la zhi ba'o //
analyzed: thun mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas las bzhi ste snga dro'i thun mtshams la zhi ba'o //
translated: By the division of the four watches, there are four actions: during the morning watch, pacification;

original: nyi ma gung la rengs pa dang nyi ma nub pa la dgug pa dang mtshan mo phyed la gsad pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gung la rengs pa dang nyi ma nub pa la dgug pa dang mtshan mo phyed la gsad pa'o //
translated: during the midday watch, immobilization; during the afternoon watch, attraction; and during the midnight watch, killing.

original: 'dir yang zhal brgyad pa'i shes rab ni phyag gnyis ma ste snga dro dang phyi dro'i thun mtshams ni zhabs gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhal brgyad pa'i shes rab ni phyag gnyis ma ste snga dro dang phyi dro'i thun mtshams ni zhabs gnyis so //
translated: Here, the wisdom of the eight faces is the two arms, and the two watches of the morning and afternoon are the two feet.

original: nyi ma gung dang mtshan mo phyed ni phyag gnyis so //
analyzed: nyi ma gung dang mtshan mo phyed ni phyag gnyis so //
translated: The two hands are noon and midnight.

original: nyin mtshan mtha' dag ni zhal lo zhes pa las bsgrub pa la sgom pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan mtha' dag ni zhal lo zhes pa las bsgrub pa la sgom pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The face is the whole of day and night.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa gang yin pa ni go sla'o //🔽da ni byis pa skyes pa'i dbugs kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa dang po zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir byis pa skyes pa'i dang po'i dbugs thog ma gang yin pa de ni yon tan med pa'i bdag nyid ces pa snying stobs la sogs pa dang dri la
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa gang yin pa ni go sla'o // da ni byis pa skyes pa'i dbugs kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa dang po zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir byis pa skyes pa'i dang po'i dbugs thog ma gang yin pa de ni yon tan med pa'i bdag nyid ces pa snying stobs la sogs pa dang dri la
translated: This verse and the next are easy to understand.🔽Now he states the characteristics of the breath of a newborn child:

original: sogs pa'i yon tan dang bral ba ste de'i chos la ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i yon tan dang bral ba ste de'i chos la ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first breath of a newborn child is devoid of the nature of the gunas, devoid of the qualities of sattva, etc., and smell, etc., because it has not yet entered into the properties.

original: de nas rnam gsum yon tan dbang gis zhes pa snying stobs kyi dbang gis dbugs gnyis pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nas rnam gsum yon tan dbang gis zhes pa snying stobs kyi dbang gis dbugs gnyis pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Then, by the power of the three gunas, by the power of sattva, the second breath arises.

original: rdul gyi dbang gis gsum pa ste mun pa'i dbang gis bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rdul gyi dbang gis gsum pa ste mun pa'i dbang gis bzhi pa'o //
translated: By the power of rajas, the third; by the power of tamas, the fourth.

original: de rnams las snga ma yon tan med pa gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams las snga ma yon tan med pa gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: Among those, the former, which is devoid of good qualities, should not be grasped.

original: de dang lhan cig gsum gyi grangs su bgrang bar bya ste khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig gsum gyi grangs su bgrang bar bya ste khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is counted as one of the three, together with that, because it is the pervader.

original: slar yang snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin de rnams so sor yul lnga'i yon tan gyi dbye bas re re la rnam pa lngar 'gyur te des na tshes zhes bya ba zhes pa bcva lnga'o //
analyzed: slar yang snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin de rnams so sor yul lnga'i yon tan gyi dbye bas re re la rnam pa lngar 'gyur te des na tshes zhes bya ba zhes pa bcva lnga'o //
translated: Again, those, which have the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas, are each divided into five types by the division of the qualities of the five objects. Therefore, they are fifteen, called “lunar days.”

original: de rnams slar yang lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dbye bas sum 'gyur ni 'byung ba chu gter grangs 'gyur zhes pa bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: de rnams slar yang lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dbye bas sum 'gyur ni 'byung ba chu gter grangs 'gyur zhes pa bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: Again, those are tripled by the division of body, speech, and mind. They are the “number of the ocean of elements,” which is forty-five.

original: slar yang de nas rgyu ba'i dbye ba rnams kyis bsnun pa de dag rnams zhes pa ni zla ba dang nyi ma'i rgyu ba rnams pa bzhi ste myur ba dang dal ba dang 'khyog po dang 'byung ba'i rkang pa rnams kyi nor 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang
analyzed: slar yang de nas rgyu ba'i dbye ba rnams kyis bsnun pa de dag rnams zhes pa ni zla ba dang nyi ma'i rgyu ba rnams pa bzhi ste myur ba dang dal ba dang 'khyog po dang 'byung ba'i rkang pa rnams kyi nor 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang
translated: Again, those are struck by the divisions of the movements, which are the movements of the sun and moon, which are four: fast, slow, crooked, and arising. The increase and decrease of the lunar days are the increase and decrease of wealth.

original: bu lon 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: bu lon 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: By the division of the increase and decrease of the debt.🔽The four

original: bzhi po rnams kyis @273b bsnun pa rnams ni chu tshod phyed kyi dbugs kyi grangs zhes pa brgya brgyad cu'i grangs so //
analyzed: bzhi po rnams kyis @273b bsnun pa rnams ni chu tshod phyed kyi dbugs kyi grangs zhes pa brgya brgyad cu'i grangs so //
translated: times are the number of breaths in half a watch, that is, the number of one hundred and eighty.

original: slar yang nyis 'gyur rnams ni dbugs kyi grangs te chu tshod kyi dbugs kyi grangs sum brgya drug cu rnams su 'gyur te shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: slar yang nyis 'gyur rnams ni dbugs kyi grangs te chu tshod kyi dbugs kyi grangs sum brgya drug cu rnams su 'gyur te shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin las so //
translated: Again, the number of breaths is doubled, that is, the number of breaths in a watch becomes three hundred and sixty, from the nature of wisdom and means.

original: chu tshod gcig po de ni byis pa'i g-yon nam g-yas nas dkyil 'khor gcig 'bab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chu tshod gcig po de ni byis pa'i g-yon nam g-yas nas dkyil 'khor gcig 'bab par byed pa'o //
translated: That one watch is the one mandala that moves from the left or right of the child.🔽Then, the second and third, the two and three, the two oceans, the two🔽arrows, and so on, the ten increase the time of the madhyama channel, and the

original: de nas gnyis pa dang gsum pa ste gnyis gsum chu gter mda' zhes pa la sogs pa bcu rnams kyis dus kyi rtsa dbu ma 'phel bar 'gyur te dkyil 'khor bcu 'bab pa ni g-yon dang g-yas su 'phel bas zhag gcig la dkyil 'khor drug cu'i bar du'o
analyzed: de nas gnyis pa dang gsum pa ste gnyis gsum chu gter mda' zhes pa la sogs pa bcu rnams kyis dus kyi rtsa dbu ma 'phel bar 'gyur te dkyil 'khor bcu 'bab pa ni g-yon dang g-yas su 'phel bas zhag gcig la dkyil 'khor drug cu'i bar du'o
translated: movement of the ten mandalas increases from the left and right, up to sixty🔽mandalas in one day.

original: // mtshams de nas sde yi rab dbye rnams kyis zhes pa ka yig la sogs pa'i sde pa rnams dang chu srin la sogs pa'i dus sbyor sngar brjod pa rnams kyis rnam gnyis lam la gnas pa dus kyi rtsa ni 'jig rten gsum zhes pa lus na kun nas
analyzed: // mtshams de nas sde yi rab dbye rnams kyis zhes pa ka yig la sogs pa'i sde pa rnams dang chu srin la sogs pa'i dus sbyor sngar brjod pa rnams kyis rnam gnyis lam la gnas pa dus kyi rtsa ni 'jig rten gsum zhes pa lus na kun nas
translated: From that juncture, the one abiding in the path of the two, by means of the divisions of the houses, that is, the groups of the letters ka and so on, and by means of the sahama of the Makara and so on, as previously described, fills the three worlds, that is, the entire body, with the channel of time.

original: gang bar byed de rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis po gang bar byed do //
analyzed: gang bar byed de rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis po gang bar byed do //
translated: He fills the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba gang yin pa de ni zla ba nyi ma'i rab tu rgyu ba las zhes pa la n'a dang ra sa n'a'i rab tu rgyu ba las te dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa las so //
analyzed: bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba gang yin pa de ni zla ba nyi ma'i rab tu rgyu ba las zhes pa la n'a dang ra sa n'a'i rab tu rgyu ba las te dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa las so //
translated: That which bestows the fruit of the bliss of equality is from the movement of the moon and sun, that is, from the movement of the lalanā and rasanā, from the descent of the five mandalas.

original: dbugs 'byung ba las dus kyi rtsa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba las dus kyi rtsa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The division of the channel of time is from the exhalation of breath.

original: gnyis pa'i dbye ba ni mngal bzung ba nas dus kyi rtsa sde tshan gyi dbye bas bskyed pa'i ched du 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbye ba ni mngal bzung ba nas dus kyi rtsa sde tshan gyi dbye bas bskyed pa'i ched du 'phel ba'o //
translated: The division of the second is the increase of the channel of time for the sake of generation by the division of the groups of the channel of time from the conception of the womb.

original: de la gcig gi sde ni gcig ste 'khor lo drug po rnams su dbu ma aa ba dh'u t'i'o //
analyzed: de la gcig gi sde ni gcig ste 'khor lo drug po rnams su dbu ma aa ba dh'u t'i'o //
translated: The group of one is one, the central channel in the six wheels.

original: gnyis kyi sde ni bzhi ste gtsug tor gyi padma'i rtsa rnams dang lte bar zlum skor dang po'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi sde ni bzhi ste gtsug tor gyi padma'i rtsa rnams dang lte bar zlum skor dang po'o //
translated: The group of two is four, the channels of the crown lotus and the first circle at the navel.

original: gsum gyi sde ni dgu'o //
analyzed: gsum gyi sde ni dgu'o //
translated: The group of three is nine.

original: de rnams ni snying kha'i rtsa brgyad dang lte ba'i zlum skor gnyis pa ste dgu pa ni zla ba'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: de rnams ni snying kha'i rtsa brgyad dang lte ba'i zlum skor gnyis pa ste dgu pa ni zla ba'i skye gnas so //
translated: Those are the eight channels of the heart and the second circle at the navel. The ninth is the lunar birthplace.

original: bzhi'i sde ni bcu drug ste de rnams ni dpral ba dang lte ba'i 'khor lo'i khyim gyi zlum skor gyi phyi rol du'o //
analyzed: bzhi'i sde ni bcu drug ste de rnams ni dpral ba dang lte ba'i 'khor lo'i khyim gyi zlum skor gyi phyi rol du'o //
translated: The group of four is sixteen. Those are outside the circles of the houses of the forehead and navel wheels.

original: lnga'i sde ni nyi shu rtsa lnga ste de rnams ni dpral bar zla ba'i rkang pa rnams so //
analyzed: lnga'i sde ni nyi shu rtsa lnga ste de rnams ni dpral bar zla ba'i rkang pa rnams so //
translated: The group of five is twenty-five. Those are the lunar petals in the forehead.

original: drug gi sde ni sum cu rtsa drug ste de rnams kyi nang nas sum cu rtsa gnyis ni mgrin par ro //
analyzed: drug gi sde ni sum cu rtsa drug ste de rnams kyi nang nas sum cu rtsa gnyis ni mgrin par ro //
translated: The group of six is thirty-six. Of those, thirty-two are in the throat.

original: bzhi ni bkra shis dang gza' lag dang phur bu dang pa sangs rnams kyi skye gnas te lte ba'i zlum skor gyi zla ba'i cha'i phyi rol du'o //
analyzed: bzhi ni bkra shis dang gza' lag dang phur bu dang pa sangs rnams kyi skye gnas te lte ba'i zlum skor gyi zla ba'i cha'i phyi rol du'o //
translated: The four are the abodes of Bṛhaspati, Śukra, Budha, and Śani, outside the lunar portion of the circle of the navel.

original: bdun gyi sde ni bzhi bcu rtsa dgu ste /
analyzed: bdun gyi sde ni bzhi bcu rtsa dgu ste /
translated: The group of seven is forty-nine.

original: mgrin par zlum skor gnyis pa la khyim gyi rkang pa bzhi bcu rtsa @274a * //
analyzed: mgrin par zlum skor gnyis pa la khyim gyi rkang pa bzhi bcu rtsa @274a * //
translated: In the throat, in the second circle, there are forty-eight feet of the houses.

original: brgyad do // gcig ni nyi ma'i skye gnas te lte bar yang ngo //
analyzed: brgyad do // gcig ni nyi ma'i skye gnas te lte bar yang ngo //
translated: One is the abode of the sun, also in the navel.

original: brgyad kyi sde ni drug cu rtsa bzhi ste lte ba'i 'khor lor dkyil 'khor drug cu 'bab par byed pa drug cu dang stong pa'i rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: brgyad kyi sde ni drug cu rtsa bzhi ste lte ba'i 'khor lor dkyil 'khor drug cu 'bab par byed pa drug cu dang stong pa'i rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The group of eight is sixty-four. In the wheel of the navel, there are sixty circles and four empty channels.

original: dgu'i sde ni brgyad cu rtsa gcig dang bcu'i sde ni brgya ste 'di rnams las gcig ni dal ba'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: dgu'i sde ni brgyad cu rtsa gcig dang bcu'i sde ni brgya ste 'di rnams las gcig ni dal ba'i skye gnas so //
translated: The group of nine is eighty-one, and the group of ten is one hundred. One of these is the abode of the slow-moving planets.

original: brgya brgyad cu ni phyi rol gyi dbye bas rdul gyi chos can nyid kyi phyir nyis 'gyur sum brgya drug cu ste tshigs kyi phyogs rnams su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: brgya brgyad cu ni phyi rol gyi dbye bas rdul gyi chos can nyid kyi phyir nyis 'gyur sum brgya drug cu ste tshigs kyi phyogs rnams su shes par bya'o //
translated: One hundred and eighty are external divisions, because of the nature of the atom. Thus, there are three hundred and sixty, which should be understood as the directions of the joints.

original: de bzhin du mgrin par ji lta ba de bzhin du gsang ba'i 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mgrin par ji lta ba de bzhin du gsang ba'i 'khor lo la'o //
translated: Just as in the throat, so also in the secret cakra.

original: dpral ba la ji lta ba de bzhin du rdo rje la'o //
analyzed: dpral ba la ji lta ba de bzhin du rdo rje la'o //
translated: Just as in the forehead, so also in the vajra.

original: gtsug tor la ji lta ba de bzhin du rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo la bzhi ste lus la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor la ji lta ba de bzhin du rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo la bzhi ste lus la khyab pa'o //
translated: Just as in the uṣṇīṣa, so also at the tip of the vajra jewel. Thus, it pervades the body.

original: ji srid rig byed klu dang me ste zhes pa ni phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang nyin zhag gsum brgya drug cu'o //
analyzed: ji srid rig byed klu dang me ste zhes pa ni phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang nyin zhag gsum brgya drug cu'o //
translated: As far as the Vedas, the nāgas, and the fire, that is, the twenty-four directions and three hundred and sixty days.

original: de ltar dus kyi 'khor lo lo dang bgrod pa dang dus dang dus dang dus dang dus sbyor dang phyogs dang nyin zhag dag gi dbye bas rtsa'i dbye ba grub ste gnyis pa ni thun mtshams dang thun tshod dang thun phyed kyi dbye pas so zhes pa nges
analyzed: de ltar dus kyi 'khor lo lo dang bgrod pa dang dus dang dus dang dus dang dus sbyor dang phyogs dang nyin zhag dag gi dbye bas rtsa'i dbye ba grub ste gnyis pa ni thun mtshams dang thun tshod dang thun phyed kyi dbye pas so zhes pa nges
translated: Thus, the division of the channels is established by the division of the year, the movement, the day, the half-month, the month, the season, the direction, and the day, and the second by the division of the period, the period of time, and the half-period.

original: pa'o // de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma ni de'i sbyor ba las nges par phyag na gri gug thod pa can du rab tu 'gyur zhes pa 'dir bcom ldan 'das ni lo'i dag pas so ;
analyzed: pa'o // de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma ni de'i sbyor ba las nges par phyag na gri gug thod pa can du rab tu 'gyur zhes pa 'dir bcom ldan 'das ni lo'i dag pas so ;
translated: Thus, the Blessed Lady, by the application of that, is certainly established as holding a flaying knife and a skull.

original: / bcom ldan 'das ma ni nyin zhag so so'i dag pas te nyin mo gri gug dang mtshan mo thod pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das ma ni nyin zhag so so'i dag pas te nyin mo gri gug dang mtshan mo thod pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, the Blessed One is by the division of the year, and the Blessed Lady is by the division of each day, a flaying knife by day and a skull by night.

original: da ni ka sde'i 'khor lo rnams gsungs pa 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed sum cu rnams dang ya aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs lnga bcu ste 'di rnams ni bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: da ni ka sde'i 'khor lo rnams gsungs pa 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed sum cu rnams dang ya aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs lnga bcu ste 'di rnams ni bzhi bcu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: Now, the wheels of the ka group are stated: “wheel” and so forth. Here, the thirty consonants beginning with ka, and the fifty vowels beginning with ya and ā, are these forty-five.

original: yul lnga dang yon tan gsum ste de'i dbang gis zhes pa dbyangs lnga thung du dang ring po dang ldan pa'i nga la sogs pa rnams dang bdag nyid dang thig le dang rnam par bcad pa dang ldan pa bcva lnga ste de ltar sa yig gi mthar thug
analyzed: yul lnga dang yon tan gsum ste de'i dbang gis zhes pa dbyangs lnga thung du dang ring po dang ldan pa'i nga la sogs pa rnams dang bdag nyid dang thig le dang rnam par bcad pa dang ldan pa bcva lnga ste de ltar sa yig gi mthar thug
translated: The five objects and the three qualities, by the power of which, the fifteen, namely, the short and long vowels, endowed with the a and so forth, endowed with the self, the drop, and the exclusion, thus, up to the letter sa,

original: pa 'khor lo rtsibs bcu pa sum cu phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: pa 'khor lo rtsibs bcu pa sum cu phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: the wheels with ten spokes, thirty, mutually engaged.

original: la yig la sogs pa aa yig gi mthar thug pa rtsibs drug pa rnams so //
analyzed: la yig la sogs pa aa yig gi mthar thug pa rtsibs drug pa rnams so //
translated: The wheels with six spokes, beginning with the letter la, up to the letter a.

original: 'khor lo mda' dang chu gter grangs ni yul dang yon tan dbang gis sku gsung thugs kyi rab tu dbye ba yis //
analyzed: 'khor lo mda' dang chu gter grangs ni yul dang yon tan dbang gis sku gsung thugs kyi rab tu dbye ba yis //
translated: The number of arrows, oceans, and wheels, by the power of the objects and the qualities, by the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: gtso bo dus kyi 'khor lo bde ba chen po @274b srung bar byed de bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba du ba la sogs lha mo brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: gtso bo dus kyi 'khor lo bde ba chen po @274b srung bar byed de bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba du ba la sogs lha mo brgyad rnams so //
translated: The eight goddesses, Dhūmā, etc., are the eight petals.

original: 'di rang yig gi 'khor lo brjod par bya ste 'khor lo thams cad kyi phyi rol dang nang du ba spu'i rtse mo la'o //
analyzed: 'di rang yig gi 'khor lo brjod par bya ste 'khor lo thams cad kyi phyi rol dang nang du ba spu'i rtse mo la'o //
translated: Now, the wheel of the vowels should be described, on the outer and inner of all the wheels, on the tip of the pores.

original: steng dung dang shar du ji dang lhor dri dang byang du du dang nub kyi rtsibs la dli dang rlung du dl'i dang dbang ldan du d'u dang bden bral du dr'i dang mer d'i dang sa 'og tu d'a'o //
analyzed: steng dung dang shar du ji dang lhor dri dang byang du du dang nub kyi rtsibs la dli dang rlung du dl'i dang dbang ldan du d'u dang bden bral du dr'i dang mer d'i dang sa 'og tu d'a'o //
translated: On the upper petal, Ga; on the eastern petal, Gha; on the southern petal, Ḍha; on the northern petal, Dha; on the western petal, Bha; on the petal of Vāyu, Ya; on the petal of Indra, Ra; on the petal of Nirṛti, La; on the petal of Agni, Va; and on the petal of Pātāla, Śa.

original: de bzhin du gha ga kha ka ste ba spu'i khams la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gha ga kha ka ste ba spu'i khams la'o //
translated: Similarly, the consonants are on the pores.

original: pags pa dang sha la tsa sde dang khrag la ta sde dang chu ser la pa sde dang rus pa la ta sde dang rkang la sa sde ste lugs las bzlog pas so //
analyzed: pags pa dang sha la tsa sde dang khrag la ta sde dang chu ser la pa sde dang rus pa la ta sde dang rkang la sa sde ste lugs las bzlog pas so //
translated: On the skin and flesh, the Ca class; on the blood, the Ta class; on the lymph, the Pa class; on the bones, the Ta class; and on the marrow, the Sa class, in reverse order.

original: de ltar rkang gi mthar rtsibs bcu ba'i 'khor lo sum cu rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar rkang gi mthar rtsibs bcu ba'i 'khor lo sum cu rnams so //
translated: Thus, at the end of the Sa, there are thirty petals with ten petals each.

original: de nas rtsibs drug pa rnams te shar gyi rtsibs la la dang lhor la: dang byang du lam dang nub tu l'a dang 'og tu l'a: dang steng du l'am ste srog la sogs pa'i rtsa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de nas rtsibs drug pa rnams te shar gyi rtsibs la la dang lhor la: dang byang du lam dang nub tu l'a dang 'og tu l'a: dang steng du l'am ste srog la sogs pa'i rtsa rnams la'o //
translated: Then the six spokes, that is, on the eastern spoke, on the southern, on the northern, on the western, on the lower, and on the upper, that is, in the nāḍīs of life and so on.

original: de bzhin du war ya ha'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du war ya ha'o //
translated: Likewise, in the vāyu of dust,

original: de bzhin du rdul la shar du aa la dang lhor aa la: dang byang du aa lam dang nub tu a'a la dang 'og tu a'a la: dang steng du a'a lam ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul la shar du aa la dang lhor aa la: dang byang du aa lam dang nub tu a'a la dang 'og tu a'a la: dang steng du a'a lam ngo //
translated: in the same way, in the east, south, north, west, below, and above, that is, in the east, south, north, west, below, and above, are the nine nāḍīs of the nine elements.

original: de bzhin du ao aar ae aa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ao aar ae aa'o //
translated: Likewise, in the vāyu of urine,

original: khu ba'i khams la bsrung ba ni shar du li dang lhor li: dang byang du lim dang nub tu li dang 'og tu l'i: dang steng du l'im ste de bzhin du au ri ai aa'o //
analyzed: khu ba'i khams la bsrung ba ni shar du li dang lhor li: dang byang du lim dang nub tu li dang 'og tu l'i: dang steng du l'im ste de bzhin du au ri ai aa'o //
translated: in the same way, in the east, south, north, west, below, and above, that is, in the east, south, north, west, below, and above, are the nine nāḍīs of the nine elements.

original: ba spu la sogs pa khu ba'i mthar thug pa khams dgu rnams so //
analyzed: ba spu la sogs pa khu ba'i mthar thug pa khams dgu rnams so //
translated: The nine elements are the nine nāḍīs, such as the one of body hair, up to the one of semen.

original: de nas zla ba'i dbus su rnam par shes pa'i khams te du ba la sogs pa stong pa rnams kyis bskor ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nas zla ba'i dbus su rnam par shes pa'i khams te du ba la sogs pa stong pa rnams kyis bskor ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Then, in the middle of the moon, the element of consciousness, surrounded by the empty forms of smoke and so forth.

original: de la yul lnga'i stong pa dang yon tan gsum gyi stong ba ni du ba la sogs pa ste de nas cha dang thig le mthong ba dang de nas gzugs mthong ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la yul lnga'i stong pa dang yon tan gsum gyi stong ba ni du ba la sogs pa ste de nas cha dang thig le mthong ba dang de nas gzugs mthong ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: There, the empty forms of the five objects and the empty forms of the three qualities are smoke and so forth. Then, the vision of parts and drops, and then the vision of forms.

original: de ltar nyi ma la gnas gtso bo mchog gi ri bong can gyi cha ni bcu drug pa ste de yis 'khyud par gyur pa dus thams cad du sna tshogs gzugs ni rnam pa thams cad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar nyi ma la gnas gtso bo mchog gi ri bong can gyi cha ni bcu drug pa ste de yis 'khyud par gyur pa dus thams cad du sna tshogs gzugs ni rnam pa thams cad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the supreme moon part of the supreme principal one abiding in the sun is the sixteenth. It is embraced by that, the all-pervading form of all aspects at all times.

original: lha mo zhes pa ni khams rnams te sangs rgyas zhes pa ni phung po rnams so //
analyzed: lha mo zhes pa ni khams rnams te sangs rgyas zhes pa ni phung po rnams so //
translated: The goddess is the elements, and Buddha is the aggregates.

original: de rnams cis khyad par du 'phags zhe na 'chi med rnams te skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba dang bral ba rnams dang yul dang yul can rnams dang sgra gcan dang zla ba dang nyi ma rnams kyis phyag 'os pa ste mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba
analyzed: de rnams cis khyad par du 'phags zhe na 'chi med rnams te skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba dang bral ba rnams dang yul dang yul can rnams dang sgra gcan dang zla ba dang nyi ma rnams kyis phyag 'os pa ste mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba
translated: Why are they especially exalted? They are the immortals, those free from birth, aging, and death, and they are worthy of homage by the objects and subjects, Rāhu, the moon, and the sun.

original: chen po bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: chen po bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The Bhagavān Kālacakra is the unchanging great bliss.

original: @275a * // 'di'i rjes la tshogs su bcad pa bzhi ni go sla'o //
analyzed: @275a * // 'di'i rjes la tshogs su bcad pa bzhi ni go sla'o //
translated: After this, the four verses in the group are easy to understand.

original: da ni rdo rje'i dbugs la gza'i rgyu ba 'jug pa gsungs pa gtso bo'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du nang la'o zhes pa'i rigs pas phyi rol du nus pa'i dbugs ni lo'i chos so //
analyzed: da ni rdo rje'i dbugs la gza'i rgyu ba 'jug pa gsungs pa gtso bo'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du nang la'o zhes pa'i rigs pas phyi rol du nus pa'i dbugs ni lo'i chos so //
translated: Now, the movement of the planets entering the vajra breath is stated: “the principal,” etc. Here, by the reasoning that “just as it is externally, so it is internally,” the breath capacity externally is the dharma of the year.

original: lo de rnams kyis gang gi tshe dus kyi mthar gyur pa ni mkha' mkha' nam mkha' mkha' mig me dang chu gter zhes pa nus pa'i dbugs dang le nyi khri lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: lo de rnams kyis gang gi tshe dus kyi mthar gyur pa ni mkha' mkha' nam mkha' mkha' mig me dang chu gter zhes pa nus pa'i dbugs dang le nyi khri lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The years of those periods, when they reach the end of time, are the space of space, the eye of space, fire and water, which is the vāyu of potency, with 21,000 breaths in excess of 430,000.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi'o //
translated: The same is true for all sentient beings.

original: dbugs rnams kyi mthar dbugs gcig ni phyi rol du 'jig rten gyi khams la lo dang dbu ma la dbugs gcig ste lo dang la rtsod dus las 'byung zhing rdzogs ldan gyi dus la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs rnams kyi mthar dbugs gcig ni phyi rol du 'jig rten gyi khams la lo dang dbu ma la dbugs gcig ste lo dang la rtsod dus las 'byung zhing rdzogs ldan gyi dus la 'jug pa'o //
translated: At the end of the breaths, one breath is external, arising in the age of discord and entering the age of perfection.

original: de ltar dus bzhi rnams kyis nus pa'i dkyil 'khor bcu'i rtsa ra rab tu 'bab ste dkyil 'khor re re ni lo stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar dus bzhi rnams kyis nus pa'i dkyil 'khor bcu'i rtsa ra rab tu 'bab ste dkyil 'khor re re ni lo stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi'o //
translated: In that way, the four ages are the ten maṇḍalas of potency, which flow in the nāḍīs. Each maṇḍala is 400,000 years, plus 32,000 years.

original: de ltar rdzogs ldan la dkyil 'khor bzhi ste g-yon gyi rtsa la nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdzogs ldan la dkyil 'khor bzhi ste g-yon gyi rtsa la nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu'o //
translated: In that way, there are four maṇḍalas in the age of perfection. In the left nāḍī, there is space, air, fire, and water.

original: gsum ldan la g-yon gyi rtsa de nyid la dkyil 'khor gcig ste sa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gsum ldan la g-yon gyi rtsa de nyid la dkyil 'khor gcig ste sa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: In the case of the three-part day, there is one mandala in the left channel, which has the characteristics of earth.

original: de nas dbu ma la 'jug ste dkyil 'khor lnga po rnams la stong phrag sum cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i 'bum phrag gcig bzung nas dbu ma'i dus so //
analyzed: de nas dbu ma la 'jug ste dkyil 'khor lnga po rnams la stong phrag sum cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i 'bum phrag gcig bzung nas dbu ma'i dus so //
translated: Then, entering the central channel, the five mandalas are held for one hundred thousand with thirty-five thousand, and the time of the central channel is complete.

original: de nas g-yas la yang dag par rgyu ba ste sa'i dkyil 'khor dang chu'i dkyil 'khor ni gsum ldan la'o //
analyzed: de nas g-yas la yang dag par rgyu ba ste sa'i dkyil 'khor dang chu'i dkyil 'khor ni gsum ldan la'o //
translated: Then, moving to the right, the mandalas of earth and water are in the three-part day.

original: de nas gnyis ldan la me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de nas gnyis ldan la me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Then, in the two-part day, there are the mandalas of fire and wind.

original: rtsod ldan la nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor te de la dus rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsod ldan la nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor te de la dus rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the degenerate age, there is the mandala of space, and the time is complete there.

original: de nas dbu ma'i dbugs rnams kyi mthar dbugs gcig lhag pas thams cad snang bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas dbu ma'i dbugs rnams kyi mthar dbugs gcig lhag pas thams cad snang bar byed do //
translated: Then, at the end of the central channel breath, one breath remains, and everything appears.

original: gal te dbugs kyi tshad des sad pa'i gnas skabs la gnas na dbugs de ni sems can thams cad kyi gnyid kyi gnas skabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbugs kyi tshad des sad pa'i gnas skabs la gnas na dbugs de ni sems can thams cad kyi gnyid kyi gnas skabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one remains in the waking state with that measure of breath, that breath becomes the sleeping state of all sentient beings.

original: de ltar dbugs nyi khri lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa gsum gyis nang du gza' rnams kyi dus gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dbugs nyi khri lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa gsum gyis nang du gza' rnams kyi dus gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, by 4,320,000 breaths, the time of the planets is one day.

original: stong pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar dbu mar ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la 'jug par 'gyur te de bas na de gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar dbu mar ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la 'jug par 'gyur te de bas na de gzung bar bya'o //
translated: At the end of the maṇḍala of the void, one enters the maṇḍala of gnosis in the central nāḍī; therefore, it should be grasped.

original: @275b de ltar rang rang tshad kyis rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rgyu ba dbugs kyi dbus su 'gro dang gnas pa shes par bya zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: @275b de ltar rang rang tshad kyis rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rgyu ba dbugs kyi dbus su 'gro dang gnas pa shes par bya zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: In this way, one should know the movement of the lord of the victors in the middle of the breath, according to one’s own measure, abiding and moving.

original: 'di'i rjes la tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhi ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rjes la tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhi ni go sla'o //
translated: The fourteen verses that follow are easy to understand.

original: da ni 'jig rten gyi khams nya bar sdus pa gsung pa las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten gyi khams nya bar sdus pa gsung pa las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to teach the near-condensed world realm, it says “here” and so on.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni 'jig rten kun rdzob dang gnyis pa ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni 'jig rten kun rdzob dang gnyis pa ni don dam pa'o //
translated: Here, the Dharma taught by the Bhagavān Buddha is of two kinds: one is the relative of the world, and the other is the ultimate.

original: de la 'jig rten kun rdzob tu gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten kun rdzob tu gsungs pa /
translated: Among them, the relative of the world is taught.

original: dbang skyes blo ni rnam med kyis //
analyzed: dbang skyes blo ni rnam med kyis //
translated: The cognition born of the sense organs, being non-mental,

original: phra rab bsags pa dngos su rig / kha che'i gzhung gi chu gter gyi //
analyzed: phra rab bsags pa dngos su rig / kha che'i gzhung gi chu gter gyi //
translated: directly cognizes the aggregation of subtle atoms.🔽The Vaibhāṣika doctrine is the water of the ocean of Kashmiri texts.

original: bye brag smra ba'i gzhung 'dod 'gyur zhes pa dang / de bzhin du mu stegs pa thams cad kyang rdul phra rab bsags pa 'dzin pa ste des na phyi rol du sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams dang 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi yang skye ba dang 'jig pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag smra ba'i gzhung 'dod 'gyur zhes pa dang / de bzhin du mu stegs pa thams cad kyang rdul phra rab bsags pa 'dzin pa ste des na phyi rol du sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams dang 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi yang skye ba dang 'jig pa rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, all tīrthikas also grasp the aggregation of subtle atoms. Therefore, the arising and destruction of external buddha fields and world systems should be understood.

original: de yang sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa'i rgyu las 'gyur te sems can gyi phung po ji srid pa de srid du'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa'i rgyu las 'gyur te sems can gyi phung po ji srid pa de srid du'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the cause of sentient beings enjoying the fruits of virtue and non-virtue, and it lasts as long as the aggregate of sentient beings. This is certain.

original: des na 'jig rten gyi khams nye bar sdud pa'i dus su las kyi rlung 'di ni gang gis sngon 'jig rten gyi khams dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten gyi khams nye bar sdud pa'i dus su las kyi rlung 'di ni gang gis sngon 'jig rten gyi khams dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing bskyed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, at the time of the contraction of the world system, this karma wind generates the world systems and buddha fields.

original: de'i rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni nam mkha' la brten pa'i skar ma bzhin du g-yo ba med pa ste 'jig rten gyi khams dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi phyogs gang du yang 'gro bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni nam mkha' la brten pa'i skar ma bzhin du g-yo ba med pa ste 'jig rten gyi khams dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi phyogs gang du yang 'gro bar mi byed do //
translated: Its nature is twofold: one is unmoving, like stars based in space, not going anywhere in the directions of world systems or buddha-fields.

original: gnyis pa ni nam mkha' la khyim gyi 'khor lo bzhin du 'khor ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nam mkha' la khyim gyi 'khor lo bzhin du 'khor ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The second is the nature of movement, like the wheel of a house in space.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams kyi nang du 'dus pa'i brtan pa rnams ni mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams kyi nang du 'dus pa'i brtan pa rnams ni mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, the stable [elements] within the world system are of the nature of immobility.

original: srog chags rnams ni g-yo ba'i rang bzhin te las kyi rlung zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: srog chags rnams ni g-yo ba'i rang bzhin te las kyi rlung zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: Beings are of the nature of movement. The so-called karma-vāyu is the reality of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du rdul phra rab las grub pa'i lus rnams nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul phra rab las grub pa'i lus rnams nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the bodies composed of subtle particles are gathered.

original: des na 'chags pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can las sangs rgyas kyi zhing nye bar sdud pa dang 'jig rten gyi khams nye bar sdud pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: des na 'chags pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can las sangs rgyas kyi zhing nye bar sdud pa dang 'jig rten gyi khams nye bar sdud pa'i dus su'o //
translated: Therefore, at the time of the formation and destruction of the world, the Buddha’s field is formed and the world system is formed.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa'i dus der sa las zhes pa ni sa las chu la @276a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa'i dus der sa las zhes pa ni sa las chu la @276a * //
translated: At the time of the destruction of the world system, the elements of earth, water, fire, and wind are dissolved into one another.

original: sogs pa'i khams kyi rdul phra rab gang dag yang dag par sbyor bas gnas pa de rnams sa'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs las phye ste sa'i rdul phra rab rnams tha dad du byas nas chu'i khams la ste chu'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs las 'jug par byed
analyzed: sogs pa'i khams kyi rdul phra rab gang dag yang dag par sbyor bas gnas pa de rnams sa'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs las phye ste sa'i rdul phra rab rnams tha dad du byas nas chu'i khams la ste chu'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs las 'jug par byed
translated: The subtle particles of the elements, such as water, that are combined and abide are separated from the collection of subtle particles of earth. The subtle particles of earth are differentiated and enter into the collection of subtle particles of water.

original: do // de bzhin du chu'i khams las phye nas me la 'jug par byed cing me las phye nas rlung la 'jug par byed de rlung las phye nas nam mkha' la so so so sor kun du spyod do //
analyzed: do // de bzhin du chu'i khams las phye nas me la 'jug par byed cing me las phye nas rlung la 'jug par byed de rlung las phye nas nam mkha' la so so so sor kun du spyod do //
translated: In the same way, they are separated from the element of water and enter into fire. They are separated from fire and enter into wind. They are separated from wind and enter into space.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams nye bar sdud pa yin gyi sa 'og na dus kyi me zhes bya ba'i lha 'ga' zhig yod pa des 'jig rten gyi khams sreg par byed pa dang thal bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams nye bar sdud pa yin gyi sa 'og na dus kyi me zhes bya ba'i lha 'ga' zhig yod pa des 'jig rten gyi khams sreg par byed pa dang thal bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus the world system is destroyed, but not by a god called “fire of destruction” that burns the world system and reduces it to ashes.

original: dus kyi me rdul phra rab bsags pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis chos gzhan za bar byed pa'i phyir rdul phra rab dang bral ba gang yin pa des ni cung zad kyang sreg par mi byed cing za bar mi byed do //
analyzed: dus kyi me rdul phra rab bsags pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis chos gzhan za bar byed pa'i phyir rdul phra rab dang bral ba gang yin pa des ni cung zad kyang sreg par mi byed cing za bar mi byed do //
translated: Since the fire of destruction is a collection of subtle particles, it consumes other phenomena. That which is free from subtle particles does not burn or consume anything at all.🔽Thus, after the destruction of the stable world, the life force of the consciousness goes to another world system generated by the wind of karma.

original: de ltar brtan pa rnams zhig par gyur pa'i rjes la rnam par shes pa'i chos can gyi srog gang yin pa de rnams gang zhig las kyi rlung gis bskyed pa'i zhing gzhan gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro ste de rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa'i slad
analyzed: de ltar brtan pa rnams zhig par gyur pa'i rjes la rnam par shes pa'i chos can gyi srog gang yin pa de rnams gang zhig las kyi rlung gis bskyed pa'i zhing gzhan gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro ste de rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa'i slad
translated: For the sake of experiencing those objects, the consciousness is born in the desire realm, form realm, or formless realm.

original: du'o // de ltar las kyi rlung mtha' yas pa rnams 'jig rten gyi khams skyed par byed pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing skyed par byed pa ste dper na /
analyzed: du'o // de ltar las kyi rlung mtha' yas pa rnams 'jig rten gyi khams skyed par byed pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing skyed par byed pa ste dper na /
translated: Thus, the infinite karmic winds generate the world systems and generate the buddhafields.🔽

original: srog chags rnams kyi srog rnams so so so so'i lus skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyi srog rnams so so so so'i lus skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the infinite karmic winds generate the world systems and generate the buddha fields, just as, for example, the life of living beings generates each individual body.🔽They generate the increase of the stable ones.

original: brtan pa rnams kyi 'phel ba skyed par byed pa'o zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: brtan pa rnams kyi 'phel ba skyed par byed pa'o zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: This is the conventional philosophy.

original: da ni las kyi rlung las grol ba rnams kyi bzhugs pa gsungs pa sangs rgyas zhing zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir bzang por spyod pa bsgrags pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: da ni las kyi rlung las grol ba rnams kyi bzhugs pa gsungs pa sangs rgyas zhing zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir bzang por spyod pa bsgrags pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Now, the state of those liberated from the karmic winds is taught: “In the buddha fields…” and so on. Here, in the Proclamation of the Good Conduct, the Bhagavān said:🔽“On one atom, as many buddhas

original: rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: as there are atoms,

original: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus na bzhugs bdag /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus na bzhugs bdag /
translated: surrounded by their bodhisattva sons.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu sangs rgyas rnams kyi bzhugs pa gang yin pa de ni rten spangs pa dang rten med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu sangs rgyas rnams kyi bzhugs pa gang yin pa de ni rten spangs pa dang rten med pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the mode of being of the Buddhas in the conventional is not a mode of being that abandons the basis or is without a basis.🔽In the ultimate, which is the absence of obscuration, there is no mode of being, for in the chapter on Subhuti’s Dharma of the Perfection of Wisdom it says:

original: sgrib pa med pa'i chos kyi don dam par ni bzhugs pa med de shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa'i chos 'phags kyi le'u las sangs rgyas rnams la @276b gang du'ang gshegs pa 'am byon pa ma byung ngo 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro mi 'byung ngo zhes
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i chos kyi don dam par ni bzhugs pa med de shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa'i chos 'phags kyi le'u las sangs rgyas rnams la @276b gang du'ang gshegs pa 'am byon pa ma byung ngo 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro mi 'byung ngo zhes
translated: “The Buddhas do not go anywhere or come from anywhere, they do not appear, will not appear, and do not appear.”

original: gsungs so // des na dag pa'i rdul phra rab grub pa'i bcud khams thams cad 'bigs par byed pa rdul gcig gi rtse mo'i rten la sangs rgyas thams cad de gang dag stong pa'i mtshan nyid sgrib pa med pa rnams mtha' dag go //
analyzed: gsungs so // des na dag pa'i rdul phra rab grub pa'i bcud khams thams cad 'bigs par byed pa rdul gcig gi rtse mo'i rten la sangs rgyas thams cad de gang dag stong pa'i mtshan nyid sgrib pa med pa rnams mtha' dag go //
translated: Therefore, in the pure atom, all the elements of the world are pierced, and in the basis of the tip of the atom, all the Buddhas, who are the absence of obscuration, which is the characteristic of emptiness, are present.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas zhing ni ma lus las can min pa ste las kyi rlung dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas zhing ni ma lus las can min pa ste las kyi rlung dang bral ba'o //
translated: Thus, the field of the Buddha is not for those who are not destined, but is for those who are free from the wind of karma.

original: srid gsum skyed par mdzad pa ye shes kyi skus rnam par gzigs nas ni dag pa'i rdul la sangs rgyas thams cad de de rnams dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: srid gsum skyed par mdzad pa ye shes kyi skus rnam par gzigs nas ni dag pa'i rdul la sangs rgyas thams cad de de rnams dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
translated: Having seen with the gnosis body that generates the three worlds, he resides together with all the Buddhas in the pure particles.

original: gnyi ga ro mnyam dag pa'i rdul la zhes pa ni phal pa'i bcud grub pa'i bcud du byas pa dang 'khor ba pa'i byang chub kyi sems mi 'gyur par byas pa la'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga ro mnyam dag pa'i rdul la zhes pa ni phal pa'i bcud grub pa'i bcud du byas pa dang 'khor ba pa'i byang chub kyi sems mi 'gyur par byas pa la'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The pure particles of the same taste of both means that the ordinary essence is made into the essence of accomplishment and the samsaric bodhicitta is made into the unchanging.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bskor ba ste zhes pa ni smon pa'i sems kyis sgrib pa'i cha shas cung zad tsam dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bskor ba ste zhes pa ni smon pa'i sems kyis sgrib pa'i cha shas cung zad tsam dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas are surrounded means that they possess a mere portion of the obscurations with the aspiration mind.

original: rdo rje'i sras po rnams zhes pa ni so sor re re'i ro'i rdul la zhes pa shes rab dang thabs gnyi ga'i chos la gnas pa rnams te mi g-yo ba la sogs pa la gnas pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sras po rnams zhes pa ni so sor re re'i ro'i rdul la zhes pa shes rab dang thabs gnyi ga'i chos la gnas pa rnams te mi g-yo ba la sogs pa la gnas pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The vajra sons means that each one resides in the particles of taste, abiding in the dharma of both wisdom and method, abiding in Acala, and so on.

original: de bzhin dus la sogs pa'i rdul la 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i zad par mngon sum du byas pa mtha' yas pa rnams te mi g-yo ba la sogs pa la rab tu zhugs pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin dus la sogs pa'i rdul la 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i zad par mngon sum du byas pa mtha' yas pa rnams te mi g-yo ba la sogs pa la rab tu zhugs pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Likewise, the infinite direct realizations of the totalities such as the earth-totality, and so on, are the totalities of earth, water, fire, wind, blue, yellow, red, and white, and the totalities of the sphere, the infinite space, and the infinite consciousness.🔽The infinite direct realizations of the totalities such as the earth-totality, and so on, are the totalities of earth, water, fire, wind, blue, yellow, red, and white, and the totalities of the sphere, the infinite space, and the infinite consciousness.

original: 'dir rdul gyi sgras mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams gsungs kyi rdul phra rab rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rdul gyi sgras mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams gsungs kyi rdul phra rab rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the word “totality” means the stages of the immovable and so on, not the atoms.

original: dag pa'i rdul gyi sgras rten du gyur pa'i sa bcu gnyis po rnams te sgrib pa thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //🔽de dag rnams dang thabs cig rdo rje sems dpa' 'chags pa'i dus kyi bar du mkha' la rnam par bzhugs zhes pa ni 'dir ji srid sems can rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes tshogs par ma gyur pa de srid du de rnams kyis sangs rgyas 'byung ba
analyzed: dag pa'i rdul gyi sgras rten du gyur pa'i sa bcu gnyis po rnams te sgrib pa thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to // de dag rnams dang thabs cig rdo rje sems dpa' 'chags pa'i dus kyi bar du mkha' la rnam par bzhugs zhes pa ni 'dir ji srid sems can rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes tshogs par ma gyur pa de srid du de rnams kyis sangs rgyas 'byung ba
translated: The word “pure” means the twelve stages that are the basis, because all obscurations are exhausted.🔽They all dwell in the sky until the time of the creation of Vajrasattva.

original: mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, as long as the accumulations of merit and wisdom of sentient beings are not complete, they will not see the arising of the Buddha.

original: des na nam mkha' la rnam par bzhugs te chos kyi sku la gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na nam mkha' la rnam par bzhugs te chos kyi sku la gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, he resides in space, which means that he abides in the dharmakāya.

original: da ni 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung @277a * //
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung @277a * //
translated: Now, the origin of the world is stated:

original: pa gsungs te sam brta'i dus zhes pa la sam brta ni 'jig par bshad ces grag go //
analyzed: pa gsungs te sam brta'i dus zhes pa la sam brta ni 'jig par bshad ces grag go //
translated: In the time of samvarta, samvarta is said to be destruction.

original: 'dir tshig 'di ni ma yin te yang dag pa'i rnam pas chos dang chos ma yin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir tshig 'di ni ma yin te yang dag pa'i rnam pas chos dang chos ma yin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir 'chags pa'o //
translated: Here, this word is not correct, because it is creation due to the engagement of dharma and nondharma by correct aspect.

original: de'i rgyu las las kyi rlung rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa dang srub par byed pa dang dbyibs byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las las kyi rlung rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa dang srub par byed pa dang dbyibs byed pa'o //
translated: From that cause, the wind of karma becomes threefold: the wind that holds, the wind that forms, and the wind that shapes.

original: de rnams la yang dag par 'dzin par byed pas sa la sogs pa'i rdul phran gyi tshogs 'dzin te dper na sprin gyi rlung gis chu'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams la yang dag par 'dzin par byed pas sa la sogs pa'i rdul phran gyi tshogs 'dzin te dper na sprin gyi rlung gis chu'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: Among those, the wind that holds holds the collection of atoms of earth and so on, like the wind of clouds holding the collection of atoms of water.

original: de nas srub par byed pas sa la sogs pa ro'i mthar thug pa'i rdul phran gyi tshogs srub par byed de lan tshva bzhin du khams rnams sra ba nyid du gyur gyi bar du'o //
