analyzed: de nas srub par byed pas sa la sogs pa ro'i mthar thug pa'i rdul phran gyi tshogs srub par byed de lan tshva bzhin du khams rnams sra ba nyid du gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: Then, the churning causes the collection of particles of earth and so on up to taste to be churned, making the elements solid like salt.

original: de bzhin du de dag rnams phan tshun sbyor bar 'gyur te gtso bo'i dngos la phal ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de dag rnams phan tshun sbyor bar 'gyur te gtso bo'i dngos la phal ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: Likewise, they mutually combine, with the primary thing being the main thing and the secondary thing being the secondary thing.

original: des na sra ba'i chos la sa'i rdul phra rab gtso bo ste lhag ma rnams ni phal pa'o //
analyzed: des na sra ba'i chos la sa'i rdul phra rab gtso bo ste lhag ma rnams ni phal pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the particle of earth is the primary thing in the phenomenon of solidity, and the rest are secondary.

original: de bzhin du chu la chu dang me la me dang g-yo ba nyid la rlung dang rol thams cad mnyam pa ste rang rang gi yon tan dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu la chu dang me la me dang g-yo ba nyid la rlung dang rol thams cad mnyam pa ste rang rang gi yon tan dang bral ba'o //
translated: Likewise, water is in water, fire is in fire, and movement is in wind. All tastes are equal, free from their own qualities.

original: de nas dbyibs kyi rlung ni chen po thams cad dag gis sangs rgyas zhing rnams mtha' dag rnam par 'god par byed ces pa ni srog dang thur sel la sogs pa bcu yis so zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: de nas dbyibs kyi rlung ni chen po thams cad dag gis sangs rgyas zhing rnams mtha' dag rnam par 'god par byed ces pa ni srog dang thur sel la sogs pa bcu yis so zhes pa'i don te /
translated: Then, the shape wind arranges all the great elements in all the buddhafields. This means the ten winds such as life-force and downward-voiding.

original: phyi rol la rten pa rnams kyi 'jig pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du lus la yang srog la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyi rol la rten pa rnams kyi 'jig pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du lus la yang srog la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Just as the causes of destruction and increase of those based on the external world, so also are life and so forth in the body.

original: 'jig rten khams ni so so dag la slar yang 'khor yug ri bo chen po dag ni kun nas so zhes pa ni sems can rnams kyi lus so so dag la ba spu dang pags pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams ni so so dag la slar yang 'khor yug ri bo chen po dag ni kun nas so zhes pa ni sems can rnams kyi lus so so dag la ba spu dang pags pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: In each world realm, the great surrounding mountains are all around. This is like the individual bodies of sentient beings, with their body hairs and skin.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yi dbus su las kyi rang bzhin 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu 'gyur te rtsa thams cad kyi aa ba dh'u t'i gcig ji lta ba bzhin no //🔽'jig rten gyi khams lhag ma longs spyod rang bzhin rnams ni rtsa gzhan rnams bzhin no ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yi dbus su las kyi rang bzhin 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu 'gyur te rtsa thams cad kyi aa ba dh'u t'i gcig ji lta ba bzhin no // 'jig rten gyi khams lhag ma longs spyod rang bzhin rnams ni rtsa gzhan rnams bzhin no ;
translated: In the middle of that buddha field, the world realm becomes one in the nature of karma, like all the channels becoming one in the avadhūtī.🔽The remaining world realms, which are in the nature of enjoyment, are like the other channels.

original: /'jig rten gyi khams de rnams yul gyi bde ba byed pa ste lus kyi rtsa rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: /'jig rten gyi khams de rnams yul gyi bde ba byed pa ste lus kyi rtsa rnams bzhin no //
translated: Those world realms are the creators of the bliss of objects, like the channels of the body.

original: rin chen kun gyis rab tu gang ba rnams zhes pa ni khrag gis gang ba'i rtsa rnams ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rin chen kun gyis rab tu gang ba rnams zhes pa ni khrag gis gang ba'i rtsa rnams ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Filled with all jewels means filled with blood, just as it is.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dang bcas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byung ste rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa @277b gnyis dang bcas pa'i lus skye ba ji lta ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dang bcas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byung ste rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa @277b gnyis dang bcas pa'i lus skye ba ji lta ba de bzhin no //
translated: The arising of a buddha-field with a world-realm means the arising of a body with the seventy-two thousand channels, just as it is.

original: da ni 'jig rten gyi khams la lhun po la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa mtha' dag ces pa la sogs pa ste ri mtha' dag gi bdag po'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten gyi khams la lhun po la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa mtha' dag ces pa la sogs pa ste ri mtha' dag gi bdag po'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Now, the characteristics of the world-realm, Meru, and so on, are explained: “all” and so on. The lord of all mountains is the meaning of “all.”

original: 'dir shar ni zhes pa shar lus 'phags po la mngon par phyogs ni dag pa'i aindra n'i la ste rlung gi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir shar ni zhes pa shar lus 'phags po la mngon par phyogs ni dag pa'i aindra n'i la ste rlung gi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, “east” is Pūrvavideha, which faces the pure sapphire, because it is the nature of wind.

original: mthar gnas ni ya ra la wa rnams te shar du ya'o //
analyzed: mthar gnas ni ya ra la wa rnams te shar du ya'o //
translated: The end-dwellers are ya ra la wa. Ya is in the east.

original: lhor ni padma r'a ga ste ra yig gi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lhor ni padma r'a ga ste ra yig gi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In the south, padmarāga is the ra syllable, because it is the nature of fire.

original: nub ni ka ra ke ta na ser bo ste la yig gi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nub ni ka ra ke ta na ser bo ste la yig gi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In the west is Karkeṭa, yellow, because of the nature of the letter la.

original: byang ni ri bor 'dzin pa ltar dkar zla ba chu shel te wa yig gi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byang ni ri bor 'dzin pa ltar dkar zla ba chu shel te wa yig gi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In the north is Aṭṭahāsa, white like the moon, crystal, because of the nature of the letter va.

original: de bzhin du ya ra la wa zhes pa ni gling bzhi po rnams la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ya ra la wa zhes pa ni gling bzhi po rnams la shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, ya, ra, la, and va should be known as the four continents.

original: dbus ni ljang khu ste stong pa ha yig gi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbus ni ljang khu ste stong pa ha yig gi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The center is green, because of the nature of the empty letter ha.

original: de yi nang du chud pa 'dir ni dkyil 'khor chen po de yi snying po ste /
analyzed: de yi nang du chud pa 'dir ni dkyil 'khor chen po de yi snying po ste /
translated: Here, within that, is the essence of the great maṇḍala.

original: zhes pa ni sngar brjod zin to ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar brjod zin to ;
translated: This has been stated previously.

original: / dang por zhes pa dbus su thugs kyi dkyil 'khor te thugs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: / dang por zhes pa dbus su thugs kyi dkyil 'khor te thugs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: First, in the center, is the maṇḍala of the mind, which is the nature of the mind.

original: de yi nyis 'gyur ni gsung dang sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de yi nyis 'gyur ni gsung dang sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Double that is the maṇḍala of speech and the maṇḍala of body.

original: lhun po'i lte ba'i gnas su ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang snying kha'i gnas su thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang mgrin pa'i gnas su gsung gi dkyil 'khor dang dpral bar sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: lhun po'i lte ba'i gnas su ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang snying kha'i gnas su thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang mgrin pa'i gnas su gsung gi dkyil 'khor dang dpral bar sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The wheel of pristine consciousness is in the center of Meru, the mandala of mind is in the heart center, the mandala of speech is in the throat center, and the mandala of body is in the forehead.

original: de'i phyi rol du dkyil 'khor thams cad 'jig rten khams kyi rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du dkyil 'khor thams cad 'jig rten khams kyi rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: Outside of that, all mandalas are situated in the nature of the world systems.

original: mda' la bcu yis bsgyur par gyur pa'i dpag tshad stong phrag go zhes pa lhun po'i steng du dpag tshad stong phrag lnga bcu ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: mda' la bcu yis bsgyur par gyur pa'i dpag tshad stong phrag go zhes pa lhun po'i steng du dpag tshad stong phrag lnga bcu ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: “The thousand yojanas multiplied by ten are the thousand yojanas on top of Meru, which are the mandalas of body, speech, and mind.

original: snying por dus kyi 'khor lo dang phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: snying por dus kyi 'khor lo dang phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: In the center, there is the Kālacakra and the characteristics of the mudras.”

original: de yi phyi rol du stong phrag lnga bcu nas 'khor lo drug gi sdom pa ste dus rnams dag gis zhes pa dus drug po rnams kyi rnam par dag pas 'jig rten khams kyi rang bzhin dang dus drug gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yi phyi rol du stong phrag lnga bcu nas 'khor lo drug gi sdom pa ste dus rnams dag gis zhes pa dus drug po rnams kyi rnam par dag pas 'jig rten khams kyi rang bzhin dang dus drug gi rang bzhin no //
translated: Outside of that, the five hundred thousand, the Wheel of the Six Seals, by the purities of the six times, the nature of the world realm and the nature of the six times.

original: 'khor lo drug dang rigs drug gis zhes pa ni sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'khor lo drug dang rigs drug gis zhes pa ni sngar brjod zin to //
translated: The six wheels and the six clans have been mentioned previously.

original: dpag tshad rig byed 'bum gyis rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas zhes pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mthar thug pa dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dpag tshad rig byed 'bum gyis rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas zhes pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mthar thug pa dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The wind maṇḍala is located at a hundred thousand krośas, the end of the wind maṇḍala is the maṇḍala.

original: snying por brgyad gnyis ka pa rnams kyis khang ba brtsegs pa cha bcu drug gis dag pa ste ka ba de @278a * //
analyzed: snying por brgyad gnyis ka pa rnams kyis khang ba brtsegs pa cha bcu drug gis dag pa ste ka ba de @278a * //
translated: The Kūṭāgāra is pure with sixteen parts by the eight and two ka-s in the center.

original: rnams kyis snying po la yongs su bskor ba ni ye shes kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: rnams kyis snying po la yongs su bskor ba ni ye shes kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The center is completely surrounded by those pillars, the wheel of wisdom.

original: skye gnas kyi rang bzhin ni dngos grub thams cad skyed par byed pa'o zhes pa ste lhun po rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye gnas kyi rang bzhin ni dngos grub thams cad skyed par byed pa'o zhes pa ste lhun po rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the womb is the generator of all powers, the perfect Meru.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i tshad kyis phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa rgyal ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rgyal ba'i bdag po bcom ldan 'das kyi gtsug tor gyi steng nas mdzod spu'i dbus zhes pa smin ma'i dbus su phyed
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i tshad kyis phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa rgyal ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rgyal ba'i bdag po bcom ldan 'das kyi gtsug tor gyi steng nas mdzod spu'i dbus zhes pa smin ma'i dbus su phyed
translated: Now, the Bhagavān’s body size is taught to be the characteristics of the external maṇḍala.

original: dang bcas pa nyi ma'i sor du 'gyur te phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis kyi tshad do //
analyzed: dang bcas pa nyi ma'i sor du 'gyur te phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis kyi tshad do //
translated: Here, from the top of the crown of the Bhagavān, the Lord of Victors, in the middle of the ūrṇā, in the middle of the eyebrows, the half-plus-one finger-widths are the sun finger-widths, the measure of twelve finger-widths with half.

original: de nas mgrin pa'i chu skyes de bzhin te phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis kyi tshad do //
analyzed: de nas mgrin pa'i chu skyes de bzhin te phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis kyi tshad do //
translated: Then, the lotus of the throat is the same, the measure of twelve finger-widths with half.

original: snying kha yang phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: snying kha yang phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis so //
translated: The heart is also twelve finger-widths with half.

original: de nas lte gsang chu skyes de bzhin no zhes pa ni lte ba'i chu skyes phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de nas lte gsang chu skyes de bzhin no zhes pa ni lte ba'i chu skyes phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis so //
translated: Then, the lotus of the navel is the same, the lotus of the navel is twelve finger-widths with half.

original: de bzhin du gsang ba'i chu skyes phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsang ba'i chu skyes phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis so //
translated: Likewise, the lotus of the secret place is twelve finger-widths with half.

original: de ltar gtsug tor nas gsang ba'i padma'i mthar phyed dang bcas pa'i sor drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi tshad ni sku'i tshad do //
analyzed: de ltar gtsug tor nas gsang ba'i padma'i mthar phyed dang bcas pa'i sor drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi tshad ni sku'i tshad do //
translated: Thus, the measure of the body is sixty-two finger-widths, from the ushnisha to the secret lotus.

original: zhabs kyi mthil ni ma nu zhes pa sor bcu bzhi rnams kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil ni ma nu zhes pa sor bcu bzhi rnams kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: The soles of the feet are fourteen finger-widths.

original: rje ngar de nyid ces pa nyi shu rtsa lnga ste brla yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rje ngar de nyid ces pa nyi shu rtsa lnga ste brla yang de bzhin no //
translated: The shanks are twenty-five finger-widths, and the thighs are the same.

original: zhabs kyi dpangs ni rig byed ces pa ste phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bzhis so //
analyzed: zhabs kyi dpangs ni rig byed ces pa ste phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bzhis so //
translated: The height of the feet is four finger-widths, together with a half.

original: de bzhin du pus mo'i tshigs dang dpyi yang sor bzhis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du pus mo'i tshigs dang dpyi yang sor bzhis so //
translated: Likewise, the knee joints and hips are four finger-widths.

original: de ltar phyed dang bcas pa'i sor drug cu rtsa gnyis kyis dpyi nas zhabs kyi mthil gyi mthar ro //
analyzed: de ltar phyed dang bcas pa'i sor drug cu rtsa gnyis kyis dpyi nas zhabs kyi mthil gyi mthar ro //
translated: Thus, from the hips to the soles of the feet, it is sixty-two finger-widths, together with a half.

original: de ltar sor nyi shu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgya ni sangs rgyas kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de ltar sor nyi shu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgya ni sangs rgyas kyi sku'o //
translated: Thus, the body of the Buddha is one hundred finger-widths, plus twenty-five.

original: brang phyed phyed bcas nyi mas zhes pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi tshad kyis so //
analyzed: brang phyed phyed bcas nyi mas zhes pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi tshad kyis so //
translated: The chest is twelve finger-widths, together with a half.

original: rang dpung dbung lag rnams ni mkha' mig rgyal po nyi ma'i tshad kyis so zhes pa ni nyi shus dpung pa dang bcu drug gis nye ba'i dpung pa dang bcu gnyis kyis lag pa gung mo'i sor mo'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: rang dpung dbung lag rnams ni mkha' mig rgyal po nyi ma'i tshad kyis so zhes pa ni nyi shus dpung pa dang bcu drug gis nye ba'i dpung pa dang bcu gnyis kyis lag pa gung mo'i sor mo'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The span of the arm is twenty finger-widths, the near span is sixteen finger-widths, and the hand is twelve finger-widths, up to the tip of the middle finger.

original: gcig gis lag pa dang nye ba'i dpung pa'i mtshams dang dpud  pa dang nye ba'i dpung pa'i mtshams so //
analyzed: gcig gis lag pa dang nye ba'i dpung pa'i mtshams dang dpud  pa dang nye ba'i dpung pa'i mtshams so //
translated: One finger-width is the distance between the hand and the near span, and between the span and the near span.

original: de ltar phyed dang bcas pa'i sor drug cu rtsa gnyis te g-yon la ji lta ba de bzhin du g-yas pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar phyed dang bcas pa'i sor drug cu rtsa gnyis te g-yon la ji lta ba de bzhin du g-yas pa la yang ngo //
translated: Thus, there are sixty-two and a half finger-widths. The right side is the same as the left.

original: thams cad du nyi shu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgya phrag gcig ni sku'i tshad de gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: thams cad du nyi shu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgya phrag gcig ni sku'i tshad de gru bzhi'o //
translated: The body is one hundred and twenty-five finger-widths in length, and it is square.

original: de nyid sems can rnams kyi ni khru bzhi ste mi rnams kyi sor dgu @278b bcu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: de nyid sems can rnams kyi ni khru bzhi ste mi rnams kyi sor dgu @278b bcu rtsa drug go //
translated: That is four cubits for sentient beings, or ninety-six finger-widths for humans.

original: steng dang 'og tu ni brgyad cu rtsa bzhi ste de ltar mi rnams ni mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'o zhes grub bo //
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu ni brgyad cu rtsa bzhi ste de ltar mi rnams ni mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'o zhes grub bo //
translated: The height is eighty-four finger-widths. Thus, humans are established as having the characteristics.

original: rig byed ces pa bzhis gtsug tor gyi tshad do //
analyzed: rig byed ces pa bzhis gtsug tor gyi tshad do //
translated: The four vidyas are the measure of the uhnha.

original: phyed dang bcas pa'i bzhis mgo bo'i dpangs dang bzhis dpral ba dang / dang yig las bzhis shangs dang phyed dang bcas pa'i bzhis shangs kyi 'og ko sko'i mthar te bzhis mgrin pa'o //
analyzed: phyed dang bcas pa'i bzhis mgo bo'i dpangs dang bzhis dpral ba dang / dang yig las bzhis shangs dang phyed dang bcas pa'i bzhis shangs kyi 'og ko sko'i mthar te bzhis mgrin pa'o //
translated: The four finger-breadths of the head are the forehead, and the four finger-breadths of the nose are the throat.

original: de nas snying kha lte ba gsang bar mi yi bdag po phyed bcas nyi ma rnams kyis rim par 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas snying kha lte ba gsang bar mi yi bdag po phyed bcas nyi ma rnams kyis rim par 'gyur //
translated: Then, O lord of men, the heart, navel, and secret place are respectively one and a half, one and a half, and one sun.

original: gsang ba'i chu skyes lte ba'i rtsa bar rdo rje dag kyang thub pa yi ni steng gi gtsug tor nyid //
analyzed: gsang ba'i chu skyes lte ba'i rtsa bar rdo rje dag kyang thub pa yi ni steng gi gtsug tor nyid //
translated: The vajra is in the center of the secret lotus at the navel, and the uṣṇīṣa is above the Sage.

original: mdzod spu gsang pa'i chu skyes dbus su khu ba'i thig le mi 'gyur bde bskyed byed gnas pa gang //
analyzed: mdzod spu gsang pa'i chu skyes dbus su khu ba'i thig le mi 'gyur bde bskyed byed gnas pa gang //
translated: The bindu of semen, which produces unchanging bliss, is located in the center of the secret lotus and the ūrṇā.

original: dpal ldan rdo rje'i sa 'di gnyi ga'i rigs kyi dbang gis sku'i 'khor lo dpral ba dang lte ba dang gsung gi 'khor lo mgrin pa dang snying kha dang thugs kyi 'khor lo gsang ba dang gtsug tor dag pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje'i sa 'di gnyi ga'i rigs kyi dbang gis sku'i 'khor lo dpral ba dang lte ba dang gsung gi 'khor lo mgrin pa dang snying kha dang thugs kyi 'khor lo gsang ba dang gtsug tor dag pa'o //
translated: This vajra ground is the wheel of body at the forehead and navel, the wheel of speech at the throat and heart, and the wheel of mind at the secret place and the crown, by the power of both of these families.

original: da ni sku la dkyil 'khor dag pa gsungs pa phyed bcas nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lus la gsang ba dang mdzod spu'i dbus su thugs ka'o //
analyzed: da ni sku la dkyil 'khor dag pa gsungs pa phyed bcas nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lus la gsang ba dang mdzod spu'i dbus su thugs ka'o //
translated: Now, the purity of the body mandala is stated with half and sun, etc. Here, the mind wheel is in the middle of the secret place and the point.

original: de nyid ni thugs kyi 'khor lo ste lte ba dang mgrin pa'i dbus nas phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de nyid ni thugs kyi 'khor lo ste lte ba dang mgrin pa'i dbus nas phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis so //
translated: That itself is the mind wheel, twelve fingerbreadths with half, from the middle of the navel and throat.

original: lte ba dang mgrin pa'i mtshams su sor nyi shu rtsa lnga ni gsung gi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: lte ba dang mgrin pa'i mtshams su sor nyi shu rtsa lnga ni gsung gi 'khor lo'o //
translated: Twenty-five fingerbreadths from the juncture of the navel and throat is the speech wheel.

original: gsang ba'i padma dang mdzod spu'i mthar sor lnga bcu ni sku'i 'khor lo ste rdo rje'i sa gzhi la'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i padma dang mdzod spu'i mthar sor lnga bcu ni sku'i 'khor lo ste rdo rje'i sa gzhi la'o //
translated: Fifty fingerbreadths from the secret lotus and the point is the body wheel, on the vajra ground.

original: thugs kyi phyed ces pa ni thugs kyi 'khor lo'i nang du gnas pa ste rkang ba dang bcas pa'i sor drug gi ye shes kyi 'khor lo sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi phyed ces pa ni thugs kyi 'khor lo'i nang du gnas pa ste rkang ba dang bcas pa'i sor drug gi ye shes kyi 'khor lo sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: The “half of the mind” is the wheel of wisdom, which is located in the mind wheel and is purified as six finger-widths together with the base.

original: gsum po dag las zhes pa ni bdun pa'i don la lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gsum po dag las zhes pa ni bdun pa'i don la lnga pa'o //
translated: “From the three” means the fifth case from the seventh case.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum po dag la sgo rnams bya zhes pa la thugs kyi sgo rnams ni sad pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhi dang gsung gi sgo rnams ni kha dang bshad lam dang sna'i bu ga rnams dang sku'i sgo rnams ni mig dang rna ba'i bu ga
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum po dag la sgo rnams bya zhes pa la thugs kyi sgo rnams ni sad pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhi dang gsung gi sgo rnams ni kha dang bshad lam dang sna'i bu ga rnams dang sku'i sgo rnams ni mig dang rna ba'i bu ga
translated: “The doors are made in the three maṇḍalas” means that the doors of the mind are the four states of waking and so on, the doors of speech are the mouth, the path of explanation, and the nostrils, and the doors of the body are the eyes and the ears.

original: rnams te de ltar sgo bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: rnams te de ltar sgo bcu gnyis so //
translated: Thus there are twelve doors.

original: lhag ma ni sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sngar brjod zin to //
translated: The rest has been explained previously.

original: de ltar byang chub sems kyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dbye bas steng dang 'og tu sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor lo nyis 'gyur dag tu 'gyur te sor brgya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems kyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dbye bas steng dang 'og tu sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor lo nyis 'gyur dag tu 'gyur te sor brgya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, by the division of the movement of bodhicitta, the body, speech, and mind wheels are doubled above and below, making one hundred finger-widths.

original: de bzhin du lhun por gnas pa la yang ste dkyil 'khor la rgyal ba'i bdag po'i sor mo phyed gang yin pa de ni mi yul du dpag tshad stong phrag dag tu 'gyur te de ltar na khru bzhi po @279a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhun por gnas pa la yang ste dkyil 'khor la rgyal ba'i bdag po'i sor mo phyed gang yin pa de ni mi yul du dpag tshad stong phrag dag tu 'gyur te de ltar na khru bzhi po @279a * //
translated: The measure of the other seven mountains is half that of the preceding one.🔽The measure of the outer rim of wind is 160,000 yojanas.🔽The measure of the outer rim of wind is 160,000 yojanas.

original: de yi steng du rdo rje'i rnam pa brtsegs pa cha gsum pa ste de yi yang ni phyed du 'gyur zhing lhun po'i phyi rol du 'og gi char 'dzin ma'i khor yug dang chu'i khor yug dang me'i khor yug dang rlung gi khor yug go //
analyzed: de yi steng du rdo rje'i rnam pa brtsegs pa cha gsum pa ste de yi yang ni phyed du 'gyur zhing lhun po'i phyi rol du 'og gi char 'dzin ma'i khor yug dang chu'i khor yug dang me'i khor yug dang rlung gi khor yug go //
translated: The measure of the outer rim of wind is 160,000 yojanas.🔽The measure of the outer rim of wind is 160,000 yojanas

original: de'i phyi rol gyi cha la 'bar ba dang bcas pa'i rdo rje'i phreng ba ni rdo rje'i khor yug go //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi cha la 'bar ba dang bcas pa'i rdo rje'i phreng ba ni rdo rje'i khor yug go //
translated: The outer part of that is the vajra garland with flames, which is the vajra fence.

original: phyed bcas zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig ni go sla'o //
analyzed: phyed bcas zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig ni go sla'o //
translated: The one verse beginning with “half” is easy to understand.

original: steng dang 'og tu sangs rgyas sku ni mnyam pa gru bzhi par 'gyur te sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor lo gru bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu sangs rgyas sku ni mnyam pa gru bzhi par 'gyur te sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor lo gru bzhi pa'o //
translated: The Buddha’s body above and below is square, the body, speech, and mind wheels are square.

original: kun nas rlung gi bgrod pa'i dbang gis thad ka'i tshad kyis zhes pa ni phyi rol du rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi bgrod pa'i dbang gis nang du lag pa g-yon gyi sen mo nas lag pa g-yas kyi sen mo'i mthar mnyam gnas la sogs pa'i rlung bgrod pa'o
analyzed: kun nas rlung gi bgrod pa'i dbang gis thad ka'i tshad kyis zhes pa ni phyi rol du rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi bgrod pa'i dbang gis nang du lag pa g-yon gyi sen mo nas lag pa g-yas kyi sen mo'i mthar mnyam gnas la sogs pa'i rlung bgrod pa'o
translated: “By the power of the wind’s movement all around, the horizontal measure” means that by the power of the movement of the wind maṇḍala outside, the winds of the brow and so on move inside from the nail of the left hand to the tip of the nail of the right hand.

original: // des na lus kyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa ste gru bzhi'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: // des na lus kyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa ste gru bzhi'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the body maṇḍala is square, that is, four-sided.

original: 'khor lo gsum rnams kyis sngom pa'am yang na 'khor lo drug rnams kyis sngom pa'i dkyil 'khor zlum po sgo brgyad pa ste 'khor lo so so'i chad rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rkang pa dang bcas pa'i sor drug rnams kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo gsum rnams kyis sngom pa'am yang na 'khor lo drug rnams kyis sngom pa'i dkyil 'khor zlum po sgo brgyad pa ste 'khor lo so so'i chad rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rkang pa dang bcas pa'i sor drug rnams kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: The mandala is a circle with eight doors, either with three or with six wheels. Each wheel is six finger-widths, together with the foot of the Lord of the Victorious Ones.

original: sgo brgyad rnams kyis bskor ba ni sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: sgo brgyad rnams kyis bskor ba ni sngar brjod zin to //
translated: The eight doors are as described above.

original: rang gi lag mthil sen mo rnams kyis dpal ldan dur khrod brtag par bya ste de la dkyil 'khor gyi thad ka dang 'og dang steng du yang kha la sogs pa sgo brgyad po rnams dang dur khrod rnams so zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi lag mthil sen mo rnams kyis dpal ldan dur khrod brtag par bya ste de la dkyil 'khor gyi thad ka dang 'og dang steng du yang kha la sogs pa sgo brgyad po rnams dang dur khrod rnams so zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: One should examine the glorious charnel grounds with the nails on the palms of one's hands. There, on the same level as the mandala, below and above, are the eight doors beginning with the mouth and the charnel grounds. This is the rule.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das ma'i sku'i dag pas dkyil 'khor gsungs te steng 'og zhal dang gsang bar gnyis dang chu gter tshad kyis bcom ldan 'das ma'i dkyil 'khor dag tu 'gyur zhes pa ni sor bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyis 'gyur te mdzod spu dang gsang ba'i padma
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das ma'i sku'i dag pas dkyil 'khor gsungs te steng 'og zhal dang gsang bar gnyis dang chu gter tshad kyis bcom ldan 'das ma'i dkyil 'khor dag tu 'gyur zhes pa ni sor bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyis 'gyur te mdzod spu dang gsang ba'i padma
translated: Now, the mandala of the Bhagavatī is taught by the purity of her body. The upper and lower faces and the two in the secret place, divided by the measure of the ocean, become the mandala of the Bhagavatī.

original: dag las sor brgyad dor nas sor bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyis rdul gyi khams so //
analyzed: dag las sor brgyad dor nas sor bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyis rdul gyi khams so //
translated: This is done with forty-two finger breadths. Excluding eight finger breadths from the ūrṇā and the secret lotus, there are forty-two finger breadths for the element of dust.

original: des bcom ldan 'das ma'i dkyil 'khor du 'gyur te padma'i phyed dang 'khor lo drug ni mtshungs pa'i cha rnams kyis so //
analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das ma'i dkyil 'khor du 'gyur te padma'i phyed dang 'khor lo drug ni mtshungs pa'i cha rnams kyis so //
translated: With that, there is the mandala of the Bhagavatī. Half of the lotus and six cakras are equal parts.

original: 'dir sgo ni mi mtshungs te 'khor lo las lnga cha'o //
analyzed: 'dir sgo ni mi mtshungs te 'khor lo las lnga cha'o //
translated: Here, the door is not equal. It is five parts of the cakra.

original: 'khor lo las lnga cha gang yin pa de ni gdan bzhi la sogs par @279b ro ;
analyzed: 'khor lo las lnga cha gang yin pa de ni gdan bzhi la sogs par @279b ro ;
translated: That which is five parts of the cakra is the four seats, and so on.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na 'dir skye ba'i dus su ma'i skye gnas sor bcu gnyis su 'gyur te cha dgu bcu rtsa drug las brgyad cha'o //
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na 'dir skye ba'i dus su ma'i skye gnas sor bcu gnyis su 'gyur te cha dgu bcu rtsa drug las brgyad cha'o //
translated: Why is that? Here, at the time of birth, the womb of the mother becomes twelve finger breadths, eight parts out of ninety-six parts.

original: des na gling bzhi rnams su bud med rnams kyi skye gnas ni sgo bzhi rnams te mngal gyi gnas ni dkyil 'khor gyi khang ba dang byis pa'i lus ni lha'i tshogs so zhes byis pa rnams kyi skye ba lha'i rnam par bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis
analyzed: des na gling bzhi rnams su bud med rnams kyi skye gnas ni sgo bzhi rnams te mngal gyi gnas ni dkyil 'khor gyi khang ba dang byis pa'i lus ni lha'i tshogs so zhes byis pa rnams kyi skye ba lha'i rnam par bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis
translated: The Bhagavān has taught that the birth of children is in the form of gods.

original: spros pas so //
analyzed: spros pas so //
translated: This is due to elaboration.

original: 'on kyang gsang ba nas gtsug tor gyi cha las sgo ni lnga cha'o zhes pas te rigs pa las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsang ba nas gtsug tor gyi cha las sgo ni lnga cha'o zhes pas te rigs pa las so //
translated: However, from the secret to the crown, there are five parts of the door, according to logic.

original: de ltar sems can rnams kyi lus ni dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar sems can rnams kyi lus ni dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the bodies of sentient beings are of the nature of the characteristics of the mandala.

original: mchod rten ni shes rab ma yin zhing thabs kyang ma yin te ma ning ngo zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: mchod rten ni shes rab ma yin zhing thabs kyang ma yin te ma ning ngo zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The caitya is neither wisdom nor method, but is neuter. This is the determination.

original: lhun po'i phyi rol du ni 'og gis gzhi'i gnas la grub pa brgyad po yang dag gnas pa ste shar du ral gri dang drag po'i zur du ro yi dbang po dang byang du bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu dang rlung du ril bu dang nub tu mig sman dang
analyzed: lhun po'i phyi rol du ni 'og gis gzhi'i gnas la grub pa brgyad po yang dag gnas pa ste shar du ral gri dang drag po'i zur du ro yi dbang po dang byang du bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu dang rlung du ril bu dang nub tu mig sman dang
translated: Outside of Meru, in the abode of the lower foundation, the eight perfections are situated: in the east, the sword; in the northeast, the head of a corpse; in the north, the fruit of immortality; in the northwest, the pill; in the west, the eye medicine;

original: bden bral du ro tsa na dang lho ru rkang mgyogs dang me yi zur du mi zad pa'i gter dang dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su mchod phyir thogs pa'o //
analyzed: bden bral du ro tsa na dang lho ru rkang mgyogs dang me yi zur du mi zad pa'i gter dang dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su mchod phyir thogs pa'o //
translated: in the southwest, the quicksilver; in the south, the swift foot; in the southeast, the inexhaustible treasure; and in the center of the maṇḍala, the sacred thread.

original: lha dang mi yi bla ma dus kyi 'khor lo'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs ni de nyid do zhes pa ni gzhom du med pa'i sgra ste lha la sogs pa rnams rab tu sad par byed pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi yi bla ma dus kyi 'khor lo'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs ni de nyid do zhes pa ni gzhom du med pa'i sgra ste lha la sogs pa rnams rab tu sad par byed pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The voice of Brahmā of the divine and human guru, the Wheel of Time, is that very [voice] itself, which is the invincible sound that awakens the gods and so forth.

original: da ni rdo rje rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa nor bu zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rdo rje nor bu rnam par dag pas rdo rje sor gcig par 'gyur ro gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo rnam par dag pas sor gnyis pa dang dpral pa
analyzed: da ni rdo rje rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa nor bu zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rdo rje nor bu rnam par dag pas rdo rje sor gcig par 'gyur ro gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo rnam par dag pas sor gnyis pa dang dpral pa
translated: Here, the one-finger vajra is due to the purity of the jewel, the two-finger [vajra] is due to the purity of the uṣṇīṣa cakra, the four-finger [vajra] is due to the purity of the forehead,

original: rnam par dag pas sor bzhi pa dang mgrin pa rnam par dag pas sor lnga pa dang snying kha rnam par dag pas sor brgyad pa dang lte ba rnam par dag pas sor dgu pa dang gsang pa rnam par dag pas sor bcu gnyis pa ste zad par
analyzed: rnam par dag pas sor bzhi pa dang mgrin pa rnam par dag pas sor lnga pa dang snying kha rnam par dag pas sor brgyad pa dang lte ba rnam par dag pas sor dgu pa dang gsang pa rnam par dag pas sor bcu gnyis pa ste zad par
translated: the five-finger [vajra] is due to the purity of the throat, the eight-finger [vajra] is due to the purity of the heart, the nine-finger [vajra] is due to the purity of the navel, and the twelve-finger [vajra] is due to the purity of the secret [place], respectively.

original: rlung dang me dang chu dang sa dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyi grangs ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rlung dang me dang chu dang sa dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyi grangs ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: [This is] the enumeration of the vāyu, fire, water, earth, and the gods, demigods, and humans of the desire realm.

original: des na rna ba'i phyag rgya rnams sor gcig pa dang mthe bo'i rdo rje ni sor gnyis pa dang dpral par rdo rje phreng ba'i don du sor bzhi pa dang mgrin par yang sor lnga pa dang phrag par rdo rje phreng pa'i don du sor brgyad pa dang
analyzed: des na rna ba'i phyag rgya rnams sor gcig pa dang mthe bo'i rdo rje ni sor gnyis pa dang dpral par rdo rje phreng ba'i don du sor bzhi pa dang mgrin par yang sor lnga pa dang phrag par rdo rje phreng pa'i don du sor brgyad pa dang
translated: Therefore, the mudras of the hands are one finger in length, the vajra of the thumb is two fingers in length, the vajra garland at the forehead is four fingers in length, the vajra garland at the throat is five fingers in length, and the vajra garland at the shoulders is eight fingers in length.

original: snying khar 'dogs pa'i rdo rje ni so rang gu pa ste rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rdo rje'i rgyan gyi ched du bya'o //
analyzed: snying khar 'dogs pa'i rdo rje ni so rang gu pa ste rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rdo rje'i rgyan gyi ched du bya'o //
translated: The vajra to be worn at the heart is six fingers in length.

original: gsor ba'i rdo rje ni sor bcu gnyis pa'o //🔽de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni steng dang dbus dang 'og @280a * //
analyzed: gsor ba'i rdo rje ni sor bcu gnyis pa'o // de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni steng dang dbus dang 'og @280a * //
translated: The vajra to be thrown is twelve fingers in length.

original: tu gsum gyi cha ste mnyam pa'i cha'o //
analyzed: tu gsum gyi cha ste mnyam pa'i cha'o //
translated: Their characteristics are the upper, middle, and lower parts, which are equal parts.

original: gsor ba'i rdo rje de nyid zlum pa ni zhi ba ste zhi ba'i las la'o //
analyzed: gsor ba'i rdo rje de nyid zlum pa ni zhi ba ste zhi ba'i las la'o //
translated: That very vajra to be thrown, when round, is for the purpose of pacifying.

original: rnam par rgyas pa ste rtse mo rnam par bye ba ni drag po la zhes pa drag po'i las la'o //
analyzed: rnam par rgyas pa ste rtse mo rnam par bye ba ni drag po la zhes pa drag po'i las la'o //
translated: When expanded, that is, with the tips spread out, it is for the purpose of wrathful activity.

original: dril bu dag kyang de bzhin cha gsum ste dbus dang steng du rdo rje dang zhal yang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: dril bu dag kyang de bzhin cha gsum ste dbus dang steng du rdo rje dang zhal yang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The bells are also like that, with three parts, with a vajra in the center and above, and also the same face.

original: ba lang gi gdong ni zhi ba la'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi gdong ni zhi ba la'o //
translated: The face of an ox is for the peaceful.

original: padma rnam par rgyas pa'i kha ni drag po la ste gyis pa'i rdo rje dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: padma rnam par rgyas pa'i kha ni drag po la ste gyis pa'i rdo rje dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The face of a fully blossomed lotus is for the wrathful, with a vajra.

original: 'dir rdo rje'i rva rnams kyi khyon ni rdo rje'i tshad las sum cha'o //
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje'i rva rnams kyi khyon ni rdo rje'i tshad las sum cha'o //
translated: Here, the width of the vajra horns is one-third the size of the vajra.

original: rdo rje'i dbus su lte ba zhal bzhi pa ste sum cha de yi sum cha'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbus su lte ba zhal bzhi pa ste sum cha de yi sum cha'o //
translated: In the center of the vajra, the navel is four-faced, one-third of that.

original: de bzhin du lte ba'i 'og dang steng du lte ba'i tshad kyis 'dab ma brgyad rnams so ;
analyzed: de bzhin du lte ba'i 'og dang steng du lte ba'i tshad kyis 'dab ma brgyad rnams so ;
translated: Similarly, below and above the navel, the eight petals are the size of the navel.

original: / rva ni rdo rje'i khyon dang mtshungs pa zhes pa phyogs sam phyogs bral gyi dbus su sum cha ste phyogs bzhi po rnams sam phyogs bral rnams su'o //
analyzed: / rva ni rdo rje'i khyon dang mtshungs pa zhes pa phyogs sam phyogs bral gyi dbus su sum cha ste phyogs bzhi po rnams sam phyogs bral rnams su'o //
translated: The horns are equal to the width of the vajra, one-third in the center of the directions or the intermediate directions, in the four directions or the intermediate directions.

original: rva yi zlum po ni rdo rje'i sum cha'i bzhi cha'o //
analyzed: rva yi zlum po ni rdo rje'i sum cha'i bzhi cha'o //
translated: The circumference of the horns is one-fourth of the vajra.

original: phyi rol gyi rva rnams kyi sum cha ni 'og go //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rva rnams kyi sum cha ni 'og go //
translated: One-third of the outer horns is below.

original: steng du cha gnyis pa ni rgya shug gi tsher ma lta bu ste steng dbus la bsres pas sbyor ba'o zhes pa ni zum pa'o //
analyzed: steng du cha gnyis pa ni rgya shug gi tsher ma lta bu ste steng dbus la bsres pas sbyor ba'o zhes pa ni zum pa'o //
translated: The upper half is like the thorn of a jujube tree, and by mixing it with the center above, it is the union, which is the closing.

original: rnam par gyes pa la rtse mo rnam par bye ba bya'o //🔽dril bu'i zhal rnams de bzhin zhes pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi thig le rnam par dag pa byams pa la sogs pa'i gnas kyis rdo rje la zhal bzhi ji lta ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi rdul gyi thig le'i chos dang
analyzed: rnam par gyes pa la rtse mo rnam par bye ba bya'o // dril bu'i zhal rnams de bzhin zhes pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi thig le rnam par dag pa byams pa la sogs pa'i gnas kyis rdo rje la zhal bzhi ji lta ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi rdul gyi thig le'i chos dang
translated: In the case of the separation, the peak should be divided.🔽The faces of the bell are like that, which is to say that just as the vajra has four faces in the places of Maitreya and so forth, which are the purities of the bindus of body, speech, mind, and gnosis,

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi rnam par dag pas zhal bzhi bya'o zhes pa ni rigs pa ste gcig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi rnam par dag pas zhal bzhi bya'o zhes pa ni rigs pa ste gcig go //
translated: the wisdom bell should have four faces, which are the purities of the four doors of liberation, such as emptiness and so forth, which are the phenomena of the bindu of the dust of wisdom.🔽This is the reasoning of the first.

original: gnyis pa ni nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can zhes pa k'a li gsal byed kyi chos brjod du med pa ste dbyangs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can zhes pa k'a li gsal byed kyi chos brjod du med pa ste dbyangs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is the day, the transcendent state of the vajra holder, which is the inexpressible phenomenon of the vowels, because there are no vowels.

original: des na rdo rje'i lte ba la zhal med do //
analyzed: des na rdo rje'i lte ba la zhal med do //
translated: Therefore, the vajra has no face in the center.

original: mtshan mo shes rab rab tu grags zhes pa ni a'a li dbyangs kyi chos te des na brjod pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma'i zhal gcig go zhes pa ni rdo rje dril bu la grub pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo shes rab rab tu grags zhes pa ni a'a li dbyangs kyi chos te des na brjod pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma'i zhal gcig go zhes pa ni rdo rje dril bu la grub pa'o //
translated: The night is Prajna, well known, is the Dharma of the vowels. Therefore, because of the nature of expression, the Bhagavati has one face. This is the accomplishment of the vajra bell.

original: da ni mchod rten gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa gsung ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste gsang ba'i chu skyes mdzod spu'i mtha' yi cha yis zhes pa sor lnga bcu rnams kyis mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i mchod rten dpangs kyi tshad do //
analyzed: da ni mchod rten gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa gsung ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste gsang ba'i chu skyes mdzod spu'i mtha' yi cha yis zhes pa sor lnga bcu rnams kyis mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i mchod rten dpangs kyi tshad do //
translated: Now, the characteristics of the stupa are stated, beginning with the secret lotus, and so forth. The measure of the height of the stupa of the supreme Victor is by fifty finger lengths, with the tip of the point of the secret lotus.

original: de yi phyed kyis zhes pa nyi shu rtsa lngas gdan gyi rgya ste sa bzhin du gru bzhi pa shin tu mnyam pa ste thad ka'i chas so //
analyzed: de yi phyed kyis zhes pa nyi shu rtsa lngas gdan gyi rgya ste sa bzhin du gru bzhi pa shin tu mnyam pa ste thad ka'i chas so //
translated: The breadth of the seat is by twenty-five, half of that, with a square base like the earth, very even, with a square measure.

original: de yi sum chas phyogs cha rnams zhes pa ni sor sum @280b cha dang bcas pa'i sor brgyad rnams te sor byed dang gnyis phyir 'bur ba'o //
analyzed: de yi sum chas phyogs cha rnams zhes pa ni sor sum @280b cha dang bcas pa'i sor brgyad rnams te sor byed dang gnyis phyir 'bur ba'o //
translated: The sides are by one-third of that, with eight finger lengths and a half,two finger lengths protruding.

original: gdan de'i steng gi padma'i phyir 'bur ba dang thugs khar gnas pa'i khor yug gi phyir 'bur ba yang tshad de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gdan de'i steng gi padma'i phyir 'bur ba dang thugs khar gnas pa'i khor yug gi phyir 'bur ba yang tshad de nyid kyis so //
translated: The outer protrusion of the lotus on that seat and the outer protrusion of the surrounding wall located in the heart are the same size.

original: thugs khar gnas pa'i khor yug tu gyur pa de bzhin du zlum po'i padma yang ste gdan gyi tshad kyis so ;
analyzed: thugs khar gnas pa'i khor yug tu gyur pa de bzhin du zlum po'i padma yang ste gdan gyi tshad kyis so ;
translated: The round lotus in the heart is the same as the seat.

original: / gzhi dang mnyam pa'i padma'i mtha' yi chas dman pa ste sor phyed dang gnyis bcum pa'i khog pa zlum po'o //
analyzed: / gzhi dang mnyam pa'i padma'i mtha' yi chas dman pa ste sor phyed dang gnyis bcum pa'i khog pa zlum po'o //
translated: The lotus is reduced by half an inch and two finger breadths at the edge of the base.

original: de yi phyogs cha yis kyang mgrin pa'o zhes pa ni thad dka'i tshad kyis sor brgyad dang sum cha'o //
analyzed: de yi phyogs cha yis kyang mgrin pa'o zhes pa ni thad dka'i tshad kyis sor brgyad dang sum cha'o //
translated: The neck is by its side, that is, by the width, eight finger breadths and three-fourths.

original: dpangs kyi tshad ni sor bzhi'o //
analyzed: dpangs kyi tshad ni sor bzhi'o //
translated: The height is four finger breadths.

original: gdan gyi phyed kyi cha yis gdong ste zhes pa ni thad ka'i char phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: gdan gyi phyed kyi cha yis gdong ste zhes pa ni thad ka'i char phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis kyis so //
translated: The face is by half the seat, that is, by twelve finger breadths in width.

original: de nyid ni gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni gru bzhi'o //
translated: That is the square.

original: de bzhin du mgrin pa ste sa bzhin shin tu mnyam pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mgrin pa ste sa bzhin shin tu mnyam pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The neck is the same, that is, very even like the ground.

original: gdong dang mgrin pa de yi sum cha ni phyogs bzhi'i cha'o //
analyzed: gdong dang mgrin pa de yi sum cha ni phyogs bzhi'i cha'o //
translated: The face and the throat are one-third of that.

original: mgrin pa'i phyogs kyi cha rnams ni sor phyed phyir 'bur ba ste gdong gi ni rkang pas dman pa'i sor gcig phyir 'bur pa'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa'i phyogs kyi cha rnams ni sor phyed phyir 'bur ba ste gdong gi ni rkang pas dman pa'i sor gcig phyir 'bur pa'o //
translated: The parts of the throat are half a finger breadth in height. The face is one finger breadth in height, less a quarter.

original: de ltar gsang ba'i padma dag las phyed bcas nyi mas zhes pa phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis kyis dpangs kyi tshad de shin tu mnyam par yang ni 'gyur zhes pa gru bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsang ba'i padma dag las phyed bcas nyi mas zhes pa phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis kyis dpangs kyi tshad de shin tu mnyam par yang ni 'gyur zhes pa gru bzhi pa'o //
translated: Thus, the height of the secret lotus is twelve finger breadths, together with half. It is very even, that is, square.

original: gdan gyi padma'i sngon mtshams zhes pa gdan gyi mthil nas lte ba'i padma'i mthar thug pa ste aa ba dh'u t'i'i gnas ji srid par phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi tshad do //
analyzed: gdan gyi padma'i sngon mtshams zhes pa gdan gyi mthil nas lte ba'i padma'i mthar thug pa ste aa ba dh'u t'i'i gnas ji srid par phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi tshad do //
translated: The lotus seat is from the base of the seat to the end of the navel lotus. The abode of the avadhūtī is twelve finger breadths, together with half.

original: de nas thugs kar gnas pa'i khor yug gi mthar yang phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi tshad do //
analyzed: de nas thugs kar gnas pa'i khor yug gi mthar yang phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi tshad do //
translated: Then, the circumference of the heart is twelve finger breadths, together with half.

original: de nas mgrin pa'i rtsa ba ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi tshad do //
analyzed: de nas mgrin pa'i rtsa ba ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bcu gnyis kyi tshad do //
translated: Then, the base of the throat is the measure of twelve finger-widths plus half.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo'i gnas de nas gdong gi mthar ni de bzhin zhes pa gdugs kyi phreng ba'i gnas kyi mthar thug pa de bzhin te mgrin pa sor bzhi dang ko sko nas zhal gyi gnas kyi mthar thug pa phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bzhi dang
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo'i gnas de nas gdong gi mthar ni de bzhin zhes pa gdugs kyi phreng ba'i gnas kyi mthar thug pa de bzhin te mgrin pa sor bzhi dang ko sko nas zhal gyi gnas kyi mthar thug pa phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bzhi dang
translated: From that place of the enjoyment wheel, up to the face, is “thus.” Up to the end of the place of the garland of parasols is thus: four finger-widths from the throat to the chin, and four finger-widths plus half from the chin to the place of the face.

original: de bzhin du sna bzang po'i gnas la sor bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sna bzang po'i gnas la sor bzhi'o //
translated: Similarly, the place of the excellent nose is four finger-widths.

original: de bzhin du spyi bo'i gnas su gdugs kyi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi bo'i gnas su gdugs kyi phreng ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the place of the crown is the garland of parasols.

original: de ltar na chu gter phyed bcas dus dang rig byed rnams kyis dum bu gsum zhes pa mgrin pa'i dang po nas gdong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na chu gter phyed bcas dus dang rig byed rnams kyis dum bu gsum zhes pa mgrin pa'i dang po nas gdong ngo //
translated: Thus, “the three sections are half the ocean” is from the first of the throat to the face.

original: gdan las zhes pa gdan gyi steng du padma'i gdan gyi dpangs ni rig byed dag gis zhes pa sor bzhis padma'o //
analyzed: gdan las zhes pa gdan gyi steng du padma'i gdan gyi dpangs ni rig byed dag gis zhes pa sor bzhis padma'o //
translated: “From the seat” is the height of the lotus seat above the seat, which is four finger-widths, as in the Vedas.

original: de bzhin du thugs khar gnas pa'i khor yug sor bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thugs khar gnas pa'i khor yug sor bzhi'o //
translated: Similarly, the circumference of the heart is four finger-widths.

original: mgrin pa'i tshad kyang de bzhin te sor bzhi @281a * //🔽rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mgrin pa'i tshad kyang de bzhin te sor bzhi @281a * // rnams kyis so //
translated: The measure of the neck is also like that, four finger-breadths.🔽The measure of the face is said to be eight finger-breadths, together with half.

original: phyed bcas brgyad kyis gdong pa'i tshad ces pa ni phyed dang bcas pa bzhis ko sgo nas zhal gyi mtha' dang bzhi bshal gyi mthar te de nas mdzod spu'i gnas smin ma'i dbus su'o //🔽de'i steng du dpral ba nas brtsams nas de yi steng du gdugs kyi phreng bar 'gyur ro mi yi dbang mdzod spu'i mtshams nas gdugs kyi phreng ba dang dpral ba dag dang spyi bo la ste de nas 'dir ni gtsug tor dag gi mthar thug 'di phyed dang
analyzed: phyed bcas brgyad kyis gdong pa'i tshad ces pa ni phyed dang bcas pa bzhis ko sgo nas zhal gyi mtha' dang bzhi bshal gyi mthar te de nas mdzod spu'i gnas smin ma'i dbus su'o // de'i steng du dpral ba nas brtsams nas de yi steng du gdugs kyi phreng bar 'gyur ro mi yi dbang mdzod spu'i mtshams nas gdugs kyi phreng ba dang dpral ba dag dang spyi bo la ste de nas 'dir ni gtsug tor dag gi mthar thug 'di phyed dang
translated: From the chin to the end of the mouth is four finger-breadths, and from the end of the mouth to the point between the eyebrows is four finger-breadths.🔽Above that, beginning from the forehead, there is the garland of parasols.

original: bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis so zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis so zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: From the point between the eyebrows to the forehead and crown of the head, and from there to the end of the ushnisha, is one half and twelve finger-breadths.

original: de ltar lhun po dang 'jig rten gyi khams ni mtha' dag rgyal ba'i sku ste mchod rten gyi dngos po ni lhun po'o //
analyzed: de ltar lhun po dang 'jig rten gyi khams ni mtha' dag rgyal ba'i sku ste mchod rten gyi dngos po ni lhun po'o //
translated: Thus, Mount Meru and the entire world system are the Victor's body, and the stupa is Mount Meru.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs sprul pa'i sku ste skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'o //

translated: Thus, beginning with the soles of the feet and ending with the usnisa, the thirty-two marks of a great person are mentioned in the Dharmasaṃgīti Sūtra, but not in the verses.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku dang mtshungs so //
translated: Thus, the origin of the world is like the emanation body of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams kyis bsod nams thob pa'i slad du rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams kyis bsod nams thob pa'i slad du rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Similarly, the colored powder mandala is for the sake of sentient beings obtaining merit.

original: nyi ma la sogs pa rnams g-yas skor du 'khor ba dang mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba'i slad du lhun po ji lta ba de bzhin du mchod rten mi yi yul du bstan to //
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa rnams g-yas skor du 'khor ba dang mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba'i slad du lhun po ji lta ba de bzhin du mchod rten mi yi yul du bstan to //
translated: Just as Meru is for the sake of the sun and so on circling to the right and for the sake of worshipping the stupa, so too is the stupa displayed in the human realm.

original: mchod pa la sogs pa bya ba'i slad du sangs rgyas ji lta bde bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan gyi sku'o //
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs pa bya ba'i slad du sangs rgyas ji lta bde bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan gyi sku'o //
translated: Just as the Buddha is for the sake of making offerings and so on, so too is the image of the Buddha.

original: de ltar bsod nams thob pa'i slad du kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams thob pa'i slad du kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the conventional truth is taught for the sake of obtaining merit.

original: 'dir dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ni gzhung mangs pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ma brjod de gang gis na thams cad las gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'dir dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ni gzhung mangs pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ma brjod de gang gis na thams cad las gsungs pas so //
translated: Here, the eighty minor marks are not mentioned for fear of verbosity, since they are mentioned in all the scriptures.

analyzed: da ni 'jig rten gyi khams su khams sna tshogs kyi rang @282a * // bzhin gsungs pa gser zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gser ni sa yi khams su 'gyur zhes pa gser ni sa'i rang bzhin ser po dang dngul ni chu'i rang bzhin dkar po dang zangs ni me'i rang bzhin dmar po dang lcags ni rlung gi rang bzhin nag
translated: Now, the natures of the various elements in the world are stated:

original: po dang zha nye dkar nag 'dres pa zhes pa ni ro dang lcags nam mkha'i mtshan nyid dang ye shes kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid de de ltar gser la sogs pa'i lcags drug go //
analyzed: po dang zha nye dkar nag 'dres pa zhes pa ni ro dang lcags nam mkha'i mtshan nyid dang ye shes kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid de de ltar gser la sogs pa'i lcags drug go //
translated: Gold and so on. Here, gold is the earth element. Gold is the nature of earth, yellow. Silver is the nature of water, white. Copper is the nature of fire, red. Iron is the nature of wind, black. Lead and tin are mixed white and black. These are the characteristics of the earth, water, fire, wind, space, and gnosis elements, respectively. Thus, there are six metals, gold and so on.

original: de bzhin du nor bu rin chen rnams te rin chen ser po ni sa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nor bu rin chen rnams te rin chen ser po ni sa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, there are precious gems. The yellow gem is the nature of earth.

original: dkar po ni chu'i rang bzhin dang dmar po ni me'i rang bzhin dang nag po ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang ljang khu ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin dang sngon po ni ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin te khams de rnams las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkar po ni chu'i rang bzhin dang dmar po ni me'i rang bzhin dang nag po ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang ljang khu ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin dang sngon po ni ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin te khams de rnams las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The white one is the nature of water, the red one is the nature of fire, the black one is the nature of wind, the green one is the nature of space, and the blue one is the nature of the element of pristine consciousness.

original: de bzhin du ro drug po rnams te lan tshva'i ro ni sa'i rang bzhin dang mngar ba ni chu'i rang bzhin dang tsha ba ni me'i rang bzhin dang kha ba ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang bska ba ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin dang skyur ba ni ye shes🔽kyi rang bzhin no /
analyzed: de bzhin du ro drug po rnams te lan tshva'i ro ni sa'i rang bzhin dang mngar ba ni chu'i rang bzhin dang tsha ba ni me'i rang bzhin dang kha ba ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang bska ba ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin dang skyur ba ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin no /
translated: Similarly, the six tastes: the salty taste is the nature of earth, the sweet taste is the nature of water, the hot taste is the nature of fire, the sour taste is the nature of wind, the astringent taste is the nature of space, and the bitter taste is the nature of pristine consciousness.

original: de bzhin du zhing gi rdo rnams dag gi skye gnas ni sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhing gi rdo rnams dag gi skye gnas ni sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the sources of the six sense bases are earth and so on.

original: de bzhin du sman rnams rnam pa drug gi ro rnams dang mchog gi ro zhes pa grub pa'i ro rnams dang khams rnams gzhan pa nor bu'i dbang po rnams zhes pa drug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du sman rnams rnam pa drug gi ro rnams dang mchog gi ro zhes pa grub pa'i ro rnams dang khams rnams gzhan pa nor bu'i dbang po rnams zhes pa drug go //
translated: Likewise, the medicines are the six tastes, the supreme tastes are the tastes of the accomplishments, and the elements are the six other than the jewel sense organs.

original: de bzhin du sa la sna tshogs reg pa rnams dang mtha' dag nad ni 'phrog pa nyid kyi chu rnams zhes pa rdo tshul sogs pa rnams ni rnam pa drug go zhes yang dag par ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa la sna tshogs reg pa rnams dang mtha' dag nad ni 'phrog pa nyid kyi chu rnams zhes pa rdo tshul sogs pa rnams ni rnam pa drug go zhes yang dag par ro //
translated: Likewise, the earth is the various textures, and the water is the entire taking away of disease, and so on, are the six.

original: da ni nor bu dang rin po che'i yon tan gsungs pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sa yi rigs kyi nor bu'am rin po ches zug gzer 'phrog par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ni nor bu dang rin po che'i yon tan gsungs pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sa yi rigs kyi nor bu'am rin po ches zug gzer 'phrog par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, the qualities of the jewel and the gem are stated by “and so on,” and so forth. Here, the jewel or gem of the family of earth will take away pain.

original: chu yi rigs ni drug 'phrog par byed pa dang me yi rigs ni 'byung po zhugs pa 'phrog par byed pa dang rlung gi rigs ni rengs pa 'phrog par byed pa dang stong pa'i rigs ni gdug pa'i lta ba lhung ba rab tu 'phrog par byed pa dang
analyzed: chu yi rigs ni drug 'phrog par byed pa dang me yi rigs ni 'byung po zhugs pa 'phrog par byed pa dang rlung gi rigs ni rengs pa 'phrog par byed pa dang stong pa'i rigs ni gdug pa'i lta ba lhung ba rab tu 'phrog par byed pa dang
translated: The water element seizes the six sense objects, the fire element seizes the demons that have entered, the wind element seizes paralysis, the space element seizes the fall into evil views,

original: ye shes kyi rigs ni skyon thams cad 'phrog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rigs ni skyon thams cad 'phrog par byed pa'o //
translated: and the wisdom element seizes all faults.

original: rin po che dang nor bu ji lta ba de bzhin du thun mong pa sbal ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mgo la skyes pa dang mi bdag rnams kyi lus la gnas pa'i nor bu yang skyon 'phrog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che dang nor bu ji lta ba de bzhin du thun mong pa sbal ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mgo la skyes pa dang mi bdag rnams kyi lus la gnas pa'i nor bu yang skyon 'phrog par byed pa'o //
translated: Just as a jewel or gem seizes faults, so also the jewel born on the heads of the common people such as frogs, and the jewel on the bodies of rulers, seize faults.

original: de ltar sa la sogs pa'i chos can gang dag brjod pa thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar sa la sogs pa'i chos can gang dag brjod pa thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Thus all things such as earth, which are described, have an inconceivable nature.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Thus the Buddha field is perfected.

original: 'di nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni go sla'o //
translated: The next two verses are easy to understand.

original: da ni chu srin la sogs pa'i khyim @282b rnams kyi rnag bzhin gsungs pa 'dir ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir chu srin ni rnam par shes pa dang stong pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang bum pa ni 'du byed dang rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin
analyzed: da ni chu srin la sogs pa'i khyim @282b rnams kyi rnag bzhin gsungs pa 'dir ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir chu srin ni rnam par shes pa dang stong pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang bum pa ni 'du byed dang rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin
translated: Here, Makara is the nature of consciousness and the space element, the pot is the nature of formation and the wind element,

original: dang nya ni tshor ba dang me'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang lug ni 'du shes dang chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang glang ni gzugs dang sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin te 'khrig pa ni ye shes kyi phung po dang ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dang nya ni tshor ba dang me'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang lug ni 'du shes dang chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang glang ni gzugs dang sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin te 'khrig pa ni ye shes kyi phung po dang ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: the fish is the nature of feeling and the fire element, the ram is the nature of discernment and the water element, and the bull is the nature of form and the earth element. Copulation is the nature of the aggregate of wisdom and the element of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du karka ta la sogs pa'i khyim rnams ni mtha'i lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams te lugs las bzlog pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du karka ta la sogs pa'i khyim rnams ni mtha'i lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams te lugs las bzlog pas so //
translated: Similarly, the houses of Cancer and so on are the natures of the ultimate, the connate, and so on, in reverse order.

original: chu srin la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi mtshan ma ni rdo rje la sogs pa ste rdo rje dang ral gri dang rin po che dang padma dang 'khor lo dang gri gug go //
analyzed: chu srin la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi mtshan ma ni rdo rje la sogs pa ste rdo rje dang ral gri dang rin po che dang padma dang 'khor lo dang gri gug go //
translated: The signs of these, Makara and so on, are the vajra and so on, that is, the vajra, sword, jewel, lotus, wheel, and flaying knife.

original: karka ta la sogs pa rnams kyi skyed pa'i rim pas lugs las bzlog pa rnams so //
analyzed: karka ta la sogs pa rnams kyi skyed pa'i rim pas lugs las bzlog pa rnams so //
translated: The order of Cancer and so on is reversed, because of the order of their generation.

original: ka'i sde pa la sogs pa rnams ni chu srin la sogs pa rnams kyi ka tsa ta pa ta sa rnams dang karka ta la sogs pa rnams kyi thakna man nyang la sogs pa 'jig rten khams kyi le'u las gsungs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ka'i sde pa la sogs pa rnams ni chu srin la sogs pa rnams kyi ka tsa ta pa ta sa rnams dang karka ta la sogs pa rnams kyi thakna man nyang la sogs pa 'jig rten khams kyi le'u las gsungs pa rnams so //
translated: The Ka group and so on are the Kas, CAs, TAs, PAS, and SAs of Makara and so on, and the THAs, Dhas, and so on, of Cancer and so on, as stated in the chapter on the world systems.

original: ring po thung du lhag pa'i lha zhes pa ne dbyangs ring pos phye ba ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed brgya brgyad cu ste de bzhin du dbyangs thung dus phye ba rnams so //
analyzed: ring po thung du lhag pa'i lha zhes pa ne dbyangs ring pos phye ba ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed brgya brgyad cu ste de bzhin du dbyangs thung dus phye ba rnams so //
translated: The long and short vowels are the long and short vowels of the one hundred and eight consonants, such as the letter Ka, and so on.

original: da ni gza' rnams kyi skye ba'i khyim gsungs pa lug ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir grangs bzhin du lug dang 'khrig pa dang karka ta ra ni ri bong can dang pa sangs dang nyi ma byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: da ni gza' rnams kyi skye ba'i khyim gsungs pa lug ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir grangs bzhin du lug dang 'khrig pa dang karka ta ra ni ri bong can dang pa sangs dang nyi ma byung bar gyur to //
translated: Now he mentions the houses of the birth of the planets: Aries, etc. Here, in order, Aries, Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Pisces are the houses of the moon, Venus, Mercury, Jupiter, Mars, Saturn, Rahu, Ketu, the sun, the moon, Mars, and Mercury, respectively.

original: seng ger sa skyes dang bu mor phur bu dang srang du skrag can dang sdig par gza' lag dang gzhu'i thog mar spen pa dang de'i mtha' mar mjug rings so //
analyzed: seng ger sa skyes dang bu mor phur bu dang srang du skrag can dang sdig par gza' lag dang gzhu'i thog mar spen pa dang de'i mtha' mar mjug rings so //
translated: In Leo, Jupiter; in Virgo, Mercury; in Libra, Venus; in Scorpio, the moon; in Sagittarius, Mars; in Capricorn, Saturn; in Aquarius, Rahu; in Pisces, Ketu.

original: de bzhin du bum par ri byi ste glang du brtan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bum par ri byi ste glang du brtan pa'o //
translated: Similarly, in Aries, Mercury; in Taurus, Jupiter.

original: de ltar sngar brjod pa'i rim pas sa la sogs pa'i khams zhes pa rdul phra rab kyi tshogs kyi gtso bo'i dngos po la phal pa'i dngos po kun nas phan tshun sbyor ba ste kun 'byung gi chos kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sngar brjod pa'i rim pas sa la sogs pa'i khams zhes pa rdul phra rab kyi tshogs kyi gtso bo'i dngos po la phal pa'i dngos po kun nas phan tshun sbyor ba ste kun 'byung gi chos kyi phyir ro //
translated: Thus, in the order mentioned above, the elements earth, etc., which are the principal substances of the collection of atoms, are the universal substances, because they are the origin of all mutual combinations.

original: 'gro ba 'di ni sems rnams kyi las kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te gang zhig rin chen kun gyis rab tu gang ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di ni sems rnams kyi las kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te gang zhig rin chen kun gyis rab tu gang ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: This world is of the nature of the karma of sentient beings. The world of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas is filled with all jewels.

original: da ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi mthu gsungs pa 'di lta ste /🔽gang dag sa la dpag bsam shing dang ro dang mchog gi ro dang sman dang lha yi ro yi dbang po gzhan /
analyzed: da ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi mthu gsungs pa 'di lta ste / gang dag sa la dpag bsam shing dang ro dang mchog gi ro dang sman dang lha yi ro yi dbang po gzhan /
translated: Now the power of karma of sentient beings is stated:

original: mtha' dag nad 'phrog rdul phran rnams kyis rab tu skyed pa de rnams sems can rnams kyis bsod nams @283a * //
analyzed: mtha' dag nad 'phrog rdul phran rnams kyis rab tu skyed pa de rnams sems can rnams kyis bsod nams @283a * //
translated: The wish-fulfilling trees, the supreme tastes, the medicines, the divine tastes, and other sense objects that arise from atoms on the earth

original: ma yin pa'i dbang gis mi mthong ste gang zhig phal pa'i rtsva dang shing dang chu dang rdul dang rdo ba dang ni lcags rnams mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i dbang gis mi mthong ste gang zhig phal pa'i rtsva dang shing dang chu dang rdul dang rdo ba dang ni lcags rnams mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: are not seen by sentient beings due to their non-meritorious karma. They see only ordinary grass, trees, water, dust, stones, and metals.

original: yi dags rnams kyis chu bo la sogs pa rnams su chu ni me 'bar ba'i rang bzhin du mthong ngo //
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyis chu bo la sogs pa rnams su chu ni me 'bar ba'i rang bzhin du mthong ngo //
translated: The hungry ghosts see water, etc. as having the nature of burning fire.

original: dmyal bar song ba'i mi rnams kyi sdig pa'i dbang gis gcod pa dang 'bigs pa'i mdung la sogs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: dmyal bar song ba'i mi rnams kyi sdig pa'i dbang gis gcod pa dang 'bigs pa'i mdung la sogs par mthong ngo //
translated: The weapons such as swords and spears that are seen in hell are due to the power of the sins of the people who have gone there.

original: da ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa gsungs pa 'di rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste sems can 'di rnams dgrol pa'i slad du bsod nams 'byung ba'i dus su sras dang bcas pa rgyal ba'i bdag po zhes pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang bcas pa'i sangs rgyas
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa gsungs pa 'di rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste sems can 'di rnams dgrol pa'i slad du bsod nams 'byung ba'i dus su sras dang bcas pa rgyal ba'i bdag po zhes pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang bcas pa'i sangs rgyas
translated: Now, the emanations of the Buddha are stated beginning with “these” and so forth. In order to liberate these sentient beings, at the time of the arising of merit, the Lord of Conquerors together with his sons, the bodhisattvas,

original: bcom ldan 'das las kyi sar ni rab zhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las kyi sar ni rab zhugs te /
translated: the Bhagavān enters the stage of activity,

original: sems can gdul ba'i slad du mngal ni rab tu gzung ba mdzad cing mchog gi thugs rje dag gis byang chub bskyed pa mdzad nas ni //
analyzed: sems can gdul ba'i slad du mngal ni rab tu gzung ba mdzad cing mchog gi thugs rje dag gis byang chub bskyed pa mdzad nas ni //
translated: and in order to tame sentient beings, he takes up a womb, and having generated enlightenment through supreme compassion,

original: nyon mongs dang ni bdud rnams bcom nas sa yi steng gi gnas su chos kyi 'khor lo rab bskor te //
analyzed: nyon mongs dang ni bdud rnams bcom nas sa yi steng gi gnas su chos kyi 'khor lo rab bskor te //
translated: he conquers the afflictions and māras, and on the surface of the earth, he turns the wheel of dharma.

original: sprul pa sgyu ma mdzad nas slar yang bcom ldan 'das ni dag pa'i sku can de nyid kho na ji ltar byon pa de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa sgyu ma mdzad nas slar yang bcom ldan 'das ni dag pa'i sku can de nyid kho na ji ltar byon pa de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: Having performed the magical emanation, the Blessed One, who has a pure body, is just as he was before, the Tathagata.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa sgyu ma dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin ni sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyi dbang dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i dbang gis rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa sgyu ma dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin ni sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyi dbang dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i dbang gis rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of the Buddha's magical emanation and nirvana is seen due to the power of sentient beings' merit and non-merit. This is the conclusion.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nas gzhan tshigs su bcad pa bdun ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nas gzhan tshigs su bcad pa bdun ni go sla'o //
translated: The seven verses from here on are easy to understand.

original: da ni ro chen po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa bsreg bya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni ro chen po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa bsreg bya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the characteristics of the great corpse and so on are stated, beginning with the burnt offering.

original: 'dir m'a kshi ka ni ro chen po dang sa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dir m'a kshi ka ni ro chen po dang sa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Here, makshaka is the great corpse and the nature of earth.

original: dang yig gis ro chen po'o //
analyzed: dang yig gis ro chen po'o //
translated: The syllable da is the great corpse.

original: dri ma med pa ni chu'i rang bzhin dang tud  tha ka ni me'i rang bzhin dang g-yo ba ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang ras ka ni stong pa'i rang bzhin dang ri bong can dang mtshal ni ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin te ro chen po
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni chu'i rang bzhin dang tud  tha ka ni me'i rang bzhin dang g-yo ba ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang ras ka ni stong pa'i rang bzhin dang ri bong can dang mtshal ni ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin te ro chen po
translated: The stainless one is the nature of water, the turmeric is the nature of fire, the moving one is the nature of wind, the cloth is the nature of space, the rabbit and the lac are the nature of the element of pristine consciousness.🔽These are the seven great tastes.

original: bdun no // de nas nye ba'i ro rnams te k'a kshi ni mnyam pa zhes pa ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin dang k'a shis ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang mu zi ni lung gi khams kyi rang bzhin dang ldong ros ni me'i rang bzhin dang ba bla
analyzed: bdun no // de nas nye ba'i ro rnams te k'a kshi ni mnyam pa zhes pa ye shes kyi khams kyi rang bzhin dang k'a shis ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang mu zi ni lung gi khams kyi rang bzhin dang ldong ros ni me'i rang bzhin dang ba bla
translated: Then, the secondary tastes: the kāksi is the nature of the element of pristine consciousness, the kāśi is the nature of the element of space, the bitumen is the nature of the element of the scriptures, the red arsenic is the nature of fire, the🔽realgar is the nature of water, and the ochre is the nature of earth.

original: ni chu'i rang bzhin dang btsag ni sa'i rang bzhin te nye ba'i ro drug go //
analyzed: ni chu'i rang bzhin dang btsag ni sa'i rang bzhin te nye ba'i ro drug go //
translated: These are the six secondary tastes.

original: de nas lan tshva lnga ste ze tshe dang rgya mtsho las byung ba @283b dang rgyam tsha dang kha ru tsha dang thab tsha rnams rim pa bzhin du sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas lan tshva lnga ste ze tshe dang rgya mtsho las byung ba @283b dang rgyam tsha dang kha ru tsha dang thab tsha rnams rim pa bzhin du sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Then, the five salts: black salt, sea salt, rock salt, brown salt, and sand salt, which are respectively of the nature of earth, etc.

original: de nas 'gyur byed lnga ste /
analyzed: de nas 'gyur byed lnga ste /
translated: Then, the five salts:

original: na ba s'a ra dang ya baksh'a ra dang sa da dzi ka ksh'a ra dang tshal dang k'a tsa'i lan tshva'i 'gyur byed rnams grang bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: na ba s'a ra dang ya baksh'a ra dang sa da dzi ka ksh'a ra dang tshal dang k'a tsa'i lan tshva'i 'gyur byed rnams grang bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: navasara, yavakshara, sahajika, kshara, tshaka, and kachhalana, which are respectively of the nature of space, etc.

original: de nas chu lnga ste rdo'i chu ni sa'i rang bzhin dang zla ba'i chu ni chu'i rang bzhin dang tsha ba'i chu ni me'i rang bzhin dang dug gi chu ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang gri gug gi chu ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas chu lnga ste rdo'i chu ni sa'i rang bzhin dang zla ba'i chu ni chu'i rang bzhin dang tsha ba'i chu ni me'i rang bzhin dang dug gi chu ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang gri gug gi chu ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Then, the five waters: stone water is of the nature of earth, moon water is of the nature of water, hot water is of the nature of fire, poison water is of the nature of wind, and razor water is of the nature of space.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste //
translated: That is also threefold:

original: reg pa'i gri gug dang grib ma'i gri gug dang sgra'i gri gug ste sgrub pa po gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa'i gri gug dang grib ma'i gri gug dang sgra'i gri gug ste sgrub pa po gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knife of touch, the knife of shadow, and the knife of sound, because they cut the adept.

original: de nas dug lnga ste gla sgang ser po ni sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang sha ga tu ka ni chu'i rang bzhin dang rva can ni me'i rang bzhin dang dug nag po ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang nag po brtsegs pa ni stong pa'i rang bzhin no
analyzed: de nas dug lnga ste gla sgang ser po ni sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin dang sha ga tu ka ni chu'i rang bzhin dang rva can ni me'i rang bzhin dang dug nag po ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang nag po brtsegs pa ni stong pa'i rang bzhin no
translated: Then, the five poisons: yellow aconite is of the nature of the earth element, datura is of the nature of water, aconite is of the nature of fire, black aconite is of the nature of wind, and kṛṣṇa is of the nature of space.

original: // gzhan pa nye ba'i dug ni rnam pa lnga po rig par bya zhes pa la rdo rje can ni sa'i rang bzhin dang aar ka ni chu'i rang bzhin dang dha du ra ni me'i rang bzhin dang lang ga l'i ni rlung gi rang bzhin te ka ra b'i
analyzed: // gzhan pa nye ba'i dug ni rnam pa lnga po rig par bya zhes pa la rdo rje can ni sa'i rang bzhin dang aar ka ni chu'i rang bzhin dang dha du ra ni me'i rang bzhin dang lang ga l'i ni rlung gi rang bzhin te ka ra b'i
