translated: The other secondary poisons are to be known as the five types. The vajra is of the nature of earth, arka is of the nature of water, dhatūra is of the nature of fire, laṅgali is of the nature of wind, and karavīra

original: ra ni stong pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ra ni stong pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: is of the nature of space.

original: 'dir sa la zhing gi rdo ba dang srog gi ngo bo sna tshogs pa dang 'bras bu'i dbyibs sna tshogs pa dang dung la sogs pa'i gzugs sna tshogs de rnams kyang rnam pa drug ste gang gis na khams de rnams las lcags rnam pa drug tu 'gyur pa'o
analyzed: 'dir sa la zhing gi rdo ba dang srog gi ngo bo sna tshogs pa dang 'bras bu'i dbyibs sna tshogs pa dang dung la sogs pa'i gzugs sna tshogs de rnams kyang rnam pa drug ste gang gis na khams de rnams las lcags rnam pa drug tu 'gyur pa'o
translated: By what means do those elements become the six kinds of iron?

original: // 'ga' zhig las gser du 'gyur zhing de bzhin du gzhan rnams las dngul la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // 'ga' zhig las gser du 'gyur zhing de bzhin du gzhan rnams las dngul la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: From some, gold arises, and similarly from others, silver and so on arise.

original: lhang tsher skyes ni rnam pa bzhi zhes pa ste lhang tsher ser po'i lcags ni sa'i rang bzhin dang dkar bo'i ni chu'i rang bzhin dang dmar po'i ni me'i rang bzhin dang nag po'i ni rlung gi rang bzhin te de bzhin du lha'i lcags kyang ngo //
analyzed: lhang tsher skyes ni rnam pa bzhi zhes pa ste lhang tsher ser po'i lcags ni sa'i rang bzhin dang dkar bo'i ni chu'i rang bzhin dang dmar po'i ni me'i rang bzhin dang nag po'i ni rlung gi rang bzhin te de bzhin du lha'i lcags kyang ngo //
translated: The iron born from salt is of four kinds. The yellow iron born from salt has the nature of earth, the white has the nature of water, the red has the nature of fire, and the black has the nature of wind. Similarly, the divine iron also has four kinds.

original: de bzhin du rdo khab len gyi lcags te 'khor byed kyi ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang sbyor byed kyi ni sa'i rang bzhin dang 'dren byed kyi ni me'i rang bzhin dang 'ju byed kyi ni chu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo khab len gyi lcags te 'khor byed kyi ni rlung gi rang bzhin dang sbyor byed kyi ni sa'i rang bzhin dang 'dren byed kyi ni me'i rang bzhin dang 'ju byed kyi ni chu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, the nature of the wind that moves is that of a magnet, the nature of the wind that joins is that of earth, the nature of the wind that draws is that of fire, and the nature of the wind that digests is that of water.

original: 'ju byed de rnams kyi rang bzhin sna tshogs pa ste 'ga' zhig ni rdo rje rnam par gnon pa zhes pa rdo rje 'ju bar byed pa dang lhang tsher 'ju bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'ju byed de rnams kyi rang bzhin sna tshogs pa ste 'ga' zhig ni rdo rje rnam par gnon pa zhes pa rdo rje 'ju bar byed pa dang lhang tsher 'ju bar byed pa'o //
translated: The nature of these digesting winds is various. Some are called vajra-crushers, which digest vajra, and some digest iron.

original: de bzhin du 'ga' zhig ni gser 'ju bar byed pa dang de bzhin du dngul dang zangs dang lcags rnams 'ju bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'ga' zhig ni gser 'ju bar byed pa dang de bzhin du dngul dang zangs dang lcags rnams 'ju bar byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, some digest gold, and some digest silver, copper, and iron.

original: @284a * // de rnams kyis nye bar sbyar bar bya ste de rnams las lcags blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: @284a * // de rnams kyis nye bar sbyar bar bya ste de rnams las lcags blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should apply them, but one should not take iron from them.

original: de la ro rnam pa gnyis te grub pa dang grub pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ro rnam pa gnyis te grub pa dang grub pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: There are two kinds of tastes: those that are accomplished and those that are not accomplished.

original: lcags la sogs pa rnams 'bugs pa ni grub pa ste sa 'og la sogs pa'i khung bu rnams na gnas pa'o //🔽gang zhig 'bugs byed min pa'i p'a ra dang dngul chu'i ro de ni lcags la sogs pa rnams bskol ba dang sa bon gyi bsgyur par gyur pa zhes pa zhes pa so sor bsgyur pa ni lcags la 'bugs shing rjes su 'bugs par 'gyur zhing zos pas mtha'
analyzed: lcags la sogs pa rnams 'bugs pa ni grub pa ste sa 'og la sogs pa'i khung bu rnams na gnas pa'o // gang zhig 'bugs byed min pa'i p'a ra dang dngul chu'i ro de ni lcags la sogs pa rnams bskol ba dang sa bon gyi bsgyur par gyur pa zhes pa zhes pa so sor bsgyur pa ni lcags la 'bugs shing rjes su 'bugs par 'gyur zhing zos pas mtha'
translated: The penetration of iron and so forth is accomplished, that is, it is present in holes in the earth and so forth.

original: dag nad 'phrog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dag nad 'phrog par 'gyur te /
translated: The taste of mercury and so forth that is not penetrating, that is, that is not penetrating iron and so forth, is transformed by boiling and by the seed transformation. The individual transformation is that iron and so forth are penetrated and followed, and by eating it all disease is removed.

original: rul pa'i lcags ni rnam par spangs nas so zhes pa ni zha nye dang gsha' tshe ma gtogs par gser la sogs pa zhu bar gyur pa'o zhes pa ste de ltar ro dang nye ba'i ro la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rul pa'i lcags ni rnam par spangs nas so zhes pa ni zha nye dang gsha' tshe ma gtogs par gser la sogs pa zhu bar gyur pa'o zhes pa ste de ltar ro dang nye ba'i ro la sogs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned rotten iron, that is, having abandoned gold and so forth that has been melted except for tin and lead, the taste and the near taste and so forth are ascertained.

original: m'a kshi ka la sogs pa 'di rnams thams cad ro brjod pa'i gzhung la sogs pa'i cho gas sbyang bar bya ste de nas gsungs pa'i las la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: m'a kshi ka la sogs pa 'di rnams thams cad ro brjod pa'i gzhung la sogs pa'i cho gas sbyang bar bya ste de nas gsungs pa'i las la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: All of these, the makṣika and so forth, should be purified by the method of the text that describes the taste and so forth, and then they should be applied to the stated action.

original: gzhan du nam dag pa'i ro dang nye ba'i ro rnams kyis ni rdzas nyams par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du nam dag pa'i ro dang nye ba'i ro rnams kyis ni rdzas nyams par byed do //
translated: Otherwise, the impure and proximate essences will destroy the substance.

original: de bzhin du gser dang dngul gyi nang du gser dang dngul gyi dgra rnams kyang sbyin par mi bya ste gser dang dngul gyi bya ba la grogs po sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gser dang dngul gyi nang du gser dang dngul gyi dgra rnams kyang sbyin par mi bya ste gser dang dngul gyi bya ba la grogs po sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not give the enemies of gold and silver to the work of gold and silver; one should give friends to the work of gold and silver.

original: lcags bsad pa la ni bstan bcos nas gsungs pa'i rnam pas dgra bo rnams sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: lcags bsad pa la ni bstan bcos nas gsungs pa'i rnam pas dgra bo rnams sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In the case of killing iron, one should give enemies in the manner taught in the treatises.

original: de bzhin du zangs dang rnon po ma dag pa yang gser dang dngul la sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zangs dang rnon po ma dag pa yang gser dang dngul la sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not give impure copper and sharp iron to gold and silver.

original: zha nye dang gsha' tshe ma bsad pa ni gang du yang sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zha nye dang gsha' tshe ma bsad pa ni gang du yang sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not give unkilled lead and tin anywhere.

original: gsad pa'i lcags gdul ba la ni ma langs pa'i lcags gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: gsad pa'i lcags gdul ba la ni ma langs pa'i lcags gsad par bya'o //
translated: In the case of subduing killed iron, one should kill unkilled iron.

original: zangs la sogs pa srog dang bcas pa gdul ba la ni dgra bo ro chen po dang nye ba'i ro byin nas gdul bar bya'o //
analyzed: zangs la sogs pa srog dang bcas pa gdul ba la ni dgra bo ro chen po dang nye ba'i ro byin nas gdul bar bya'o //
translated: In the case of subduing copper and so on that have life, one should subdue them after giving enemies, a great corpse and a proximate corpse.

original: dngul dang gser la grogs po'i zhes pa ni sa bon gyi bya ba la'o //
analyzed: dngul dang gser la grogs po'i zhes pa ni sa bon gyi bya ba la'o //
translated: The line silver and gold are friends refers to the action of the seed.🔽Now, the nature of the corpse is stated beginning with first.

original: da ni ro'i rang bzhin gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dang por du ba'i rang bzhin dag gis 'gro ste me la gnas shing bskol ba gang yin pa de ni rim pa yis sgra byas nas 'gro ba @284b ni byis pa dang 'phar
analyzed: da ni ro'i rang bzhin gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dang por du ba'i rang bzhin dag gis 'gro ste me la gnas shing bskol ba gang yin pa de ni rim pa yis sgra byas nas 'gro ba @284b ni byis pa dang 'phar
translated: Here, first, the nature of smoke moves, abiding in fire and boiling. That which is boiled gradually makes sound and moves.

original: bas 'gro ba ni gzhon nu dang rab tu 'dar bas 'gro ba ni dar la bab pa dang 'dar ba med pa ni rgan po ste gang gi tshe 'bugs pa dang rjes su 'bugs par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bas 'gro ba ni gzhon nu dang rab tu 'dar bas 'gro ba ni dar la bab pa dang 'dar ba med pa ni rgan po ste gang gi tshe 'bugs pa dang rjes su 'bugs par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The child moves with jumping, the youth moves with trembling, the adult moves without trembling. When there is piercing and counter-piercing,

original: 'dir sgra ldan byis pa ni lcags 'bugs par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sgra ldan byis pa ni lcags 'bugs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: here the child with sound does not pierce the iron.

original: 'phar ldan yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phar ldan yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor does the jumper.

original: 'on kyang gzhon nu ni 'dab ma la byugs pa dang me 'jam pos cung zad 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhon nu ni 'dab ma la byugs pa dang me 'jam pos cung zad 'jug par byed do //
translated: However, the youth anoints the leaf and slightly penetrates with gentle fire.

original: de ltar byis pa ni 'dab ma la byugs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar byis pa ni 'dab ma la byugs pas so //
translated: Thus, the child anoints the leaf.

original: gzhon nu yang kong bu kha bcad kyis so //
analyzed: gzhon nu yang kong bu kha bcad kyis so //
translated: Youth is pierced by the wick.

original: lang tsho ni mdung gis 'bugs pas so //
analyzed: lang tsho ni mdung gis 'bugs pas so //
translated: Adolescence is pierced by the spear.

original: rgan po ni ji ltar 'dod pas 'bugs pas so //
analyzed: rgan po ni ji ltar 'dod pas 'bugs pas so //
translated: Old age is pierced by the iron.

original: de ltar sgra ldan 'phar ldan yang 'bugs par byed pa yin te de yang dang po gang zhig du ba'i 'gro ba can ni 'dab ma 'bugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgra ldan 'phar ldan yang 'bugs par byed pa yin te de yang dang po gang zhig du ba'i 'gro ba can ni 'dab ma 'bugs par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, the one with sound and wings is also pierced. Moreover, the one who has the movement of smoke pierces the leaf.

original: 'dar ba dang bcas pa ni mdung gis 'bugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dar ba dang bcas pa ni mdung gis 'bugs par byed pa'o //
translated: The one with trembling pierces with a spear.

original: de yang rnam gsum 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sgyur byed rnams kyis bsgyur par gyur pa ni rgan por 'gyur te de ni ji ltar 'dod par lcags 'bugs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ro'i yon tan gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam gsum 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sgyur byed rnams kyis bsgyur par gyur pa ni rgan por 'gyur te de ni ji ltar 'dod par lcags 'bugs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ro'i yon tan gyi nges pa'o //
translated: And that one, having been changed by the changers that will be explained in three ways, becomes old. That one is pierced by the iron as desired. This is the determination of the qualities of taste.

original: da ni sman gyi yon tan gsungs pa mchog gis zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ro'i bstan bcos tham cad las rdo rje rnam par gnod pa reg pa dang mchog gi sman gyi sbyor ba las ro dang lhang tshor kha med par rgyu'i zhes pa'o //
analyzed: da ni sman gyi yon tan gsungs pa mchog gis zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ro'i bstan bcos tham cad las rdo rje rnam par gnod pa reg pa dang mchog gi sman gyi sbyor ba las ro dang lhang tshor kha med par rgyu'i zhes pa'o //
translated: Now, the qualities of the medicine are stated, beginning with “the best,” and so forth. Here, “all the treatises on poison” means that from the application of the supreme medicine Vajra-vidāraṇa, the poison and the metal are melted without a trace.

original: des na rdo rje dang lhang tsher 'ju bar byed pa'i rdo rnams te de rnams kyi rig pa dang bi da yis so //
analyzed: des na rdo rje dang lhang tsher 'ju bar byed pa'i rdo rnams te de rnams kyi rig pa dang bi da yis so //
translated: Therefore, the “metals” are the metals that melt the Vajra and the metal. Their “knowledge” is the knowledge of the vidyā and the vidyā.

original: mchog gi sman ni ro'i sman 'chad par 'gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: mchog gi sman ni ro'i sman 'chad par 'gyur pa rnams so //
translated: The “supreme medicine” is the medicine of poison that will be explained.

original: de rnams kyi stobs dang ldan par rab tu 'gyur te lhang tshe la sogs pa'i lcags rnams thams cad bzhu ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi stobs dang ldan par rab tu 'gyur te lhang tshe la sogs pa'i lcags rnams thams cad bzhu ba'o //
translated: They become “powerful,” and all the metals such as the metal of poison and so on are melted.

original: su zhig ces pa ste mchog gi sman de rnams med nas yi steng gi gnas su dngul chu'i da yi bcing ba dbul ba dang nang 'phrog par byed pa dag ni gang zhig byed /
analyzed: su zhig ces pa ste mchog gi sman de rnams med nas yi steng gi gnas su dngul chu'i da yi bcing ba dbul ba dang nang 'phrog par byed pa dag ni gang zhig byed /
translated: “Who” means that if those supreme medicines do not exist, who would make the binding and the internal theft of mercury in the abode of the sky?

original: bcings na mkha' la spyod pa nyid du 'gyur zhing de bzhin zos na mi rnams kyi 'chi ba dag kyang nyams par 'gyur te gang gi mthu las so //
analyzed: bcings na mkha' la spyod pa nyid du 'gyur zhing de bzhin zos na mi rnams kyi 'chi ba dag kyang nyams par 'gyur te gang gi mthu las so //
translated: If bound, it will become the one who moves in the sky. And likewise, if eaten, it will destroy the death of men, by whose power.

original: de phyir ye shes med na nad 'phrog par byed pa'i don du sa bdag rnams kyis ro yi dbang po 'di ni bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa @285a * //
analyzed: de phyir ye shes med na nad 'phrog par byed pa'i don du sa bdag rnams kyis ro yi dbang po 'di ni bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa @285a * //
translated: Therefore, if there is no knowledge, the lords of the earth should accomplish this sense organ of taste in order to steal the disease.

original: ro'i dbang po'i nges pa ste //
analyzed: ro'i dbang po'i nges pa ste //
translated: The ascertainment of the sense organ of taste.

original: go sla pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: go sla pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis kyang ngo //
translated: And by another verse that is easy to understand.🔽Now, the characteristics of the supreme medicine are stated: that which, by merely being applied...

original: da ni mchog gi sman gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa gang zhig byugs pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang zhig byugs pa tsam gyis 'phral la zangs kyi 'dab ma mer bcug pa'i dri ma 'phrog par byed pa ste mchog gi sman ro chen po dang mtshungs
analyzed: da ni mchog gi sman gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa gang zhig byugs pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang zhig byugs pa tsam gyis 'phral la zangs kyi 'dab ma mer bcug pa'i dri ma 'phrog par byed pa ste mchog gi sman ro chen po dang mtshungs
translated: Here, that which, by merely being applied, immediately steals the stain of a copper plate placed in fire, is the supreme medicine, equal to great taste.

original: pa zos pas mtha' dag nad 'phrog cing ro bcing ba'i slad du lcags kyi rigs 'ju bar byed pa de ni sa la skal ldan rnams kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa zos pas mtha' dag nad 'phrog cing ro bcing ba'i slad du lcags kyi rigs 'ju bar byed pa de ni sa la skal ldan rnams kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The iron family, which digests all the poisons and binds the tastes, is seen by the fortunate ones on earth.

original: sman gzhan dag rnams kyis dngul chu 'di yi bcing bar rab tu 'gyur pa gang yin pa ni nges par lo dus par zhes pa lo bcu gnyis 'dug pa dang bcas pa dang dgang ba dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sman gzhan dag rnams kyis dngul chu 'di yi bcing bar rab tu 'gyur pa gang yin pa ni nges par lo dus par zhes pa lo bcu gnyis 'dug pa dang bcas pa dang dgang ba dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The binding of this mercury by other medicines is definitely for twelve years, with the application of the container and the filling.

original: de ni bcings pa lhag par mi 'gyur te stong phag gcig 'bugs pa las lhag pa 'bugs par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bcings pa lhag par mi 'gyur te stong phag gcig 'bugs pa las lhag pa 'bugs par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: That binding does not increase, it does not increase beyond one thousand palas. This is the certainty.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las gzhan tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las gzhan tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ni go sla'o //
translated: The four verses other than this one are easy to understand.

original: da ni ro bsrung ba'i don du dzam bha la'i mchod pa gsungs pa khru phyed ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir khru phyed ces pa mtho gang tsam gyi gser gyi padma 'dab brgyad pa la lte bar snying po'i dbus su rdo rje dag pa gser gyi bcing
analyzed: da ni ro bsrung ba'i don du dzam bha la'i mchod pa gsungs pa khru phyed ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir khru phyed ces pa mtho gang tsam gyi gser gyi padma 'dab brgyad pa la lte bar snying po'i dbus su rdo rje dag pa gser gyi bcing
translated: Now, the worship of Jambhala is taught for the purpose of protecting the corpse, beginning with “half a cubit.” Here, “half a cubit” is an eight-petaled golden lotus about one handspan high, in the center of which, in the middle of the essence, a pure vajra is to be placed.

original: par bya'o // shar gyi 'dab ma la aindra r'i la dang lho'i 'dab ma la padma r'a ga dang nub tu rin chen kar ke ta ser po ste byang du rin chen zla ba chu shel lo //
analyzed: par bya'o // shar gyi 'dab ma la aindra r'i la dang lho'i 'dab ma la padma r'a ga dang nub tu rin chen kar ke ta ser po ste byang du rin chen zla ba chu shel lo //
translated: On the eastern petal is sapphire, on the southern petal is ruby, on the western petal is the precious karkeṭa gem, and on the northern petal is the precious moon crystal.

original: de bzhin du mer ron po bcing bar bya ste bden bral du zangs dang rlung du gser dang dbang ldan du dngul dang lte bar rdo rje'i steng du gser gyi lhang tsher gyi gdan gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mer ron po bcing bar bya ste bden bral du zangs dang rlung du gser dang dbang ldan du dngul dang lte bar rdo rje'i steng du gser gyi lhang tsher gyi gdan gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, a pigeon is to be placed in the southeast, copper in the southwest, gold in the northwest, and silver in the northeast. On the center of the vajra, a seat of a golden lotus is to be placed.

original: gang ni de'i steng du gser las byas pa'i dzam bha la phyag gnyis pa g-yon pa na ne'u le dang g-yas pa mchog sbyin pa ste gtsug tor gyi tshad kyis sor bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gang ni de'i steng du gser las byas pa'i dzam bha la phyag gnyis pa g-yon pa na ne'u le dang g-yas pa mchog sbyin pa ste gtsug tor gyi tshad kyis sor bzhi pa'o //
translated: On top of that, there is Jambhala made of gold, with two hands, holding a mongoose in the left hand and giving the boon-granting gesture with the right hand, four finger-widths in size, the size of the uṣṇīṣa.

original: de bzhin du 'dab ma rnams la gser las skyes pa'am dngul las skyes pa'i gnod sbyin mo brgyad rnams te padma dang mchog sbyin gyi phyag go //🔽'dir gal te dzam bha la dngul las skyes pa yin na de'i tshe gnod sbyin mo rnams gser @285b las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dab ma rnams la gser las skyes pa'am dngul las skyes pa'i gnod sbyin mo brgyad rnams te padma dang mchog sbyin gyi phyag go // 'dir gal te dzam bha la dngul las skyes pa yin na de'i tshe gnod sbyin mo rnams gser @285b las skyes pa'o //
translated: Similarly, on the petals there are eight yakṣiṇīs born from gold or born from silver, with lotus and boon-granting gestures.🔽Here, if Jambhala is born from silver, then the yakṣiṇīs are born from gold.

original: gang gi tshe dzam bha la gser las skyes pa yin na de'i tshe gnod sbyin mo rnams dngul las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dzam bha la gser las skyes pa yin na de'i tshe gnod sbyin mo rnams dngul las skyes pa'o //
translated: When Jambhala is born from gold, then the yakṣiṇīs are born from silver.

original: de bzhin du gang gi tshe gser gyi padma yin pa de'i tshe dngul gyi snod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi tshe gser gyi padma yin pa de'i tshe dngul gyi snod do //
translated: Similarly, when the lotus is golden, then the vessel is silver.

original: gang gi tshe snying por dngul gyi padma yin pa de'i tshe chu sbyin pa'i slad du gser gyi snod du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe snying por dngul gyi padma yin pa de'i tshe chu sbyin pa'i slad du gser gyi snod du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the lotus in the center is silver, then the vessel for giving water becomes golden.

original: cod pan sangs rgyas rin chen dbang po nor bu mchog sbyin phyag ste gnod sbyin mo rnams de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: cod pan sangs rgyas rin chen dbang po nor bu mchog sbyin phyag ste gnod sbyin mo rnams de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The crown is the jewel of the Buddha, the lord of jewels, the boon-granting jewel, the hand, and the yakshini.

original: de bzhin du shes rab dang bcas pa ste dzam bha la nor rgyun ma dang bcas pa ha l'a ha la lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab dang bcas pa ste dzam bha la nor rgyun ma dang bcas pa ha l'a ha la lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, with wisdom, that is, Jambhala with Vasudhara, like Hala hala.

original: lte ba la dzam bha la dang nor rgyun ma dag gi sa bon ham h'a:'o //
analyzed: lte ba la dzam bha la dang nor rgyun ma dag gi sa bon ham h'a:'o //
translated: At the navel, the seed of Jambhala and Vasudhara is ham ham.

original: de bzhin du shar gyi lha mo'i h'i:dang mer h'i:dag lhor dram dang bden bral du hr'i:dang byang du hu dang dbang ldan du h'u:dang nub tu hlim dang rlung du hl'ia'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar gyi lha mo'i h'i:dang mer h'i:dag lhor dram dang bden bral du hr'i:dang byang du hu dang dbang ldan du h'u:dang nub tu hlim dang rlung du hl'ia'o //
translated: Similarly, the hi hi of the eastern goddess, the hi hi in the southeast, the tram tram in the south, the hri hri in the southwest, the hu hu in the west, the hri hri in the northwest, the hrim hrim in the north, and the hlim hlim in the northeast.

original: sgrol ma dang reg bya rdo rje ma dang gos dkar mo dang ro rdo rje ma dang m'a ma k'i dang gzugs rdo rje ma dang spyan ma dang dri rdo rje ma ste rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ni nor rgyun ma'o //
analyzed: sgrol ma dang reg bya rdo rje ma dang gos dkar mo dang ro rdo rje ma dang m'a ma k'i dang gzugs rdo rje ma dang spyan ma dang dri rdo rje ma ste rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ni nor rgyun ma'o //
translated: Tara, Sparshavajra, Pandaravasini, Rasavajra, Mamaki, Rupavajra, Lochana, and Gandhavajra. Vasudhara is Vajradhatvihsvari.

original: rdzas kyi don du khams thams cad rin po che chen pos rgyas btab pa gtso bo dang bcas pa bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi don du khams thams cad rin po che chen pos rgyas btab pa gtso bo dang bcas pa bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: For the sake of substance, one should seal all the elements with great jewels, along with the principal one. This is the rule.

original: de nas dri dang spos dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis nyin zhag so sor thun mtshams gsum la dngul gyi snod du mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dri dang spos dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis nyin zhag so sor thun mtshams gsum la dngul gyi snod du mchod par bya'o //
translated: Then, with perfumes, incense, flowers, and so on, one should make offerings three times a day in a silver vessel.🔽Then, with this mantra, Oṃ Jambhala Jalenḍarāya svāhā,

original: de nas aom dzam bha la dza len dr'a ye sv'a h'a zhes pa'i sngags 'dis chu khyor ba brgya rtsa brgyad sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas aom dzam bha la dza len dr'a ye sv'a h'a zhes pa'i sngags 'dis chu khyor ba brgya rtsa brgyad sbyin par bya'o //
translated: one should offer one hundred and eight handfuls of water.

original: rab dga'i yid kyis gser 'gyur mkhan rnams dag gi ro ni bsrung ba'i don du chu sbyin par bya ste bsrung ba'i cho ga 'di yis 'byung po'i mgon po dang klu yi mgon po ste klu'i rgyal pos ro ni 'phrog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab dga'i yid kyis gser 'gyur mkhan rnams dag gi ro ni bsrung ba'i don du chu sbyin par bya ste bsrung ba'i cho ga 'di yis 'byung po'i mgon po dang klu yi mgon po ste klu'i rgyal pos ro ni 'phrog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: With a joyful mind, one should offer water for the sake of protecting the elixir of the alchemists. By this rite of protection, the lord of spirits and the lord of nāgas, the king of nāgas, will not steal the corpse.

original: de bzhin du gang dag ro 'phrog par byed pa'i lha min gzhan rnams kyis kyang ro 'phrog par mi 'gyur te rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bkas dzam bha la'i srung bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag ro 'phrog par byed pa'i lha min gzhan rnams kyis kyang ro 'phrog par mi 'gyur te rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bkas dzam bha la'i srung bas so //
translated: In the same way, the other demons who steal corpses will not steal the corpse, because of the protection of Jambhala by the order of the Vajra Holder.

original: da ni ro bzhi pa bsrungs pa pha gces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dang por so phag gi phye ma dang lan tshva byin nas b'i dza p'u ra la sogs pa'i skyur pos nyi ma bcu'i bar du ro mnye bar bya zhing bdug par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni ro bzhi pa bsrungs pa pha gces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dang por so phag gi phye ma dang lan tshva byin nas b'i dza p'u ra la sogs pa'i skyur pos nyi ma bcu'i bar du ro mnye bar bya zhing bdug par bya'o //
translated: Now, the protection of the fourth corpse, which is dear to the father, and so on, is as follows: Here, first, having given brick-powder and salt, the corpse should be anointed with sour milk, curd, and so on, and fumigated for ten days.

original: de bkrus shing ro bzung nas lhag ma bskams te @286a * //
analyzed: de bkrus shing ro bzung nas lhag ma bskams te @286a * //
translated: Having washed it and taken hold of the corpse, dry the remainder.

original: snyigs ma dag la gnas pa'i ro ni phyi nas slar yang ro de nyid la bsre bar bya'o //
analyzed: snyigs ma dag la gnas pa'i ro ni phyi nas slar yang ro de nyid la bsre bar bya'o //
translated: The corpse that is left with the dregs should be mixed again with that very corpse.

original: thams cad dus su'o zhes pa ni dngul chu mnyes pa'i snyigs mar gyur pa gang yin pa de mtha' dag dngul chu gzung ba'i slad du dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad dus su'o zhes pa ni dngul chu mnyes pa'i snyigs mar gyur pa gang yin pa de mtha' dag dngul chu gzung ba'i slad du dbye bar bya'o //
translated: All the time means that all the dregs that are left from the melting of the mercury should be separated for the sake of taking hold of the mercury.

original: slar yang zhes pa ro phye bar gyur pa la gal te ro ma phyed na de'i tshe snyigs ma de nyid las ro shi ba yang dag par bsregs nas gzung bar bya ste lcags gzhan dang lhan cig de yang bzhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang zhes pa ro phye bar gyur pa la gal te ro ma phyed na de'i tshe snyigs ma de nyid las ro shi ba yang dag par bsregs nas gzung bar bya ste lcags gzhan dang lhan cig de yang bzhu bar bya'o //
translated: Again, if the corpse is not opened, then one should take that very dregs, burn the corpse well, and melt it with another iron.

original: de la sbyangs pa'i dngul chu rang gi skye gnas za bar gyur na de ni slar yang gzhan lcags thams cad kyi skye gnas za'o //
analyzed: de la sbyangs pa'i dngul chu rang gi skye gnas za bar gyur na de ni slar yang gzhan lcags thams cad kyi skye gnas za'o //
translated: There, the refined mercury eats its own birthplace, and then again it eats the birthplace of all other irons.

original: da ni lcags thams cad bsres pa'i bzhu ba gsungs pa zha nye zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lcags rnams nyid kyis phan tshun 'ju bar byed do //
analyzed: da ni lcags thams cad bsres pa'i bzhu ba gsungs pa zha nye zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir lcags rnams nyid kyis phan tshun 'ju bar byed do //
translated: Now, the melting of the mixture of all irons is stated: lead, etc. Here, the irons themselves mutually melt.

original: des na bsres pa bya'o //
analyzed: des na bsres pa bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the mixture should be made.

original: zha nye rnon po dang ra gan dang zangs dang lhang tsher skyes zhes pa lhang tsher gyi lcags sam zhing las skyes pa rdo sna tshogs kyi lcags te rnon po la sogs pa'i gnas su rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: zha nye rnon po dang ra gan dang zangs dang lhang tsher skyes zhes pa lhang tsher gyi lcags sam zhing las skyes pa rdo sna tshogs kyi lcags te rnon po la sogs pa'i gnas su rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Sharp lead, brass, copper, and iron born from a swamp—iron born from a swamp or iron born from the field, various iron ores—are pure in the abode of sharpness, etc.

original: lcags lnga po 'di rnams cha mnyam pa gcig tu bsregs pa ni bsres pa'i lcags su 'gyur te gser gyi bya ba la'o //
analyzed: lcags lnga po 'di rnams cha mnyam pa gcig tu bsregs pa ni bsres pa'i lcags su 'gyur te gser gyi bya ba la'o //
translated: These five metals are melted together in equal parts and this is called the mixed metal, which is used for gold.

original: bcud len gyi bya ba la ni zha nye sbyin par mi bya ste lcags bzhi bsres pa bya'o //
analyzed: bcud len gyi bya ba la ni zha nye sbyin par mi bya ste lcags bzhi bsres pa bya'o //
translated: For the purpose of mercury, lead should not be given, but the four metals should be mixed.

original: dngul gyi bya ba la lhang tsher dkar po'i lcags dang gsha' tshe ste dngul gyi bya ba la gnyis po dag dang lhan cig dngul bzhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngul gyi bya ba la lhang tsher dkar po'i lcags dang gsha' tshe ste dngul gyi bya ba la gnyis po dag dang lhan cig dngul bzhu bar bya'o //
translated: For the purpose of silver, the metal of white vitriol and mica are used. For the purpose of silver, these two are melted together with silver.

original: de ltar bsres pa byas shing dngul chu yang dag par sbyang ba byas nas sna tshogs 'ju bar byed pa'i 'khrul 'khor rnams la gru'i 'khrul 'khor mchog ste des na gru'i 'khrul 'khor du ro blug par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsres pa byas shing dngul chu yang dag par sbyang ba byas nas sna tshogs 'ju bar byed pa'i 'khrul 'khor rnams la gru'i 'khrul 'khor mchog ste des na gru'i 'khrul 'khor du ro blug par bya'o //
translated: Having thus prepared the mixture and purified the mercury, the various digesting machines are used, the ship machine being the best. Therefore, the corpse should be placed in the ship machine.

original: de nas dngul chu las sum cu'i cha shas bzung nas rdo skyong du bsres pa btag par bya ste rtsa ba'i dngul chu'i drug cu'i cha'i lcags kyis so //
analyzed: de nas dngul chu las sum cu'i cha shas bzung nas rdo skyong du bsres pa btag par bya ste rtsa ba'i dngul chu'i drug cu'i cha'i lcags kyis so //
translated: Then, taking one-thirtieth part of the mercury, it should be added to the mixed metal, with iron being one-sixtieth part of the original mercury.

original: de ltar sa las byas pa'i gru'i 'khrul 'khor du dang por drug cu'i cha shas kyi zas byin te /
analyzed: de ltar sa las byas pa'i gru'i 'khrul 'khor du dang por drug cu'i cha shas kyi zas byin te /
translated: In this way, in the machine of the boat made of earth, first give food in sixty parts.

original: de nas ro'i steng du ras srab mo byin nas steng du sngar brjod pa'i bslang ba'i rtsa ba mo byin te gru ni pu ba ma dang ba lang gi lci ba'i phye ma'i me la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ro'i steng du ras srab mo byin nas steng du sngar brjod pa'i bslang ba'i rtsa ba mo byin te gru ni pu ba ma dang ba lang gi lci ba'i phye ma'i me la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then, on top of the corpse, give a thin cloth, and on top of that, the previously mentioned root of the plant that grows in plowed fields. Place the boat in a fire of chaff and cow dung powder.

original: rtsab @286b mo skam pa na bar chad med par slar rtsab mo sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsab @286b mo skam pa na bar chad med par slar rtsab mo sbyin par bya'o //
translated: When the root of the plant dries out, without interruption, give the root again.

original: de ltar nyi ma gcig gam gnyis kyis zas 'ju bar 'gyur te de nas zhu ba'i rjes la gzhan nyis 'gyur ni rim pa de nyid kyis sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyi ma gcig gam gnyis kyis zas 'ju bar 'gyur te de nas zhu ba'i rjes la gzhan nyis 'gyur ni rim pa de nyid kyis sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In this way, in one or two days, the food will be digested. Then, after the digestion, give another double portion in the same sequence.

original: slar yang zhu bar shes nas te ras la blugs pa'i btags pa gal te ras la mi snang na de'i tshe zhu bar brjod do //
analyzed: slar yang zhu bar shes nas te ras la blugs pa'i btags pa gal te ras la mi snang na de'i tshe zhu bar brjod do //
translated: Again, knowing that it is digested, if the stain on the cloth does not appear, then it is said to be digested.

original: de ltar zas 'phel bar bya ste ji srid rkang pa'i cha shas zas za bar 'gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zas 'phel bar bya ste ji srid rkang pa'i cha shas zas za bar 'gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: In this way, increase the food until the parts of the feet eat food.

original: de'i steng du 'phel bar mi bya ste lhag par rab tu sbyin mi bya zhes pa dgag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du 'phel bar mi bya ste lhag par rab tu sbyin mi bya zhes pa dgag pa'o //
translated: One should not increase it further, i.e. one should not add more.

original: de'i steng du rnam pa 'dis sngar gsungs pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: de'i steng du rnam pa 'dis sngar gsungs pa'i sa bon no //
translated: By this method, the seed mentioned earlier is doubled.

original: phyogs gcig gis ni nyis 'gyur 'ju bar 'gyur te slar yang dngul chu 'di ni de bzhin sa bon rnam par dag de ltar sa bon gnyis sam brgyad 'gyur 'ju bar 'gyur te slar yang zhu ba 'di ni sngar brjod pa'i bi da mchog rnams kyis so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis ni nyis 'gyur 'ju bar 'gyur te slar yang dngul chu 'di ni de bzhin sa bon rnam par dag de ltar sa bon gnyis sam brgyad 'gyur 'ju bar 'gyur te slar yang zhu ba 'di ni sngar brjod pa'i bi da mchog rnams kyis so //
translated: By one part, mercury is doubled. Again, this mercury is the seed. Thus, the seed is doubled or quadrupled. Again, this melting is by the best of the previously mentioned bījas.

original: ci ste ma zhu bar gyur na de'i tshe ma zhu ba la 'khor lo'i dugs bya ste ba lang gi nu ma'i rnam pa'i kong bur dngul chu blugs nas sor mo gsum gyi bar du mi snang bar sa la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste ma zhu bar gyur na de'i tshe ma zhu ba la 'khor lo'i dugs bya ste ba lang gi nu ma'i rnam pa'i kong bur dngul chu blugs nas sor mo gsum gyi bar du mi snang bar sa la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: If it does not melt, then in the case of non-melting, one should do a wheel-shaped fumigation. Mercury is placed in a cavity shaped like a cow's udder and buried in the ground up to three finger-widths.

original: de nas phyi rol du 'khor lo'i rnam pa'i 'obs byas nas phub ma dang ba lang gi lci ba'i phye ma rnams kyis bkang ste me sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol du 'khor lo'i rnam pa'i 'obs byas nas phub ma dang ba lang gi lci ba'i phye ma rnams kyis bkang ste me sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, outside, a wheel-shaped pit is made, filled with chaff and cow dung powder, and fire is applied.

original: 'khor lo'i dugs de yis nyin zhag brgyad kyis bi da dang bcas pa'i ro'i kong bur ma zhu ba'i skyon 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dugs de yis nyin zhag brgyad kyis bi da dang bcas pa'i ro'i kong bur ma zhu ba'i skyon 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this process of heating, the cavity of the corpse together with the bile is freed from the fault of non-digestion in eight days.

original: de nas slar yang gru'i 'khrul 'khor du blug par bya sta de ltar 'bugs pa dang rjes su 'bugs par bya ba'i slad du lo gcig dang por byas nas lo bcu gnyis kyi mthar thug par lcags thams cad bzhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slar yang gru'i 'khrul 'khor du blug par bya sta de ltar 'bugs pa dang rjes su 'bugs par bya ba'i slad du lo gcig dang por byas nas lo bcu gnyis kyi mthar thug par lcags thams cad bzhu bar bya'o //
translated: Then again, it should be put into the machine of the boat. In this way, for the sake of piercing and subsequent piercing, having made one year the beginning, all the iron should be melted until the end of twelve years.

original: ce ste bsod nams kyi dbang gis reg rdo dang mchog gi sman 'ju bar byed pa ste //
analyzed: ce ste bsod nams kyi dbang gis reg rdo dang mchog gi sman 'ju bar byed pa ste //
translated: But if by the power of merit, the touchstone and the best medicine for digestion are obtained,

original: zhu bar byed pa dag rnyed na de'i tshe reg rdo dang 'ju byed kyi phye ma'i bi da dang mchog gi sman sngar brjod pa rnams kyis me la gnas kyang lhang tsher gyi lcags rnams kha med par 'ju bar 'gyur te de'i stobs lhag pa'i ror 'gyur ro
analyzed: zhu bar byed pa dag rnyed na de'i tshe reg rdo dang 'ju byed kyi phye ma'i bi da dang mchog gi sman sngar brjod pa rnams kyis me la gnas kyang lhang tsher gyi lcags rnams kha med par 'ju bar 'gyur te de'i stobs lhag pa'i ror 'gyur ro
translated: then at that time, the touchstone and the powder of the digestive medicine and the best medicine mentioned before, although remaining in the fire, the iron of the furnace will be digested without mouth, and its power will become the best essence.

original: // lhang tsher las lhang tsher gyi lcags zhu na stobs brgyad 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // lhang tsher las lhang tsher gyi lcags zhu na stobs brgyad 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the iron is melted in the iron crucible, it becomes eight times stronger.

original: de ni zhu ba ste zos par gyur @287a * //🔽pa na de yi yang brgyad 'gyur gyi stobs so //
analyzed: de ni zhu ba ste zos par gyur @287a * // pa na de yi yang brgyad 'gyur gyi stobs so //
translated: That is the melting.🔽When it is melted, it becomes eight times stronger.

original: sa bon zhu ba la yang de'i brgyad 'gyur gyi stobs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon zhu ba la yang de'i brgyad 'gyur gyi stobs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The seed is melted, and it becomes eight times stronger.

original: slar yang rdo rje rin chen dang aindra n'i la la sogs pa zhu bar gyur na de'i yang brgyad 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang rdo rje rin chen dang aindra n'i la la sogs pa zhu bar gyur na de'i yang brgyad 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Again, the diamond, the sapphire, and so forth are melted, and it becomes eight times stronger. This is the rule.

original: de ltar lcags la sogs rnams ji srid khol bar gyur gyi bar du me yi nang du bskol bar bya ste de nas de ni 'bum phrag du ma 'bugs par rab tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar lcags la sogs rnams ji srid khol bar gyur gyi bar du me yi nang du bskol bar bya ste de nas de ni 'bum phrag du ma 'bugs par rab tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the iron and so forth should be boiled in the fire until it boils. Then it becomes a hundred thousand times more penetrable.

original: de la sgyur par byed pa la sogs pa ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la sgyur par byed pa la sogs pa ni mi bya'o //
translated: In that, the transformation and so forth should not be done.

original: reg rdo sman dag med na sngar brjod pa'i mchog gi bi da mnye ba dag dang dugs rnams kyis kyang 'ju bar 'gyur //
analyzed: reg rdo sman dag med na sngar brjod pa'i mchog gi bi da mnye ba dag dang dugs rnams kyis kyang 'ju bar 'gyur //
translated: If the touchstone and the medicine are not available, it will be melted by the previously mentioned excellent massage and fomentation.

original: 'dar ba med pa ji srid nyid de de nas sgyur byed gser ni mnyam pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir zhu bar gyur pa'i ro 'bar ba'i sol ba la byin pa na gal te 'dar ba byas nas mi 'gro na de'i tshe 'dar ba
analyzed: 'dar ba med pa ji srid nyid de de nas sgyur byed gser ni mnyam pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir zhu bar gyur pa'i ro 'bar ba'i sol ba la byin pa na gal te 'dar ba byas nas mi 'gro na de'i tshe 'dar ba
translated: Here, when the melted elixir is placed on a burning charcoal fire, if it does not move due to trembling, then it is not trembling.

original: med pa gang yin pa de ba lang gi nu ma'i rnam pa'i kong bur blugs nas ji srid ro nub par gyur gyi bar du ae randa'i 'bru mar steng du sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: med pa gang yin pa de ba lang gi nu ma'i rnam pa'i kong bur blugs nas ji srid ro nub par gyur gyi bar du ae randa'i 'bru mar steng du sbyin par bya'o //
translated: That which is not trembling is placed in a cavity shaped like a cow's udder and is given on top of castor oil until the elixir sinks.

original: de nas gser ro dang mnyam pa bzhu nas rdzas kyi don du zha nye brgyad ma byin te ro'i steng du blug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gser ro dang mnyam pa bzhu nas rdzas kyi don du zha nye brgyad ma byin te ro'i steng du blug par bya'o //
translated: Then, the gold elixir is melted and eight parts of mercury are given to it for the sake of the substance. It should be placed on top of the elixir.

original: des bsgyur par 'gyur zhing slar yang rim pa de nyid kyis nyis 'gyur gyi gser gyis rab tu bsgyur par 'gyur te sum 'gyur gyis rjes su bsgyur par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bsgyur par 'gyur zhing slar yang rim pa de nyid kyis nyis 'gyur gyi gser gyis rab tu bsgyur par 'gyur te sum 'gyur gyis rjes su bsgyur par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, it is transformed. Again, by that same process, it is transformed into twice the amount of gold, and by three times, it is transformed into gold.

original: de ltar bsgyur pa rnam pa gsum ni 'bugs par 'gyur te lcags kyi stobs kyi rjes su mthun pas stong gi mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bsgyur pa rnam pa gsum ni 'bugs par 'gyur te lcags kyi stobs kyi rjes su mthun pas stong gi mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
translated: These three transformations are the piercing, which is the end of the thousand, in accord with the power of iron.

original: de nas zangs bzhu ste ro phye mar byas shing spra tshil gyis yang dag par dkris nas bsad pa'i zha nyi dang gsha' che dag dang lhan cig de la blug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zangs bzhu ste ro phye mar byas shing spra tshil gyis yang dag par dkris nas bsad pa'i zha nyi dang gsha' che dag dang lhan cig de la blug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having melted the copper, having ground the corpse to powder, and having completely wrapped it with glue, one should pour it into the dead lead and tin.

original: des dngul lam gser la 'jug pa dang 'bugs par 'gyur ro zhes pa bzhu ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: des dngul lam gser la 'jug pa dang 'bugs par 'gyur ro zhes pa bzhu ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: By that, it enters into the silver or gold, and is pierced. This is the determination of the melting.

original: da ni dgod pa dang bcas pa'i bcing ba gsungs pa gser zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gser gyi bya ba la gser gyi zha nye rab tu btab pas gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni dgod pa dang bcas pa'i bcing ba gsungs pa gser zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gser gyi bya ba la gser gyi zha nye rab tu btab pas gsad par bya'o //
translated: Now, having declared the binding with the laugh, [the Bhagavān] declares the gold, etc. Here, in the action of gold, one should kill by the addition of gold-lead.

original: rnon po mtshal gyis te kha sbyor gyi sbyor bas so //🔽sprul zhes pa zha nye ni ldong ros kyis gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnon po mtshal gyis te kha sbyor gyi sbyor bas so // sprul zhes pa zha nye ni ldong ros kyis gsad par bya'o //
translated: The sharp one is with vermilion, by the method of the union.🔽The snake is lead, which is killed by realgar.

original: zangs ni mu zis gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: zangs ni mu zis gsad par bya'o //
translated: The copper is killed by mercury.

original: dngul gyi bya ba la gsha' tshe ni ba blas gsad par bya'o //🔽@287b dngul ni m'akshi ka dkar pos gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: dngul gyi bya ba la gsha' tshe ni ba blas gsad par bya'o // @287b dngul ni m'akshi ka dkar pos gsad par bya'o //
translated: For silver, the iron of the Bhablas is to be used.🔽Silver is to be killed by white Makshika.

original: lhang tsher skyes zhes pa lhang tsher dkar po'i lcags ni m'akshi kas gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: lhang tsher skyes zhes pa lhang tsher dkar po'i lcags ni m'akshi kas gsad par bya'o //
translated: The iron of the white Lhang tsher is to be killed by Makshika.

original: de nas shi ba'i lcags mnyam pa'i 'gyur byed bzhi po rnams te de rnams tshogs pa med na gsum mam gnyis so //🔽mnyam pa'i bi da dang mnyam pa'i lan tshva rnams dang nye ba'i ro dgra'i chos can rnams dang lcags dang mnyam pa'i dngul chu ste thams cad gcig tu byas nas nya la sogs pa rnams kyi mkhris pa dang b'i dza p'u ra la sogs pa rnams kyi skyur
analyzed: de nas shi ba'i lcags mnyam pa'i 'gyur byed bzhi po rnams te de rnams tshogs pa med na gsum mam gnyis so // mnyam pa'i bi da dang mnyam pa'i lan tshva rnams dang nye ba'i ro dgra'i chos can rnams dang lcags dang mnyam pa'i dngul chu ste thams cad gcig tu byas nas nya la sogs pa rnams kyi mkhris pa dang b'i dza p'u ra la sogs pa rnams kyi skyur
translated: Then, the four equalizers of the dead iron are to be added. If they are not available, three or two are to be used.

original: po dag gis nyin zhag bcu ru mnyes /
analyzed: po dag gis nyin zhag bcu ru mnyes /
translated: The equal Bida, the equal salt, the near-enemy spices, and the mercury equal to the iron are all to be mixed together and kneaded with the bile of fish and so forth and the sour curd of sheep and so forth for ten days.

original: nas de thams cad ni rdo skyong kha sbyar du rab tu blugs te de nas sa la bcug nas zla ba drug gi bar ji srid par dus thams cad du steng du mes bdugs par gyur na des bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nas de thams cad ni rdo skyong kha sbyar du rab tu blugs te de nas sa la bcug nas zla ba drug gi bar ji srid par dus thams cad du steng du mes bdugs par gyur na des bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of that barley is well-poured into a copper vessel, and then it is placed in the ground and fumigated with fire above it for as long as six months at all times. By that, it is bound.

original: de nas bcu drug gi cha yis ghe shas drangs pa ste zangs 'bugs par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bcu drug gi cha yis ghe shas drangs pa ste zangs 'bugs par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, with a sixteenth part, it is drawn by geṣa, and the copper is pierced.

original: slar yang phug pa'i zangs de nyid dngul dang gser dang cha mnyam par byas nas kha sbyor gyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang phug pa'i zangs de nyid dngul dang gser dang cha mnyam par byas nas kha sbyor gyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Again, that very copper of the hole is made equal to silver and gold, and it is accomplished by joining the mouth.

original: dge pa'i gser 'di ni gser 'gyur mkhan rnam dag gi sdug bsngal 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge pa'i gser 'di ni gser 'gyur mkhan rnam dag gi sdug bsngal 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: This virtuous gold is the destroyer of the suffering of the pure alchemists.

original: ci ste dngul la sogs pa dgod pa dang bcas pas 'ching na de'i tshe dngul brgyad kyi cha shas byin par gyur pa na dag pa'i zangs phug pa dngul chu 'gyur te dgong pa dang bcas pa'i bcing ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste dngul la sogs pa dgod pa dang bcas pas 'ching na de'i tshe dngul brgyad kyi cha shas byin par gyur pa na dag pa'i zangs phug pa dngul chu 'gyur te dgong pa dang bcas pa'i bcing ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: But if silver and so forth are bound with a weight, then when an eighth part of silver is given, the pure copper becomes mercury. This is the rule for binding with a weight.

original: de nas dang po'i sangs rgyas las gsungs pa'i gong bu'i bcing ba brjod par bya ste 'dir gser gyi bya ba la lhang tsher ser po la sogs pa'i lhang tsher cung zad bzhu bar bya ste mnyam pa'am phyed do //
analyzed: de nas dang po'i sangs rgyas las gsungs pa'i gong bu'i bcing ba brjod par bya ste 'dir gser gyi bya ba la lhang tsher ser po la sogs pa'i lhang tsher cung zad bzhu bar bya ste mnyam pa'am phyed do //
translated: Then, the binding of the pill taught by the Buddha of the beginning should be stated. Here, for the work of gold, a little of the yellow borax, etc., should be melted and made equal or half.

original: dngul gyi bya ba la lhang tsher dkar po ste de nas gser gyi bya ba la zha nyes btag par bya'o //
analyzed: dngul gyi bya ba la lhang tsher dkar po ste de nas gser gyi bya ba la zha nyes btag par bya'o //
translated: For the work of silver, the borax is white. Then, for the work of gold, the borax should be added.

original: dngul la gsha' tshes so //
analyzed: dngul la gsha' tshes so //
translated: For silver, the borax is added.

original: de nas de la gser gyi 'dab mas dkri bar bya ste dngul gyi bya ba la dngul gyi 'dab mas so //
analyzed: de nas de la gser gyi 'dab mas dkri bar bya ste dngul gyi bya ba la dngul gyi 'dab mas so //
translated: Then, it should be wrapped with a leaf of gold, and for the work of silver, with a leaf of silver.

original: de nas ba lang gi gcin gyis ldong ros btags nas des gser gyi 'dab ma'i steng du byug pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ba lang gi gcin gyis ldong ros btags nas des gser gyi 'dab ma'i steng du byug pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, having mixed up the red arsenic with the urine of a cow, it should be applied with that on the leaf of gold.

original: de nas phyi rol du mtshal gyis so //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol du mtshal gyis so //
translated: Then, outside, with lac.

original: de nas rdza mkhan gyi 'jim @288a * //🔽pas dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdza mkhan gyi 'jim @288a * // pas dkri bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with the clay of a potter.🔽Then, it should be wrapped with the clay of a potter.

original: de nas bskams pa na slar yang ba lang gi lci bas dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bskams pa na slar yang ba lang gi lci bas dkri bar bya'o //
translated: Then, when it is dry, it should again be wrapped with cow dung.

original: slar yang nyi ma'i 'od drag pos skam por byas nas ba lang gi lci ba'i me 'jam po kha sbyor la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang nyi ma'i 'od drag pos skam por byas nas ba lang gi lci ba'i me 'jam po kha sbyor la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Again, dried by the strong light of the sun, it should be heated in a gentle fire of cow dung.

original: de nas thal ba rnams bsal te sa'i gong bu ni ji srid ro chen po dang nye ba'i re dang gser dang zha nye btags pa ro mnyam par gyur gyi bar du bzhus thab tu sol ba drag po rnams kyis bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas thal ba rnams bsal te sa'i gong bu ni ji srid ro chen po dang nye ba'i re dang gser dang zha nye btags pa ro mnyam par gyur gyi bar du bzhus thab tu sol ba drag po rnams kyis bsreg par bya'o //
translated: Then, having removed the ashes, the lump of earth should be heated in a strong fire until it becomes of equal taste with the great corpse, the essence, and the gold and tin.🔽Then, when it has cooled, having broken it up as before, the mixture which is in the middle, together with the gold, by the method of the preparation, is the binding of the lump.

original: de nas grang mor gyur pa na gong du bcag nas dbus su gang zhig gser dang lhan cig btags pa'i tshogs ni gang gi sbyor bas gong bu'i bcing ba ste de nyid zangs la drug cu rtsa bzhi'i cha shas blugs pa ni snga ma bzhin du gser ram
analyzed: de nas grang mor gyur pa na gong du bcag nas dbus su gang zhig gser dang lhan cig btags pa'i tshogs ni gang gi sbyor bas gong bu'i bcing ba ste de nyid zangs la drug cu rtsa bzhi'i cha shas blugs pa ni snga ma bzhin du gser ram
translated: That very thing, having placed a sixty-fourth part of copper, becomes gold or silver, as before.

original: dngul du 'gyur ro zhes pa rtsa ba'i rgyud las gong bu'i bcing ba'o //
analyzed: dngul du 'gyur ro zhes pa rtsa ba'i rgyud las gong bu'i bcing ba'o //
translated: Thus, in the Root Tantra, is the binding of the lump.

original: da ni zhing gi lcags rnams kyi bcing ba gsungs pa 'dzin ma zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sa la rdo ba gang dag 'tsho ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste de nyid kyi skye gnas de
analyzed: da ni zhing gi lcags rnams kyi bcing ba gsungs pa 'dzin ma zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sa la rdo ba gang dag 'tsho ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste de nyid kyi skye gnas de
translated: Now, the binding of the iron of the field is stated: “The binding of the iron of the field is stated,” and so on.🔽Here, having given to the various forms of life on the earth, such as stones, and the various forms of fruit, and so on, that very place of birth,

original: rnams la byin nas zhes pa 'tsho ba rnams la 'tsho ba'i sha dang 'bras bu rnams la 'bras bu'i phye ma dang dung la sogs pa rnams la dung la sogs pa'i phye ma byin nas phye ma de dang de rnams kyi phye ma lhan cig tu mar dang
analyzed: rnams la byin nas zhes pa 'tsho ba rnams la 'tsho ba'i sha dang 'bras bu rnams la 'bras bu'i phye ma dang dung la sogs pa rnams la dung la sogs pa'i phye ma byin nas phye ma de dang de rnams kyi phye ma lhan cig tu mar dang
translated: having given food to the living beings, rice to the fruits, and so on, having given rice to the conch, and so on, having mixed that rice with the rice of those, with ghee,🔽honey, and vegetables, one should make a ball.

original: sbrang rtsi dang tshal dang bcas pa gong bu bya ste ji srid lcags phyed par gyur gyi bar du lcags 'byed pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyis drag por bzhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang tshal dang bcas pa gong bu bya ste ji srid lcags phyed par gyur gyi bar du lcags 'byed pa'i 'khrul 'khor gyis drag por bzhu bar bya'o //
translated: One should boil it intensely with the machine for separating the iron until the iron is separated.

original: slar yang btag pa ni mar la ste slar yang tshal byin nas ji srid rnam par dag par gyur gyi bar du sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang btag pa ni mar la ste slar yang tshal byin nas ji srid rnam par dag par gyur gyi bar du sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Again, it is melted, that is, again it is heated, and the pieces are given again. It should be refined until it is purified.

original: de ltar dag par byas te skye gnas de ni shes nas rnon po 'am zangs gser dang lhan cig gnyis sbyar ba byas nas de nyid ni gser 'gyur mkhan gyis nyis 'gyur du bzhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dag par byas te skye gnas de ni shes nas rnon po 'am zangs gser dang lhan cig gnyis sbyar ba byas nas de nyid ni gser 'gyur mkhan gyis nyis 'gyur du bzhu bar bya'o //
translated: Having thus purified it, that place of birth is known. Having made a compound of the sharp and copper, the alchemist should melt it twice.

original: dang po lhang tsher mngon du phyogs pa'am phyir phyogs par bzhu ste de nas lcags la sogs pa gzhan rnams bzhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang po lhang tsher mngon du phyogs pa'am phyir phyogs par bzhu ste de nas lcags la sogs pa gzhan rnams bzhu bar bya'o //
translated: First, the iron should be melted facing or turned away from the fire. Then the other metals should be melted.

original: de bzhin du m'a kshi ka dang zangs dang gser ram tud  tha ka dang zangs dang gser ram mu men dang zangs dang gser ram ri bong can dang zangs dang gser bzhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du m'a kshi ka dang zangs dang gser ram tud  tha ka dang zangs dang gser ram mu men dang zangs dang gser ram ri bong can dang zangs dang gser bzhu bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, māṣaka, copper, and gold should be melted. Tuthāka, copper, and gold should be melted. Lapis lazuli, copper, and gold should be melted. Rabbit, copper, and gold should be melted.

original: 'dir zhing gi rdo ba rnams kyis lcags 'byed par byed pa ji lta ba de @288b bzhin du m'akshi ka la sogs pa dang dri ma med pa la sogs rnams sbyang bar bya ste de nas snga ma'i las byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhing gi rdo ba rnams kyis lcags 'byed par byed pa ji lta ba de @288b bzhin du m'akshi ka la sogs pa dang dri ma med pa la sogs rnams sbyang bar bya ste de nas snga ma'i las byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, just as the stones of a mine produce iron, so too, the makasika and the stainless, etc., should be refined, and then they will perform their former functions.

original: gzhan du na rdzas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rdzas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the substance will be ruined.

original: de nas gang gis zan tsam nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur pa dang por gser 'gyur mkhan rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i thabs brjod par bya ste 'dir zhu ba'i ro ma bsgyur pa gzhon nu'am byis pas 'dab ma la byugs pas gser phyed can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gang gis zan tsam nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur pa dang por gser 'gyur mkhan rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i thabs brjod par bya ste 'dir zhu ba'i ro ma bsgyur pa gzhon nu'am byis pas 'dab ma la byugs pas gser phyed can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, I will first describe the method of livelihood of the alchemists, by which one can obtain food without difficulty. Here, a young or immature unrefined mercury paste, applied to a leaf, becomes half gold.

original: 'di la yang 'dab ma gcig dang gser gnyis kyis sum cha can du brjod do //
analyzed: 'di la yang 'dab ma gcig dang gser gnyis kyis sum cha can du brjod do //
translated: Here, too, with one leaf and two parts gold, it is said to become one-third gold.

original: 'dir dang por zangs la 'dab ma byas nas lan tshva dang rtsa ba mo dag gis ji srid phye mar gyur gyi bar du btag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dang por zangs la 'dab ma byas nas lan tshva dang rtsa ba mo dag gis ji srid phye mar gyur gyi bar du btag par bya'o //
translated: Here, first make a leaf of copper and pound it with salt and root until it becomes powder.

original: de nas chu byin nas lan tshva'i skyon bsal te de nas bskam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas chu byin nas lan tshva'i skyon bsal te de nas bskam par bya'o //
translated: Then, having given water, the fault of salt is removed and then it should be dried.

original: de nas rgyam tsha bcu drug gi cha shas byin te b'i dza p'u ra la sogs pa'i skyur pos mnyes nas kha sbyor du btso bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rgyam tsha bcu drug gi cha shas byin te b'i dza p'u ra la sogs pa'i skyur pos mnyes nas kha sbyor du btso bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having given one-sixteenth part of salt, it should be mixed with sour substances such as tamarind and cooked in a closed vessel.

original: de bzhin du yang nas yang du rgyam tsha byin nas lan bdun brgyad kyi bar du kha sbyor du btso bar bya ste so phag gi rdul dang mtshungs ba cung zad ljang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang nas yang du rgyam tsha byin nas lan bdun brgyad kyi bar du kha sbyor du btso bar bya ste so phag gi rdul dang mtshungs ba cung zad ljang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, having repeatedly given salt, it should be cooked in a closed vessel seven or eight times, and it will become slightly green, like brick dust.

original: de nas sbrang rtsi dang mar dang tsha las gong bu byas nas snga ma bzhin du lcags dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sbrang rtsi dang mar dang tsha las gong bu byas nas snga ma bzhin du lcags dbye bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having made a ball with honey, ghee, and salt, the iron should be separated as before.

original: de nas dri ma dang bral ba phyed tsam thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dri ma dang bral ba phyed tsam thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, half of the impurities will be removed.

original: slar yang de nyid 'dab mar bya ste mtshal rkang ba'i cha shas byin nas mu zis kha sbyor dag gis gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang de nyid 'dab mar bya ste mtshal rkang ba'i cha shas byin nas mu zis kha sbyor dag gis gsad par bya'o //
translated: Again, it should be made into a leaf, and having given a part of madder root, it should be killed with the closed vessel of mercury.

original: de nyid la slar yang dngul chu brgyad cha dang lhan cig dngul chu'i nyis 'gyur gyi mu zi dang dngul chu'i phyed kyi mtshal byin nas gyo mor skyur pos mnye bar bya ste slar yang bdug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la slar yang dngul chu brgyad cha dang lhan cig dngul chu'i nyis 'gyur gyi mu zi dang dngul chu'i phyed kyi mtshal byin nas gyo mor skyur pos mnye bar bya ste slar yang bdug par bya'o //
translated: Again, it should be heated with one eighth part of mercury, twice as much cinnabar as mercury, and half as much lac. It should be heated again with sour gruel.

original: slar yang mnye bar bya ste nyi ma bdun du'o //
analyzed: slar yang mnye bar bya ste nyi ma bdun du'o //
translated: Again, it should be heated for seven days.

original: de nyid rdza mkhan gyis bsregs pa'i snod dog mor blug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdza mkhan gyis bsregs pa'i snod dog mor blug par bya'o //
translated: It should be put into a small pot baked by a potter.

original: de nas snod kyi kha la rdza mkhan gyi 'jim pas rgyas gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas snod kyi kha la rdza mkhan gyi 'jim pas rgyas gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then, the mouth of the pot should be sealed with the clay of a potter.

original: snod kyi phyi rol du yang byug pa sbyin par bya ste sor gcig gi dpangs n'a ri ke la'i tshad do //
analyzed: snod kyi phyi rol du yang byug pa sbyin par bya ste sor gcig gi dpangs n'a ri ke la'i tshad do //
translated: Outside the pot, it should be smeared with a layer of one finger breadth in height, the measure of an arikela.

original: che ba la lhag pa sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: che ba la lhag pa sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: In the case of a larger one, an additional layer should be given.

original: de nas nyi ma la bskam par bya'o //🔽slar yang steng du ba lang gi lci bas byug par bya ste @289a * //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma la bskam par bya'o // slar yang steng du ba lang gi lci bas byug par bya ste @289a * //
translated: Then, it should be dried in the sun.🔽Again, it should be smeared with cow dung on top.

original: slar yang ji srid pa lang gi lci ba skams par gyur gyi bar du bskam par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang ji srid pa lang gi lci ba skams par gyur gyi bar du bskam par bya'o //
translated: Again, it should be dried until the cow dung is dry.

original: de nas kha sbyor gyis btso bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas kha sbyor gyis btso bar bya'o //
translated: Then it should be heated in a closed vessel.

original: de ltar zangs kyi phye ma la 'khyud nas dngul chu 'chi bar 'gyur zhing zangs kyang skyon med par 'gyur te phan tshun yang dag par sbyor ba las so //🔽de nas dngul gyi rkang pa'i cha shas kyi gser byin zhing gser gyi nyis 'gyur gyi zangs byin nas ji srid thams cad ro mnyam par gyur gyi bar du kong bu kha bsdams su bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zangs kyi phye ma la 'khyud nas dngul chu 'chi bar 'gyur zhing zangs kyang skyon med par 'gyur te phan tshun yang dag par sbyor ba las so // de nas dngul gyi rkang pa'i cha shas kyi gser byin zhing gser gyi nyis 'gyur gyi zangs byin nas ji srid thams cad ro mnyam par gyur gyi bar du kong bu kha bsdams su bsreg par bya'o //
translated: Thus, when the mercury is embraced by the copper powder, the mercury dies and the copper becomes faultless, from the perfect union of the two.🔽Then, giving gold equal to one-fourth of the silver, and giving copper equal to twice the gold, the crucible should be heated until all become of equal taste.

original: de nas grang bar gyur pa dang snod bsal te slar yang rkang pa'i cha shas kyi gser dang / gser gyi nyis 'gyur gyi zangs byin nas snga ma bzhin du bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas grang bar gyur pa dang snod bsal te slar yang rkang pa'i cha shas kyi gser dang / gser gyi nyis 'gyur gyi zangs byin nas snga ma bzhin du bsreg par bya'o //
translated: Then, when it becomes cold, the vessel should be removed and again gold equal to one-fourth of the silver and copper equal to twice the gold should be given and heated as before.

original: de nas grang bar gyur pa dang snod bsal nas gser phyed kyi gser du gyur te kha sbyor gnyis kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas grang bar gyur pa dang snod bsal nas gser phyed kyi gser du gyur te kha sbyor gnyis kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Then, when it becomes cold, the vessel should be removed and the gold becomes half gold. This is the purification by the two unions.

original: de nas sbyor ba gzhan brjod par bya ste phye ma 'di gser la nyis 'gyur ram sum 'gyur bzhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba gzhan brjod par bya ste phye ma 'di gser la nyis 'gyur ram sum 'gyur bzhu bar bya'o //
translated: Then, another process will be described: this powder is dissolved in twice or thrice the amount of gold.

original: de rkang pa'i cha shas kyi dngul chu la sbyar ba byas nas so phag gi khung bur blugs te steng du mu zi'i phye ma byin zhing de'i steng du kha chod byas nas de'i steng du sol bas skad cig tsam bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: de rkang pa'i cha shas kyi dngul chu la sbyar ba byas nas so phag gi khung bur blugs te steng du mu zi'i phye ma byin zhing de'i steng du kha chod byas nas de'i steng du sol bas skad cig tsam bsreg par bya'o //
translated: Having made that part of the silver mercury, it is placed in a hole in a brick, and on top of it, arsenic powder is given. On top of that, a lid is put on, and on top of that, it is burned for a moment with charcoal.

original: de nas grang bar gyur pa dang yang dang yang du sbyar ba dang mnyam pa'i mu zi byin nas lan brgyad du bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas grang bar gyur pa dang yang dang yang du sbyar ba dang mnyam pa'i mu zi byin nas lan brgyad du bsreg par bya'o //
translated: Then, when it has cooled, arsenic equal to the amount of the repeated [process] is given, and it is burned eight times.

original: de nas dngul chus gser la 'khyud de mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: de nas dngul chus gser la 'khyud de mi gtong ngo //
translated: Then, the mercury embraces the gold and does not let go.

original: de nas dngul gyi rkang pa'i cha shas kyi sa bon byin zhing de nyid la dngul dang mnyam pa'i zangs byin nas kong bu kha bsdams su bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dngul gyi rkang pa'i cha shas kyi sa bon byin zhing de nyid la dngul dang mnyam pa'i zangs byin nas kong bu kha bsdams su bsreg par bya'o //
translated: Then, a part of the silver seed is given, and on that very [gold], copper equal to the silver is given, and it is burned in a closed crucible.

original: de nas grang bar gyur pa dang snod bsal nas 'dab ma de 'dab mar byas te sbyar ba des 'dab ma la byug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas grang bar gyur pa dang snod bsal nas 'dab ma de 'dab mar byas te sbyar ba des 'dab ma la byug par bya'o //
translated: Then, when it has cooled, remove the vessel, and with that leaf, which has become a leaf, smear it on the leaf.

original: 'ju bar byed pa'i don du t'am b'u la'i 'dab ma'i khu bas steng du byug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ju bar byed pa'i don du t'am b'u la'i 'dab ma'i khu bas steng du byug par bya'o //
translated: For the purpose of digestion, smear the top with the juice of the tāmbūla leaf.

original: de nas thab kyi 'og tu gzhug par bya ste steng du so sor gcig byin nas steng du mes khyim gyi g-yos la sogs pa nyi ma gsum gyi bar du bya'o //
analyzed: de nas thab kyi 'og tu gzhug par bya ste steng du so sor gcig byin nas steng du mes khyim gyi g-yos la sogs pa nyi ma gsum gyi bar du bya'o //
translated: Then, place it under the stove, and having given one to each on top, cook the house-food and so forth on top with fire for three days.

original: de nas phyung ste slar yang rkang pa'i cha shas kyi sa bon byin nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyung ste slar yang rkang pa'i cha shas kyi sa bon byin nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having removed it, again give the seed-portion of the foot, and remove it.

original: 'dab ma de ni de'i tshe 'dab mar 'gyur te phyed dang bcas pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i gser du 'gyur ro @289b zhes pa dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ste gzhan rgya chen po ni ma bris so //
analyzed: 'dab ma de ni de'i tshe 'dab mar 'gyur te phyed dang bcas pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i gser du 'gyur ro @289b zhes pa dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ste gzhan rgya chen po ni ma bris so //
translated: That leaf becomes a leaf at that time, and becomes superior gold with half. This was spoken by the Bhagavān in the First Buddha, but the extensive other [texts] were not written.

original: da ni lus don du gnyer ba rnams la bcud len gsungs pa nyin zhag bdun zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang la la zhag bcings pa'i bcud za bar byed na de'i tshe de'i dang por snod dag par byas te de yang 'bras bu gsum bo cha
analyzed: da ni lus don du gnyer ba rnams la bcud len gsungs pa nyin zhag bdun zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang la la zhag bcings pa'i bcud za bar byed na de'i tshe de'i dang por snod dag par byas te de yang 'bras bu gsum bo cha
translated: That is, they should purge with water boiled with the three fruits

original: mnyam pa bskol ba'i chus bshal bar bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa bskol ba'i chus bshal bar bya'o //
translated: and equal parts.

original: lan tshva dang skyur ba dang bral ba s'a li'i zan dang 'o mas kha zas bya'o //
analyzed: lan tshva dang skyur ba dang bral ba s'a li'i zan dang 'o mas kha zas bya'o //
translated: They should eat food of rice and milk free from salt and sourness.

original: de nas sman gyis bsad pa'i lcags kyi phye ma zhes pa ni gu na dis bsad pa'i rnon pa'i phye ma mar dang sprang rtsi dag dang bcas pa dngul chu dang bcas zhes pa legs par shi ba'i dngul chu dang mnyam pa ste de nyid cung zad re
analyzed: de nas sman gyis bsad pa'i lcags kyi phye ma zhes pa ni gu na dis bsad pa'i rnon pa'i phye ma mar dang sprang rtsi dag dang bcas pa dngul chu dang bcas zhes pa legs par shi ba'i dngul chu dang mnyam pa ste de nyid cung zad re
translated: Then, “iron powder killed by the medicine” is sharp powder killed by guḍūcī, together with ghee and honey, together with mercury, that is, together with well-prepared mercury.

original: nyin zhag so sor bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag so sor bza' bar bya'o //
translated: That should be consumed in equal parts, and a little bit of that should be consumed each day.

original: kha zas ni sar pa dang rnyings pa zhes pa dang bo be'u btsas pa'i ba'i 'o ma dang rnyid pa zhes pa 'bras rnying pa'i zan no //
analyzed: kha zas ni sar pa dang rnyings pa zhes pa dang bo be'u btsas pa'i ba'i 'o ma dang rnyid pa zhes pa 'bras rnying pa'i zan no //
translated: Food is fresh and stale. Fresh is the milk of a cow that has given birth to her first calf. Stale is the rice of the previous year.

original: de ltar s'a li la sogs pa lo ma skyur pos dman zhing lan tshva dang rnam par bral ba nya dang 'bru mar la sogs pa las grol ba zos pa dag gis phyogs kyi nang du snod dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar s'a li la sogs pa lo ma skyur pos dman zhing lan tshva dang rnam par bral ba nya dang 'bru mar la sogs pa las grol ba zos pa dag gis phyogs kyi nang du snod dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, having eaten rice and so on, which is devoid of sour leaves and salt, and is free from fish, oil and so on, the stomach becomes pure.

original: de nas bcud bza' bar bya ste stod phrag 'bugs pa dang brgya yis bsgyur pa'i brgya zhes pa 'bum phrag 'bugs pa dang bye ba 'bugs pa ji srid par yang shes nas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bcud bza' bar bya ste stod phrag 'bugs pa dang brgya yis bsgyur pa'i brgya zhes pa 'bum phrag 'bugs pa dang bye ba 'bugs pa ji srid par yang shes nas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should eat the essence. One should know that one should eat as much as one can swallow in one hundred and eight breaths, one thousand and eight breaths, one hundred thousand and eight breaths, and ten million and eight breaths.

original: stong phrag 'bugs pa ni nyin zhag so sor nas tsam bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: stong phrag 'bugs pa ni nyin zhag so sor nas tsam bza' bar bya'o //
translated: One should eat as much as can be swallowed in one thousand and eight breaths each day.

original: 'bum phrag 'bugs pa ni yungs kar tsam dang bye ba 'bugs pa ni skye tshe tsam ste de ltar mtha' ma skye tshe'i cha shas so //
analyzed: 'bum phrag 'bugs pa ni yungs kar tsam dang bye ba 'bugs pa ni skye tshe tsam ste de ltar mtha' ma skye tshe'i cha shas so //
translated: One should eat as much as can be swallowed in one hundred thousand and eight breaths, which is the size of a mustard seed, and as much as can be swallowed in ten million and eight breaths, which is the size of a louse egg. Thus, the end is the size of a part of a louse egg.

original: 'dir bcud bza' ba'i slad du khang bzangs sam sa yi khang pa grang ba dang rlung dang tshad pa dang bral ba shes so //
analyzed: 'dir bcud bza' ba'i slad du khang bzangs sam sa yi khang pa grang ba dang rlung dang tshad pa dang bral ba shes so //
translated: Here, in order to consume the essence, one should know a house or a cool, windless, and warm house on the ground.

original: de ltar bcud 'bring po stong phrag 'bugs pa ni zla ba drug gis lha yi lus po skra dkar gnyer ma dag dang bral bar byed de grub pa'i bcud gzhan ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i nyin zhag gcig gis byed do //
analyzed: de ltar bcud 'bring po stong phrag 'bugs pa ni zla ba drug gis lha yi lus po skra dkar gnyer ma dag dang bral bar byed de grub pa'i bcud gzhan ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i nyin zhag gcig gis byed do //
translated: Thus, the essence of medium strength, one thousand palas, is prepared in six months with a divine body free of gray hair and wrinkles. The other essence of accomplishment is prepared in one day, as will be explained.

original: da ni bcud ma zhu ba'i sman gsungs pa kar ko t'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe bcud ma zhu bar gyur @290a * //
analyzed: da ni bcud ma zhu ba'i sman gsungs pa kar ko t'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang gi tshe bcud ma zhu bar gyur @290a * //
translated: Now, the medicine for undigested essence is described: karkotaka and so on. Here, when the essence becomes undigested,

original: ba na de'i tshe ba na dha kar ko t'i dang de ba d'a li dang tsha ba gsum dang bri ha t'i dang nim pa'i 'dab ma dang ke r'a ta tig ta ste 'di rnams chu brgyad cha'i lhag mar bskol ba ni bskol zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ba na de'i tshe ba na dha kar ko t'i dang de ba d'a li dang tsha ba gsum dang bri ha t'i dang nim pa'i 'dab ma dang ke r'a ta tig ta ste 'di rnams chu brgyad cha'i lhag mar bskol ba ni bskol zhes brjod do //
translated: then at that time, one part of banana, one part of devadali, three parts of the three hot spices, one part of brihati, one part of nimba leaf, and one part of kerata-tikta - these are boiled in eight parts of water until only one part remains, which is called boiled.

original: de nyid btung ste ma zhu ba la nyin zhag gsum du smyung bar gnas pa ni ji srid shin tu bkres par gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de nyid btung ste ma zhu ba la nyin zhag gsum du smyung bar gnas pa ni ji srid shin tu bkres par gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: Having drunk that, he should fast for three days and nights, until he becomes very hungry.

original: de nas kha zas bya'o //
analyzed: de nas kha zas bya'o //
translated: Then he should eat food.

original: de bzhin du zla ba'i chu 'thungs te nyin zhag gsum smyung bar gnas pa dang de nas kha zas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba'i chu 'thungs te nyin zhag gsum smyung bar gnas pa dang de nas kha zas so //
translated: In the same way, he should drink moon water, fast for three days and nights, and then eat food.

original: me'i chu la de nyid kyis khrus dang de nyid kyis zan btso ba dang de nyid btung ba ste zla ba drug dang lo gcig gi bar du 'o ma dang zan bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: me'i chu la de nyid kyis khrus dang de nyid kyis zan btso ba dang de nyid btung ba ste zla ba drug dang lo gcig gi bar du 'o ma dang zan bza' bar bya'o //
translated: With fire water, he should bathe with that, cook food with that, and drink that. For six months up to one year, he should eat milk and food.

original: dug gi chu dang rdo'i chu dang bhall'a ta yi chu la de bzhin te 'di rnams ni cung zad btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dug gi chu dang rdo'i chu dang bhall'a ta yi chu la de bzhin te 'di rnams ni cung zad btung bar bya'o //
translated: With poison water, stone water, and bhallāṭa water, he should drink that in the same way. These should be drunk a little.

original: lhag pa ni ma yin te 'chi bar byed do //
analyzed: lhag pa ni ma yin te 'chi bar byed do //
translated: Not more, for it would cause death.

original: de bzhin du ngan pa'i dri bza' ba dang sa dang rdo ba bza' ba dang dug gis byugs pa'i sha dang gzhan tsha la'i yal 'dab la sogs pa'i brtag pa la zas la sogs pa cho ga 'di'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngan pa'i dri bza' ba dang sa dang rdo ba bza' ba dang dug gis byugs pa'i sha dang gzhan tsha la'i yal 'dab la sogs pa'i brtag pa la zas la sogs pa cho ga 'di'o //
translated: Likewise, the examination of eating bad smells, eating earth and stones, meat smeared with poison, and the leaves of the thorn tree, etc., is the rite for food, etc.

original: da ni bcud len gyi sman rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa gang zhig zos na zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir tsha la'i yal 'dab la sogs pa dang 'khri shing la sogs pa rnams las gang zhig zos na shin tu drag po rang rgyal ba ster byed
analyzed: da ni bcud len gyi sman rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa gang zhig zos na zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir tsha la'i yal 'dab la sogs pa dang 'khri shing la sogs pa rnams las gang zhig zos na shin tu drag po rang rgyal ba ster byed
translated: Now, he states the characteristics of the medicines of alchemy: “Which, when eaten, gives the very powerful self-conquest” and so on. Here, from among the leaves of the thorn tree, etc., and the creepers, etc., which, when eaten, gives the very powerful self-conquest

original: dug dang mtshungs pa ste sman de'i yan lag lnga bzung nas phye ma zhib mor bya'o //
analyzed: dug dang mtshungs pa ste sman de'i yan lag lnga bzung nas phye ma zhib mor bya'o //
translated: is like poison. Having taken the five parts of that medicine, make a fine powder.
