original: phye ma de nyid cung zad re mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bcas pa nyin zhag so sor bza' bar bya ste de bzhin nyid ces pa lhag ma ni cho ga snga ma'o //
analyzed: phye ma de nyid cung zad re mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bcas pa nyin zhag so sor bza' bar bya ste de bzhin nyid ces pa lhag ma ni cho ga snga ma'o //
translated: That very powder, together with a little ghee and honey, should be eaten every day. The rest of “just so” is the previous rite.

original: 'dir sems can rnams kyis gang zhig za bar byed cing brgyal ba mi ster ba de ni grub pa ster ba'i sman ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sems can rnams kyis gang zhig za bar byed cing brgyal ba mi ster ba de ni grub pa ster ba'i sman ma yin no //
translated: Here, that which is eaten by sentient beings and does not give them a loss of consciousness is not the medicine that gives success.

original: sems can de dag rnams la 'chi ster mchog tu 'jigs byed gang yin pa de ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la grub pa ster ba ste sngags dang bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: sems can de dag rnams la 'chi ster mchog tu 'jigs byed gang yin pa de ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la grub pa ster ba ste sngags dang bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis so //
translated: That which gives death to those sentient beings, the supreme fear, is the giver of success to the yogis, by the power of mantra and meditation.

original: da ni bcud len gzhan gsungs pa ra na dod pa la zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir da na dod pa la'i khu ba dang s'a li par ni'i khu ba dang autpala s'a r'i'i khu ba yis ro dang mu zi mnyam pa rdo khab len gyi lcags
analyzed: da ni bcud len gzhan gsungs pa ra na dod pa la zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir da na dod pa la'i khu ba dang s'a li par ni'i khu ba dang autpala s'a r'i'i khu ba yis ro dang mu zi mnyam pa rdo khab len gyi lcags
translated: Now, another elixir is mentioned, beginning with “iron powder,” etc. Here, the juice of danti, the juice of śāliparṇī, and the juice of utpalasāra, equal parts of mercury and sulfur, iron powder,

original: kyi snod du lcags kyi gtun bus nyin zhag gsum mnye bar bya ste de ltar mnyes nas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: kyi snod du lcags kyi gtun bus nyin zhag gsum mnye bar bya ste de ltar mnyes nas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: in an iron vessel with an iron mortar, should be ground for three days. Having ground it in that way, one should eat it.

original: gang zhig t'am ka'i @290b rkang pa'i tshad ces pa m'a sha ka re za bar byed pa de ni mdze la sogs pa'i nad las grol zhing rgas pa skra dkar la sogs pa dang bral ba lo bcu drug lon pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig t'am ka'i @290b rkang pa'i tshad ces pa m'a sha ka re za bar byed pa de ni mdze la sogs pa'i nad las grol zhing rgas pa skra dkar la sogs pa dang bral ba lo bcu drug lon pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: One who eats a māṣaka measure of the root of the plant called what? or tā, is freed from such diseases as leprosy and is free from old age, such as gray hair, and becomes like one sixteen years old.

original: da ni ro bsad pa la grub pa'i sman rnams gsungs pa bokk'a na zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang zhig dngul chu bsdu ba dang gsad par 'dod pa des sman 'di rnams btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: da ni ro bsad pa la grub pa'i sman rnams gsungs pa bokk'a na zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gang zhig dngul chu bsdu ba dang gsad par 'dod pa des sman 'di rnams btsal bar bya'o //
translated: Now, the herbs that are successful in killing mercury are mentioned, beginning with bokkaṇa. Here, one who desires to collect and kill mercury should search for these herbs.

original: bokk'a na zhes pa ni shing kun te gang gis srad bu sngon po la byugs na dkar por 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bokk'a na zhes pa ni shing kun te gang gis srad bu sngon po la byugs na dkar por 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Bokkaṇa is aśoka, which, when smeared on a blue thread, turns it white.

original: des kong bu la byugs pas dngul chu 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kong bu la byugs pas dngul chu 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By smearing it on a lamp, mercury dies.

original: bar snang zhes pa ni nam mkha' ste be runda'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bar snang zhes pa ni nam mkha' ste be runda'i bshad pa'o //
translated: Space is the sky, explained as berunda.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te gdugs kyi nam mkha' dang gtsug phud kyi nam mkha'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te gdugs kyi nam mkha' dang gtsug phud kyi nam mkha'o //
translated: That is also of two types: umbrella space and topknot space.

original: me'i nang du bcug pa'i steng du gos bkab pa na gal te gtsug phud kyi rnam pas gos phug nas dub 'byung ba de ni mchog go //
analyzed: me'i nang du bcug pa'i steng du gos bkab pa na gal te gtsug phud kyi rnam pas gos phug nas dub 'byung ba de ni mchog go //
translated: If the cloth is covered above the fire and the smoke emerges in the form of a topknot, that is the best.

original: ma yin par gdugs kyi rnam bas du ba gnas na de ni 'bring po ste des kyang bsdus te bcing ba'o //
analyzed: ma yin par gdugs kyi rnam bas du ba gnas na de ni 'bring po ste des kyang bsdus te bcing ba'o //
translated: If it remains in the form of an umbrella, that is medium.

original: de bzhin du shag tu ka'i dug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du shag tu ka'i dug go //
translated: Similarly, it is the poison of a shaktuka.

original: de bzhin du k'i ra'i mchu zhes pa ni ne tso'i mchu khrag zag pa can te 'jig rten du khrag skrod par grags pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du k'i ra'i mchu zhes pa ni ne tso'i mchu khrag zag pa can te 'jig rten du khrag skrod par grags pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the beak of a karikari is the bloody beak of a parrot. In the world, it is known as blood-dispelling.

original: de bzhin du kam gi padma can ni gang gi steng du rkang pa bzhag par gyur pa na nyin mo nam mkha' la skar ma rnams mthong bar 'gyur te 'di rnams med na sman gzhan rnams kyis zol gyis bsad pa'i dngul chu la dmar reng ste zangs dang
analyzed: de bzhin du kam gi padma can ni gang gi steng du rkang pa bzhag par gyur pa na nyin mo nam mkha' la skar ma rnams mthong bar 'gyur te 'di rnams med na sman gzhan rnams kyis zol gyis bsad pa'i dngul chu la dmar reng ste zangs dang
translated: Similarly, the kamgi padma is that on which the feet are placed. During the day, the stars are seen in the sky. If these are not available, the mercury that is killed by the deception of other medicines is heated with red copper.

original: lhang tsher gyis zhes pa lhang tsher gyi lcags dang gser dang khab len gyi lcags mnyam par byas nas bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: lhang tsher gyis zhes pa lhang tsher gyi lcags dang gser dang khab len gyi lcags mnyam par byas nas bsreg par bya'o //
translated: With iron filings one should heat iron filings, gold, and lodestone together.

original: dngul chu srang bzhi la de phyed kyis te srang gnyis kyis sbyar ba srang drug tu bya'o //
analyzed: dngul chu srang bzhi la de phyed kyis te srang gnyis kyis sbyar ba srang drug tu bya'o //
translated: Four suvarṇas of mercury are to be mixed with half of that, two suvarṇas, making six suvarṇas.

original: lhag ma ni nang gi le'u las brjod pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni nang gi le'u las brjod pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The rest is the procedure described in the Inner Chapter.

original: da ni stod phrag 'bugs pa la sogs pa'i bcud rnams kyi rang bzhin gsungs pa zla ba drug ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sngar brjod pa'i cho gas zos na stong phrag 'bugs ba ni zla ba drug gis lus mchog tu byed do //
analyzed: da ni stod phrag 'bugs pa la sogs pa'i bcud rnams kyi rang bzhin gsungs pa zla ba drug ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sngar brjod pa'i cho gas zos na stong phrag 'bugs ba ni zla ba drug gis lus mchog tu byed do //
translated: Now, he describes the nature of the essences such as the piercing of the thousand, the six months, etc. Here, if one eats by the procedure described previously, the piercing of the thousand is done in six months, making the body supreme.

original: des na zla ba drug gis 'di yi mthu las lus la dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //🔽zla ba gnyis kyis stong phrag bcu 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //🔽zla ba @291a * //
analyzed: des na zla ba drug gis 'di yi mthu las lus la dngos grub tu 'gyur ro // zla ba gnyis kyis stong phrag bcu 'bugs pa'i mthu las so // zla ba @291a * //
translated: Therefore, in six months, by the power of this, there is siddhi in the body.🔽In two months, by the power of the piercing of ten thousand.

original: gcig gis 'bum phrag 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
analyzed: gcig gis 'bum phrag 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
translated: In one month, by the power of the piercing of a hundred thousand.

original: nyin zhag bcu drug gis 'bum phrag nyi shu 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
analyzed: nyin zhag bcu drug gis 'bum phrag nyi shu 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
translated: In sixteen days, the power of penetrating twenty myriads.

original: nyin zhag bcus 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa bzhi 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
analyzed: nyin zhag bcus 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa bzhi 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
translated: In ten days, the power of penetrating thirty-four myriads.

original: zhag bdun gyis 'bum phrag drug cu 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
analyzed: zhag bdun gyis 'bum phrag drug cu 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
translated: In seven days, the power of penetrating sixty myriads.

original: zhag gsum gyis 'bum phrag brgyad cu 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
analyzed: zhag gsum gyis 'bum phrag brgyad cu 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
translated: In three days, the power of penetrating eighty myriads.

original: zhag gcig gis bye ba 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
analyzed: zhag gcig gis bye ba 'bugs pa'i mthu las so //
translated: In one day, the power of penetrating ten myriads.

original: skad cig gcig gis zhes pa ni yud tsam gcig gis grub pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gcig gis zhes pa ni yud tsam gcig gis grub pa'o //
translated: In one moment means in one instant.

original: bcud la sogs pa'i dngos grub 'di ni thun mong pa ste ral gri la sogs pa'i dngos grub dang rig pa 'dzin pa'i dngos grub kyang ngo //
analyzed: bcud la sogs pa'i dngos grub 'di ni thun mong pa ste ral gri la sogs pa'i dngos grub dang rig pa 'dzin pa'i dngos grub kyang ngo //
translated: This power of penetrating the earth and so forth is common, and also the power of penetrating the sword and so forth, and the power of the knowledge-holder.

original: las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub ni 'bring po'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub ni 'bring po'o //
translated: The power of the action seal and the power of the wisdom seal are middling.

original: 'di dag las mchog ni rang dang gzhan la phan pa'i mchog ye shes kyi dngos grub ste shes rab kyi gzugs bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: 'di dag las mchog ni rang dang gzhan la phan pa'i mchog ye shes kyi dngos grub ste shes rab kyi gzugs bsgoms pas so //
translated: The supreme among these is the supreme power of benefiting oneself and others, the power of knowledge, by meditating on the form of wisdom.

original: de yang gang gis gang zhig sgrub par 'gyur pa skyes bu rnams kyi snga ma'i legs byas kyi dbang gis nge la bag chags su 'gyur te skye ba snga ma'i rjes su 'bugs pa las so //
analyzed: de yang gang gis gang zhig sgrub par 'gyur pa skyes bu rnams kyi snga ma'i legs byas kyi dbang gis nge la bag chags su 'gyur te skye ba snga ma'i rjes su 'bugs pa las so //
translated: Moreover, by the power of the good actions of those who are to accomplish something, it becomes a latent tendency in them, from the continuation of the previous birth.

original: da ni rdzas don du gnyer ba rnams la gter brtag pa gsungs pa gang na zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sa gzhi la gang na 'khri shing rnams dang ljon shing rnams mi 'dra ba'i rang bzhin du snang ba de na rdzas yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ni rdzas don du gnyer ba rnams la gter brtag pa gsungs pa gang na zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir sa gzhi la gang na 'khri shing rnams dang ljon shing rnams mi 'dra ba'i rang bzhin du snang ba de na rdzas yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, the examination of treasure for those who seek wealth is stated by “where” and so on. Here, where vines and trees appear to have an unusual nature, there is wealth.

original: gzhan yang gang na rtag tu dud 'gro rnam par rtsod par snang ba ste rang gi gnas kyi don du 'thab pa de na rdzas yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang na rtag tu dud 'gro rnam par rtsod par snang ba ste rang gi gnas kyi don du 'thab pa de na rdzas yod do //
translated: Moreover, where animals always appear to fight, fighting for their own dwelling, there is wealth.

original: der lcags bzang po'i ral gri'i steng ngam chu gri'i steng du padma dmar po'i skud pa la sdong bu byas nas mi yi snum gyis sbar te 'byung po'i bdag po'i sngags sgrub thabs kyi le'u las brjod pas mngon par bsngags nas sa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: der lcags bzang po'i ral gri'i steng ngam chu gri'i steng du padma dmar po'i skud pa la sdong bu byas nas mi yi snum gyis sbar te 'byung po'i bdag po'i sngags sgrub thabs kyi le'u las brjod pas mngon par bsngags nas sa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: There, on a good iron sword or on a water sword, one should make a wick of red lotus fibers, light it with human oil, and recite the mantra of the Lord of Spirits as stated in the chapter on the sādhana.

original: gal te me lce kha thur du bltas par gyur na de'i tshe rdzas yod do //
analyzed: gal te me lce kha thur du bltas par gyur na de'i tshe rdzas yod do //
translated: If the flame of the wick points downward, then the substance is there.

original: gal te ma lhung na de'i tshe med do //
analyzed: gal te ma lhung na de'i tshe med do //
translated: If it does not fall, then it is not there.

original: de ltar gal te lhung na de'i tshe gnas der thun gsum du 'byung po'i bdag po'i sngags bzlas par bya ste ji srid snang bar gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de ltar gal te lhung na de'i tshe gnas der thun gsum du 'byung po'i bdag po'i sngags bzlas par bya ste ji srid snang bar gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: If it falls like that, then one should recite the mantra of the Lord of Spirits three times in that place, until it appears.

original: de nas sngags pa rnams la brko bar bya ba'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: de nas sngags pa rnams la brko bar bya ba'i dngos grub bo //
translated: Then, for the adepts, it is to be dug up.

original: gzhan du na nyon mongs par 'gyur te lha @291b min rnams kyis bsrungs pa'i rdzas ni sus kyang gdon par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na nyon mongs par 'gyur te lha @291b min rnams kyis bsrungs pa'i rdzas ni sus kyang gdon par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it will be troublesome, and the substance guarded by the asuras cannot be taken by anyone.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i rjes la tshigs su bcad pa gsum ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i rjes la tshigs su bcad pa gsum ni go sla'o //
translated: The three verses following this one are easy to understand.

original: da ni rigs kyi lung las brjod pa'i rigs kyi dbye ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rigs kyi lung las brjod pa'i rigs kyi dbye ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now he states the division of the families mentioned in the Tantra of the Family,

original: sgra gcan zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rigs kyi lung nub kyi khang pa las bzhi po dang lnga po dang drug po dang bzhi po dang lnga po dang gsum po zhes pa ni phyi rol dang lus la rnam par sbyang bar bya ste de nas lha
analyzed: sgra gcan zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rigs kyi lung nub kyi khang pa las bzhi po dang lnga po dang drug po dang bzhi po dang lnga po dang gsum po zhes pa ni phyi rol dang lus la rnam par sbyang bar bya ste de nas lha
translated: Rahu, etc. Here, the four, the five, the six, the four, the five, and the three mentioned in the Tantra of the Family in the western house are to be purified in the external and the body, and then the

original: rnams kyi mchod pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: rnams kyi mchod pa'o zhes so //
translated: worshipping of the deities.

original: des na phyi rol du sgra gcan dang dus kyi me dang zla ba dang nyi ma'o //
analyzed: des na phyi rol du sgra gcan dang dus kyi me dang zla ba dang nyi ma'o //
translated: Therefore, externally, Rahu, Kālāgni, the moon, and the sun.

original: 'di rnams kyi sbyor ba ni bzhi po ste gdan bzhi po'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi sbyor ba ni bzhi po ste gdan bzhi po'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Their union is the four, i.e., the four seats.

original: de nas 'jig rten gyi khams rdzogs pa'i don du lnga po ste sa la sogs pa ro'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten gyi khams rdzogs pa'i don du lnga po ste sa la sogs pa ro'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of completing the world, the five, i.e., earth, etc., up to the taste.

original: de nas gza' yi tshogs pa cig shos dag ces pa ni bzhi po spangs pa bkra shis dang gza' la ga dang phur bu dang pa sangs dang spen pa dang mjug rings te 'di rnams kyi tshogs pa ni drug po'o //
analyzed: de nas gza' yi tshogs pa cig shos dag ces pa ni bzhi po spangs pa bkra shis dang gza' la ga dang phur bu dang pa sangs dang spen pa dang mjug rings te 'di rnams kyi tshogs pa ni drug po'o //
translated: Then, the other group of planets, the four planets that are excluded, are Bṛhaspati, Rāhu, Śukra, and Śani.

original: de nas lhun po'i phyogs bzhi rnams su gling bzhi rnams ni bzhi po'o //
analyzed: de nas lhun po'i phyogs bzhi rnams su gling bzhi rnams ni bzhi po'o //
translated: Then, the four continents are in the four directions of Meru.

original: dri la sogs pa rnams kyi yul lnga rnams ni lnga po'o //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa rnams kyi yul lnga rnams ni lnga po'o //
translated: The five objects of smell and so on are the five.

original: snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum ni gsum bo'o //
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum ni gsum bo'o //
translated: The three qualities of sattva and so on are the three.🔽Thus, the three qualities of sattva and so on are external, and the seat and so on are internal.

original: de ltar phyi rol du snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams ni gsum po dang gdan la sogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lus kyi dbus su yang shes par bya ste 'dir lus bskyed pa'i don du ma'i padmar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol du snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams ni gsum po dang gdan la sogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lus kyi dbus su yang shes par bya ste 'dir lus bskyed pa'i don du ma'i padmar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni
translated: In the same way, in the center of the body, the consciousness of the all-base is in the lotus of the mother, for the purpose of generating the body.

original: sgra gcan dang dga' ba ni dus kyi me dang khrag ces pa me'i rdul ni nyi ma dang bdud rtsi zhes pa khu ba ni zla ba ste 'di rnams ni dang por lus kyi rigs skyed pa'i rgyu bzhi'o //
analyzed: sgra gcan dang dga' ba ni dus kyi me dang khrag ces pa me'i rdul ni nyi ma dang bdud rtsi zhes pa khu ba ni zla ba ste 'di rnams ni dang por lus kyi rigs skyed pa'i rgyu bzhi'o //
translated: Rāhu and Ānandā are the “fire of time” and “blood,” the “particle of fire” is the sun, and the “nectar” or semen is the moon. These are the four causes that first generate the body type.

original: bzhi po de las rus pa la sogs pa ni lnga po ste rus pa ni sa dang chu ser ni chu dang khrag ni me dang sha dang pags pa ni rlung dang rkang ni nam mkha' ste mtha' dag rnams kyang lnga po'o //
analyzed: bzhi po de las rus pa la sogs pa ni lnga po ste rus pa ni sa dang chu ser ni chu dang khrag ni me dang sha dang pags pa ni rlung dang rkang ni nam mkha' ste mtha' dag rnams kyang lnga po'o //
translated: From those four, the five, such as bone, arise: bone is earth, marrow is water, blood is fire, flesh and skin are wind, and sinews are space.

original: de nas mig la sogs pa drug po ste zhes pa ni bkra shis dang rna ba ni gza' lag dang lce ni phur bu dang sna ni pa ba sangs dang lus kyi dbang po ni sben pa dang yid kyi dbang po ni mjug rings so zhes pa drug🔽po'o // de @292a * //
analyzed: de nas mig la sogs pa drug po ste zhes pa ni bkra shis dang rna ba ni gza' lag dang lce ni phur bu dang sna ni pa ba sangs dang lus kyi dbang po ni sben pa dang yid kyi dbang po ni mjug rings so zhes pa drug🔽po'o // de @292a * //
translated: Then, the six, such as the eyes, arise. The eyes are Śukra, the ears are Aṅgāraka, the tongue is Budha, the nose is Bṛhaspati, the organ of touch is Śukra, and the mental organ is Ketu.

original: bzhin du lag pa rkang pa dag ni bzhi po zhes pa la lag pa g-yon pa ni shar gyi gling dang lag pa g-yas pa ni lho'i gling dang rkang pa g-yas pa ni nub kyi gling dang rkang pa g-yon pa ni byang gi gling ngo zhes pa bzhi
analyzed: bzhin du lag pa rkang pa dag ni bzhi po zhes pa la lag pa g-yon pa ni shar gyi gling dang lag pa g-yas pa ni lho'i gling dang rkang pa g-yas pa ni nub kyi gling dang rkang pa g-yon pa ni byang gi gling ngo zhes pa bzhi
translated: Likewise, the four hands and feet are the four continents. The left hand is the eastern continent, the right hand is the southern continent, the right foot is the western continent, and the left foot is the northern continent.

original: po'o // lag pa rkang pa la gnas sor mo rnams ni lnga po'o zhes pa la 'dir mthe bo ni dri dang mdzub mo ni ro dang gung mo ni gzugs dang ming med ni reg bya dang mthe chung ni sgra ste sa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas
analyzed: po'o // lag pa rkang pa la gnas sor mo rnams ni lnga po'o zhes pa la 'dir mthe bo ni dri dang mdzub mo ni ro dang gung mo ni gzugs dang ming med ni reg bya dang mthe chung ni sgra ste sa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas
translated: The five fingers on the hands and feet are the five continents. Here, the thumb is smell, the index finger is taste, the middle finger is form, the fourth finger is touch, and the little finger is sound.

original: so // sor mo lnga po de rnams kyi tshigs gsum pa ni gsum por brjod de dang po'i tshigs ni snying stobs kyi yon tan dang dbus ma'i tshigs ni rdul gyi yon tan dang mtha'i tshigs ni mun pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: so // sor mo lnga po de rnams kyi tshigs gsum pa ni gsum por brjod de dang po'i tshigs ni snying stobs kyi yon tan dang dbus ma'i tshigs ni rdul gyi yon tan dang mtha'i tshigs ni mun pa'i yon tan no //
translated: The third joint of those five fingers is called the three. The first joint has the quality of sattva, the middle joint has the quality of rajas, and the last joint has the quality of tamas.

original: mun pa'i mthar sen mo'i tshigs ni gtso bo ste 'dir ni rim pa mtha' dag rigs 'di la ni rig par bya zhes pa rigs pa'o //
analyzed: mun pa'i mthar sen mo'i tshigs ni gtso bo ste 'dir ni rim pa mtha' dag rigs 'di la ni rig par bya zhes pa rigs pa'o //
translated: At the end of the dark [half], the joint of the nail is the principal [joint]. Here, all the stages are to be known in this system.

original: da ni gdan la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba gsungs pa sa 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rkang pa bzhi'i dbang gis dbye ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: da ni gdan la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba gsungs pa sa 'dzin zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir rkang pa bzhi'i dbang gis dbye ba bzhi'o //
translated: Now, the division of the seat, etc. is stated by earth-holder, etc. Here, by the power of four lines, there are four divisions.

original: de ltar gdan gyi dbye bas 'dzin zhes pa bcu drug go //
analyzed: de ltar gdan gyi dbye bas 'dzin zhes pa bcu drug go //
translated: Thus, by the division of the seat, there are sixteen earth-holders.

original: de nyid rab dbye rnams ni nyi shu rtsa lnga ste kun 'byung gi phyir gad na gcig yod pa de na lnga ga'o //
analyzed: de nyid rab dbye rnams ni nyi shu rtsa lnga ste kun 'byung gi phyir gad na gcig yod pa de na lnga ga'o //
translated: Those very divisions are twenty-five, because of the origination. Where one exists, there all five exist.

original: ro yis bsgyur pa'i ro zhes pa drug gis bsgyur pa'i drug ni sum cu rtsa drug 'gyur te rkang pa drug gi dbang gis bkra shis la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: ro yis bsgyur pa'i ro zhes pa drug gis bsgyur pa'i drug ni sum cu rtsa drug 'gyur te rkang pa drug gi dbang gis bkra shis la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: By the six tastes transformed by taste, the six transformed by the six are thirty-six. By the power of six lines, there is the division of auspiciousness, etc.

original: bzhi po la nyi ma zhes pa dbye ba bcu gnyis te lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs kyi dbye ba bcu gnyis dang phyi rol du zla ba dang khyim bcu gnyis kyi dbye ba las so //
analyzed: bzhi po la nyi ma zhes pa dbye ba bcu gnyis te lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs kyi dbye ba bcu gnyis dang phyi rol du zla ba dang khyim bcu gnyis kyi dbye ba las so //
translated: In the four, the sun is the twelve divisions, that is, the twelve divisions of the joints of the arms and legs, and externally, the twelve divisions of the moon and the houses.

original: lnga po la nyi shu ste sor mo'i grangs so //
analyzed: lnga po la nyi shu ste sor mo'i grangs so //
translated: In the five, there are twenty, the number of fingers.

original: de bzhin du sor mo'i tshigs rnams la dbye ba drug cu ste dbye ba 'di rnams mi rnams dang lha rnams dag gi mtha' dag lus la gnas pa ste dri ma med pa'i lus la gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sor mo'i tshigs rnams la dbye ba drug cu ste dbye ba 'di rnams mi rnams dang lha rnams dag gi mtha' dag lus la gnas pa ste dri ma med pa'i lus la gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In the same way, there are sixty divisions in the joints of the fingers. The meaning of this is that all of these divisions exist in the bodies of humans and gods, but not in stainless bodies.

original: thams cad bsdus pa ni bug pa drug dang zla ba'i grangs zhes pa brgya drug cu rtsa dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad bsdus pa ni bug pa drug dang zla ba'i grangs zhes pa brgya drug cu rtsa dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: The total is the six openings and the number of the moon, which is one hundred and sixty-nine.

original: de dag thams cad bsdus pa zhes pa de rnams bsdus pa las sum 'gyur dgu ru 'gyur te zhes pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsdus pa zhes pa de rnams bsdus pa las sum 'gyur dgu ru 'gyur te zhes pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The meaning of “all of those” is that the total of those is multiplied by three, making twenty-seven.

original: slar yang zhi ba dang nus ma'i dbye ba rten dang brten pa'i chos kyis lnga bcu rtsa bzhi'o zhes par @292b rig par bya'o //🔽rigs 'di la gang zhig srog gi rtsa la yang dag par rgyu ba dang gza' rnams kyi rgyu skar la yang dag par rgyu ba ste 'di rnams kyi yang dag par rgyu ba gang yin pa de ni cig shos phyi rol gyi bka' la dga' ba rnams kyis
analyzed: slar yang zhi ba dang nus ma'i dbye ba rten dang brten pa'i chos kyis lnga bcu rtsa bzhi'o zhes par @292b rig par bya'o // rigs 'di la gang zhig srog gi rtsa la yang dag par rgyu ba dang gza' rnams kyi rgyu skar la yang dag par rgyu ba ste 'di rnams kyi yang dag par rgyu ba gang yin pa de ni cig shos phyi rol gyi bka' la dga' ba rnams kyis
translated: Again, by the division of peace and power, and by the phenomena of the support and the supported, [the channels] are to be known as fifty-four.🔽In this system, the movement in the life channel and the movement in the lunar mansions of the planets are the movements of these [channels].

original: rnal 'byor ma'i yang dag par rgyu bar brjod do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i yang dag par rgyu bar brjod do //
translated: The other, the movement of the yoginīs, is described as the external movement of those who delight in the words of the Buddha.

original: de skad du rtsa ba'i mdo las bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad du rtsa ba'i mdo las bshad pa /
translated: Thus it is explained in the Root Tantra:

original: gang zhig nus ma bha ga zhes bya de ni rnam gsum bgrod ldan yi ge gsum dang rang bzhin gsum //
analyzed: gang zhig nus ma bha ga zhes bya de ni rnam gsum bgrod ldan yi ge gsum dang rang bzhin gsum //
translated: The power called bhaga has three movements, three syllables, and three natures.

original: de la dpal ldan ao di y'a na mchog gi cha dang bcas pa dbus su gnas shing shin tu 'bar //
analyzed: de la dpal ldan ao di y'a na mchog gi cha dang bcas pa dbus su gnas shing shin tu 'bar //
translated: There, the glorious Oḍiyāna, with its supreme part, abides in the center, blazing.

original: de yi g-yas zur nyid du rab tu gsal byas gnas la dpal ldan dz'a l'i dha ra zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yi g-yas zur nyid du rab tu gsal byas gnas la dpal ldan dz'a l'i dha ra zhes bya ste /
translated: On its right side, in the place called Jalandhara, is the glorious Jalandhara.

original: g-yon du dpal ldan gang ba'i gnas te phyugs kyi skye bo 'jigs byed k'a ma r'u ba da yi rtser //
analyzed: g-yon du dpal ldan gang ba'i gnas te phyugs kyi skye bo 'jigs byed k'a ma r'u ba da yi rtser //
translated: On the left is the glorious Pūrṇagiri, the place of the fearful people of cattle, on the peak of Kāmarūpa.

original: de ltar kun nas khyab byed gnas dang 'jigs dang skyed ma khyab byed ma ni drag po'i nus ma ste /
analyzed: de ltar kun nas khyab byed gnas dang 'jigs dang skyed ma khyab byed ma ni drag po'i nus ma ste /
translated: Thus, the all-pervading places, fearful and generative, are pervaded by the all-pervading one, the powerful one of Rudra.

original: de yi dbus na rtags ni mchog gi bde byed thig le n'a da khor na gnas shing rtag tu dga' //
analyzed: de yi dbus na rtags ni mchog gi bde byed thig le n'a da khor na gnas shing rtag tu dga' //
translated: In its center is the supreme bliss-producing sign, the bindu, the nada, the abode, and the constant joy.

original: shin tu zhi ba yod de de yi steng na srub pa rnam pa drug gis rnam par phye pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu zhi ba yod de de yi steng na srub pa rnam pa drug gis rnam par phye pa'o //
translated: The very peaceful one exists there, above which is the churning by the six aspects.

original: 'dod pa gsum po 'di nams byed cing mchog gi lus bskyod ku pa dzi ka zhes bya ba la phyag 'tshal zhes pa rigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa gsum po 'di nams byed cing mchog gi lus bskyod ku pa dzi ka zhes bya ba la phyag 'tshal zhes pa rigs pa ste /
translated: This is the reasoning: “Homage to the one who performs the three desires, the supreme body-shaking, called Kuṇḍalī.”

original: sems can thams cad la lhan cig skyes pa 'bebs par byed ma bha ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la lhan cig skyes pa 'bebs par byed ma bha ga zhes bya'o //
translated: The bhaga is called the one who causes the simultaneous descent into all sentient beings.

original: zhes pa rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature.

original: de nas rigs kyi mdo lus rdzogs pa'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas rigs kyi mdo lus rdzogs pa'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Next, the cause of the complete body of the clan is as follows:

original: k'a ma r'u par k'u yig bu li la gnas pu li ka rnams dz'a la'i gnas su me lce nyid /
analyzed: k'a ma r'u par k'u yig bu li la gnas pu li ka rnams dz'a la'i gnas su me lce nyid /
translated: The syllable ka in the form of a hook, the syllable ū in the form of a hook, and the syllable pu in the form of a hook,

original: dpal ldan dbus kyi gnas su aond'a rnam pa gsum gyi lam bgrod lha yi rva co ta yig rnams //
analyzed: dpal ldan dbus kyi gnas su aond'a rnam pa gsum gyi lam bgrod lha yi rva co ta yig rnams //
translated: the flame of fire in the abode of the zodiac, the three forms of the syllable oṃ in the glorious center, the path traversed, the horn of the god, the syllable ca.

original: de yi grub pa rnams kyang lnga ste da ra la ka dang bcas de rnams lha mo bzhi dang lnga //
analyzed: de yi grub pa rnams kyang lnga ste da ra la ka dang bcas de rnams lha mo bzhi dang lnga //
translated: And also the five accomplishments, along with the syllable da, those are the four goddesses and the fifth.

original: de phyir nus ma gsum mam rigs kyi ljon shing skyed ma sgur 'khyog ma zhes bya ba la phyag 'tshal zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de phyir nus ma gsum mam rigs kyi ljon shing skyed ma sgur 'khyog ma zhes bya ba la phyag 'tshal zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, homage to the three powers or to the hunchbacked woman who produces the tree of the clan, called “the crooked one.”

original: de ltar mchog tu gsad pa ni lha min dang / bdud kyi ris kyi bza' bar bya ba'i rigs las byung ba rnams kyis mi shes so zhes pa rigs kyi mdo'i nges @293a * //
analyzed: de ltar mchog tu gsad pa ni lha min dang / bdud kyi ris kyi bza' bar bya ba'i rigs las byung ba rnams kyis mi shes so zhes pa rigs kyi mdo'i nges @293a * //
translated: Thus, the supreme secret is not known by those born in the clan of the demons and the class of Māra, who are to be devoured.

original: pa'o // da ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par sdud pa gsungs pa ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pa'o // da ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par sdud pa gsungs pa ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the chapter on the perfect gathering of the qualities of the Buddha is explained by the words “wisdom” and so on.

original: 'dir dus kyi 'khor lo la rnal 'byor pas chos yang dag par sdud pa shes nas de nas rgyud bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dus kyi 'khor lo la rnal 'byor pas chos yang dag par sdud pa shes nas de nas rgyud bstan par bya'o //
translated: Here, the yogi, having understood the Dharma-saṃgīti of the Kālacakra, should then teach the Tantra.

original: gzhan du na chos yang dag par sdud pa med na lam ngan pa ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na chos yang dag par sdud pa med na lam ngan pa ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, without the Dharma-saṃgīti, he would teach a bad path.

original: des na chos yang dag par sdud pa bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: des na chos yang dag par sdud pa bri bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the Dharma-saṃgīti should be written.

original: 'dir ye shes nam mkha' gnyis zhes pa ye shes ni 'dzin par byed pa'i sems dang / gzung bar bya ba stong pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'dir ye shes nam mkha' gnyis zhes pa ye shes ni 'dzin par byed pa'i sems dang / gzung bar bya ba stong pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Here, the two of wisdom and space means the mind that apprehends and the empty form that is apprehended.

original: gnyis po ni shes rab dang thabs te /
analyzed: gnyis po ni shes rab dang thabs te /
translated: The two are wisdom and method.

original: bha ga dang rtags yang dag par sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bha ga dang rtags yang dag par sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The union of the bhaga and the sign is not [the union of] the wisdom and method.

original: 'dis sems can gyi don byas pas theg pa gsum ston pa por 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'dis sems can gyi don byas pas theg pa gsum ston pa por 'gyur zhing /
translated: By this, having done the welfare of sentient beings, he becomes the teacher of the three vehicles.

original: chos yang dag par rig pa por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos yang dag par rig pa por 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes the knower of the Dharma.

original: 'dir theg pa gsum ni nyan thos kyi theg pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa gsum ni nyan thos kyi theg pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ste /
translated: Here, the three vehicles are the Śrāvaka Vehicle, the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, and the Vehicle of the Perfectly Complete Buddhas.

original: 'dis 'gro ba'i phyir theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'gro ba'i phyir theg pa'o //
translated: It is a vehicle because it carries beings.

original: dkon mchog gsum ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog ste ston pa po dang // bstan pa dang zhu ba po'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog ste ston pa po dang // bstan pa dang zhu ba po'o //
translated: The Three Jewels are the Jewel of the Buddha, the Jewel of the Dharma, and the Jewel of the Community, which are the teacher, the teaching, and those who listen.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Similarly, there are three roots:

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: the generation of the mind of enlightenment, the purity of intention, and the abandonment of the grasping of self and the grasping of “mine.”

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas la skyabs pa dang / chos la skyabs pa dang // dge 'dun la skyabs pa ste de ltar skyabs su 'gro ba gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas la skyabs pa dang / chos la skyabs pa dang // dge 'dun la skyabs pa ste de ltar skyabs su 'gro ba gsum mo //
translated: Similarly, there are three refuges: the refuge in the Buddha, the refuge in the Dharma, and the refuge in the Community.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa bzhi ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa bzhi ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal lo //
translated: The four afflictions of all sentient beings are desire, hatred, ignorance, and pride.

original: bdud bzhi ni phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi ni phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'o //
translated: The four demons are the aggregates, the afflictions, the Lord of Death, and the son of heaven.

original: 'di rnams rnam par nyams par byed pa sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: 'di rnams rnam par nyams par byed pa sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: The four divine abodes of the buddhas, which destroy these, are love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa bzhi ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / @293b smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa bzhi ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / @293b smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the four liberations are emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and non-compoundedness.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang dpyod pa'o //
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers are aspiration, effort, mind, and investigation.

original: sems can rnams kyi zag pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi zag pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four defilements of sentient beings are as follows:

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa'o //
translated: the defilement of desire, the defilement of existence, the defilement of ignorance, and the defilement of views.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi 'jigs pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi 'jigs pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four fearlessnesses of the buddhas are as follows:

original: chos thams cad mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / chos thams cad ston pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i lam du 'jug pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i ye shes la gnas pa la mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / chos thams cad ston pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i lam du 'jug pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i ye shes la gnas pa la mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The four fearlessnesses are: fearlessness with regard to the knowledge of all things, fearlessness with regard to the teaching of all the paths, fearlessness with regard to the teaching of the attainment of the unhindered path, and fearlessness with regard to the teaching of the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: bden pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four noble truths are:

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / lam gyi bdan  pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / lam gyi bdan  pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.

original: rton pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rton pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four reliances are:

original: don la rton par bya'i tshig la rton par mi bya ba dang / ye shes la rton par bya'i rnam shes la rton par mi bya ba dang / nges pa'i don la rton par bya'i drang ba'i don la rton par mi bya ba dang / chos la rton par bya'i gang zag la rton par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: don la rton par bya'i tshig la rton par mi bya ba dang / ye shes la rton par bya'i rnam shes la rton par mi bya ba dang / nges pa'i don la rton par bya'i drang ba'i don la rton par mi bya ba dang / chos la rton par bya'i gang zag la rton par mi bya ba'o //
translated: rely on the meaning, not on the expression; rely on the teaching, not on the person; rely on the definitive meaning, not on the interpretable meaning; rely on the wisdom of the noble beings, not on the consciousness of the ordinary person.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are: mindfulness of the body, mindfulness of feeling, mindfulness of thought, and mindfulness of dharmas.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ni sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ni sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'o //
translated: The four means of gathering disciples are: generosity, pleasant speech, purposeful behavior, and sameness of purpose.

original: 'dir ni don chen po mchog tu mi 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni don chen po mchog tu mi 'gyur pa ste /
translated: Here, the great purpose is the supreme, unchanging.

original: de'i don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'o //
translated: The purposeful behavior and sameness of purpose are for that purpose.

original: chos sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i mchog ste /
analyzed: chos sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i mchog ste /
translated: The gift of Dharma is the supreme generosity.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa bzhi ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhi pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa bzhi ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhi pa'o //
translated: The four gifts of Dharma are: all conditioned things are impermanent, all conditioned things are suffering, all dharmas are without self, and nirvana is peace.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni sdig pa ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed pa dang / sdig pa skyes pa rnams kyi gnyen po dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa dang / dge @294a * //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni sdig pa ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed pa dang / sdig pa skyes pa rnams kyi gnyen po dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa dang / dge @294a * //
translated: The four correct abandonments are:🔽generating the will to prevent the arising of nonvirtue that has not yet arisen,🔽generating the roots of virtue that are the antidotes to nonvirtue that has arisen,🔽

original: ba ma skyes pa rnams yang dag par skyed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: ba ma skyes pa rnams yang dag par skyed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: The four right efforts are: generating the will in order not to generate evil that has not yet arisen; generating the roots of the wholesome that are the antidotes to evil that has arisen; correctly generating the wholesome that has not yet arisen; and dedicating the roots of the wholesome that have arisen to Buddhahood.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: These four are fourfold:

original: rgyal ba mchog gi rdo rje rnams kyis zhes pa sku dang / gsung dang / thugs dang / ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / sprul pa dang / chos dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi sku rnam par dag ba bsgom par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba mchog gi rdo rje rnams kyis zhes pa sku dang / gsung dang / thugs dang / ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / sprul pa dang / chos dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi sku rnam par dag ba bsgom par bya ba ste /
translated: The vajras of the supreme victors are the vajra of the body, the vajra of speech, the vajra of mind, the vajra of gnosis, the vajra of emanation, the vajra of Dharma, the vajra of enjoyment, and the vajra of the essential body.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi slad du lha'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi slad du lha'i rnam pa'o //
translated: They are to be cultivated in the form of the deity for the sake of mundane powers.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa lnga ni lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / nam mkha'i rdzu 'phrul lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa lnga ni lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / nam mkha'i rdzu 'phrul lo //
translated: Likewise, the five higher knowledges of the bodhisattvas are the divine eye, the divine ear, knowledge of the minds of others, recollection of former lives, and the magical power of the sky.

original: stobs lnga ni dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs te de bzhin du dbang po lnga'o //
analyzed: stobs lnga ni dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs te de bzhin du dbang po lnga'o //
translated: The five powers are the power of faith, the power of perseverance, the power of mindfulness, the power of concentration, and the power of wisdom. The five faculties are the same as the powers.

original: sems can rnams kyi lta ba lnga ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lta ba lnga ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The five views of sentient beings are the view of the transitory aggregates, the view holding to an extreme, wrong views, the view of holding a view as paramount, and the view of holding morality and asceticism as paramount.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan lnga ni sha'i spyan dang / lha'i spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang / ye shes kyi spyan no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan lnga ni sha'i spyan dang / lha'i spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang / ye shes kyi spyan no //
translated: The five eyes of the Buddhas are the eye of flesh, the divine eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma eye, and the eye of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po lnga ni tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po lnga ni tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The five supramundane aggregates of the Buddhas are the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of concentration, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the vision and cognition of liberation.

original: 'jig rten pa yi ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The mundane aggregates are form, etc.

original: khams rnams ni sa la sogs pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang / yul rnams ni dri la sogs pa rnams dang / las kyi dbang po rnams ni bshang lam la sogs pa rnams dang / las kyi dbang po'i bya ba rnams ni rjod pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: khams rnams ni sa la sogs pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang / yul rnams ni dri la sogs pa rnams dang / las kyi dbang po rnams ni bshang lam la sogs pa rnams dang / las kyi dbang po'i bya ba rnams ni rjod pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The elements are earth, etc. The faculties are the eye, etc. The objects are form, etc. The organs of action are the anus, etc. The actions of the organs of action are speech, etc.

original: de ltar lnga ste chos kyi khams @294b dang lhan cig thams cad drug go //
analyzed: de ltar lnga ste chos kyi khams @294b dang lhan cig thams cad drug go //
translated: Thus, there are five, together with the element of mental objects, making six.

original: rjes su dran pa drug ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa drug ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The six recollections are the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Doctrine, the recollection of the Community, the recollection of relinquishment, the recollection of morality, and the recollection of the gods.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: The seven members of enlightenment are the member of enlightenment of the correct concept of mind, the member of enlightenment of the correct concept of doctrine, the member of enlightenment of correct vigor, the member of enlightenment of correct joy,

original: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: the member of enlightenment of correct ease, the member of enlightenment of correct concentration, and the member of enlightenment of correct balance.

original: mchod pa rnam pa bdun ni phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa dang bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa bdun ni phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa dang bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: The seven kinds of worship are: homage, worship, confession, rejoicing, requesting, beseeching, and dedication.

original: lam yan lag brgyang ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /🔽yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: lam yan lag brgyang ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The eightfold noble path is: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: bsam gtan gyi rnam par thar pa brgyad ni gzugs stong par lta ba dang / nang gi gzugs dang phyi'i gzugs stong par lta ba ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi rnam par thar pa brgyad ni gzugs stong par lta ba dang / nang gi gzugs dang phyi'i gzugs stong par lta ba ste /
translated: The eight liberations of the dhyanas are: seeing forms while having the notion of form, seeing forms while having no notion of form, seeing forms that are limited, seeing forms that are unlimited, having the notion of beauty, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the sphere of nothingness.

original: stong pa zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: stong pa zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The notion of form is the form aggregate.

original: sdug pa dang / mi sdug par lta bas byas pa stong par lta ba dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched stong par lta ba dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched stong par lta ba ste /
analyzed: sdug pa dang / mi sdug par lta bas byas pa stong par lta ba dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched stong par lta ba dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched stong par lta ba ste /
translated: The view of emptiness of the sphere of infinite space, the view of emptiness of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the view of emptiness of the sphere of nothingness, the view of emptiness of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and the view of emptiness of the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs la'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs la'o //
translated: These are in relation to the form of all aspects.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched stong par lta ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched stong par lta ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog @295a * //🔽pa stong par lta ba ste /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched stong par lta ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched stong par lta ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog @295a * // pa stong par lta ba ste /
translated: The view of emptiness of the four formless meditative attainments.

original: stong pa nyid sgom pa la'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid sgom pa la'o //
translated: These are in relation to the meditation on emptiness.

original: gzugs can brgyad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs can brgyad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'o //
translated: The eight forms are the four great elements and form, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: yang dag par bsdu ba mdzad pa rnams kyi gsung rab yan lag dgu ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / de lta bu byung ba dang /
analyzed: yang dag par bsdu ba mdzad pa rnams kyi gsung rab yan lag dgu ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / de lta bu byung ba dang /
translated: The nine branches of the scriptures of those who compiled the teachings correctly are the category of sutra, the category of melodious narrations, the category of prophecies, the category of verses, the category of aphorisms, the category of narratives, the category of former events, the category of extensive teachings and the category of marvelous events.

original: skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa rmad du byung ba ste chos yang dag par bsdu pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa rmad du byung ba ste chos yang dag par bsdu pa'i slad du'o //
translated: The nine branches of the scriptures of the Perfectly Awakened Ones who have collected the true Dharma are the category of sutra, the category of geya, the category of vyakarana, the category of gathā, the category of udana, the category of nidana, the category of avadana, the category of itivrttaka, and the category of vaipulya.🔽They are called the true collection of the Dharma.

original: pha rol du phyin pa bcu la sogs pa bcu po rnams ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa las brjod de /
analyzed: pha rol du phyin pa bcu la sogs pa bcu po rnams ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa las brjod de /
translated: The ten categories such as the ten perfections are mentioned in the Siddhi of Supreme, Unchanging Wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad po rnams kyang brjod zin to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad po rnams kyang brjod zin to //
translated: The eighteen special qualities of the Buddha are also mentioned there.

original: 'dir dge slong rnams kyi sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni bsod snyoms pa dang / chos gos gsum pa dang / zas phyis mi len pa dang / cog pu ba dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa dang / gdan gcig pa dang / bla gab med pa dang /
analyzed: 'dir dge slong rnams kyi sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni bsod snyoms pa dang / chos gos gsum pa dang / zas phyis mi len pa dang / cog pu ba dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa dang / gdan gcig pa dang / bla gab med pa dang /
translated: Here, the twelve ascetic practices of the monks are: the alms-man, the three-robe-man, the non-receiver-of-food-after-times, the sitter, the as-is-the-ground-man, the one-seat-man, the uncovered-man,

original: shing drud pa dang / dgon pa pa dang / dur khrod pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa dang / phyid pa pa'o //
analyzed: shing drud pa dang / dgon pa pa dang / dur khrod pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa dang / phyid pa pa'o //
translated: the dragged-wood-man, the forest-man, the charnel-ground-man, the rag-robe-man, and the fasting-man.

original: de ltar dang por chos thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba shes nas /
analyzed: de ltar dang por chos thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba shes nas /
translated: Thus, first knowing the correct compilation of all dharmas,

original: de nas rang gi lus la khyab bdag mchog gi go 'phang ma ning ni sngags pas bsgom par bye sta slob dpon dang bcas pa yis so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nas rang gi lus la khyab bdag mchog gi go 'phang ma ning ni sngags pas bsgom par bye sta slob dpon dang bcas pa yis so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: then the mantrin should meditate on the supreme state of the all-pervading lord in his own body, together with the master.

original: 'di'i rjes la rtsis kyi grangs gcig la sogs pa la zla ba la sogs pa'i ming rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rjes la rtsis kyi grangs gcig la sogs pa la zla ba la sogs pa'i ming rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni go sla'o //
translated: After this, the two verses that clearly state the names of the moon, etc., on the number one, etc., of calculation, are easy to understand.

original: da ni rgyud kyi yon tan gsungs pa rgyud kyi rgyal po zhes pa la sogs pa ste rnal 'byor ma dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad dag tu nges par rdo rje'i tshig mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba ni rdo rje can sh'akya thub pas spas pa ste /
analyzed: da ni rgyud kyi yon tan gsungs pa rgyud kyi rgyal po zhes pa la sogs pa ste rnal 'byor ma dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad dag tu nges par rdo rje'i tshig mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba ni rdo rje can sh'akya thub pas spas pa ste /
translated: In all the yoginī and yoga tantras, the supreme vajra words of unchanging bliss are praised by the vajra-holder Śākyamuni.

original: rdo rje zhes pa ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes bsam du med pa'i thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes bsam du med pa'i thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: “Vajra” refers to the indivisible, inconceivable wisdom mind-vajra.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje @295b can te rdo rje can des so //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje @295b can te rdo rje can des so //
translated: He who possesses that is the “vajra-holder,” by that vajra-holder.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na 'phags pa'i yul du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na 'phags pa'i yul du sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi phyir te /
translated: Why is that? Because of the pride of the learned ones in the noble land.

original: gang gis sangs rgyas pa'i mkhas pa rnams bla ma'i sri zhu byas pa med par glegs bam mthong nas /
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas pa'i mkhas pa rnams bla ma'i sri zhu byas pa med par glegs bam mthong nas /
translated: By whom, the learned ones in the Buddha’s teachings, without serving a guru, seeing a book,

original: bdag cag rnams kyis rdo rje'i tshig shes so zhes brjod par 'gyur pa'i nga rgyal des dmyal bar 'gro ste /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams kyis rdo rje'i tshig shes so zhes brjod par 'gyur pa'i nga rgyal des dmyal bar 'gro ste /
translated: they say, “We know the vajra words,” by that pride they go to hell.

original: dbang yang dag par sbyin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang yang dag par sbyin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the empowerment is not perfectly bestowed.

original: de bas na sbas so //
analyzed: de bas na sbas so //
translated: Therefore, it is hidden.

original: des na dang po'i sangs rgyas su ni sham bha la'i yul du skyes pa nga rgyal med pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i srog chags rnams kyi thar pa'i slad du ma lus pa yang mngon sum du gsungs so //
analyzed: des na dang po'i sangs rgyas su ni sham bha la'i yul du skyes pa nga rgyal med pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i srog chags rnams kyi thar pa'i slad du ma lus pa yang mngon sum du gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Primordial Buddha was taught in the land of Shambhala, in the presence of those beings who are free of pride, for the sake of their liberation.

original: de'i phyir mtha' dag ma tshang ba med pa rgyud kyi rgyal po ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtha' dag ma tshang ba med pa rgyud kyi rgyal po ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the King of Tantras is supramundane, complete and without omission.

original: 'jig rten gyi rgyud bya ba'i rgyud dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnal 'byor gyi rgyud de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rgyud bya ba'i rgyud dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnal 'byor gyi rgyud de /
translated: The mundane tantra is the Action Tantra, and the supramundane is the Yoga Tantra.

original: de dag las 'das pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las 'das pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: Beyond those is the supramundane.

original: dpal ldan rgyud ni dang po'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: dpal ldan rgyud ni dang po'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: The glorious Tantra is the Primordial Buddha,

original: mchog gi rgyal pa'i bdag po ye shes kyi sku lhan cig skyes pa'i mngon par brjod pa'i rjod byed do //
analyzed: mchog gi rgyal pa'i bdag po ye shes kyi sku lhan cig skyes pa'i mngon par brjod pa'i rjod byed do //
translated: the expression of the simultaneously born exoteric teaching of the Lord of the Supreme King, the Wisdom Body.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa gsungs pa gang la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa gsungs pa gang la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the praise of the five aspects of the Bhagavat is stated beginning with “To whom?”

original: 'dir stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'dir stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga ni rdo rje'o //
translated: Here, the five immutable great emptinesses are the vajra.

original: de'i stong pa dang po ni rnam par shes pa 'gags pa ste gang la thog mtha' dbus med ces pa la sogs pa nas yon tan med pa de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i mthar thug pa rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das /
analyzed: de'i stong pa dang po ni rnam par shes pa 'gags pa ste gang la thog mtha' dbus med ces pa la sogs pa nas yon tan med pa de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i mthar thug pa rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das /
translated: The first emptiness of that is the cessation of consciousness, which is stated beginning with “To whom there is no beginning, middle, or end,” and concluding with “I pay homage to the one without qualities.”

original: gnyis med ye shes tshul 'chang ba zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis med ye shes tshul 'chang ba zhes pa ste /
translated: The second is “the one who holds the mode of nondual pristine consciousness.”

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa'i phyir de'i rigs las byung ba nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams las kyang 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa'i phyir de'i rigs las byung ba nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams las kyang 'das pa nyid do //
translated: Because it transcends the reality of consciousness, it also transcends the elements such as space, and the sense organs, and so on, that arise from that family.

original: de nas stong pa gnyis pa ni 'du byed 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: de nas stong pa gnyis pa ni 'du byed 'gag pa ste /
translated: Next, the second emptiness is the cessation of formation.

original: dus dang sna tshogs la sogs rdo rje @296a * //
analyzed: dus dang sna tshogs la sogs rdo rje @296a * //
translated: The vajra of time, variety, and so on

original: zhes pa la sogs pa nas dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal zhes pa'i mthar thug pa go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa nas dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal zhes pa'i mthar thug pa go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand, up to “Homage to Kālacakra.”

original: de bzhin du 'du byed gzhan de rnams zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rlung gi khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid stong pa gnyis pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed gzhan de rnams zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rlung gi khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid stong pa gnyis pas rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, since it is said “those other formations,” the wind element and the faculties and so on are the absence of obscuration, which should be understood as the second emptiness.

original: de nas stong pa gsum pa ni tshor ba 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: de nas stong pa gsum pa ni tshor ba 'gags pa ste /
translated: Then, the third emptiness is the cessation of feeling.

original: spro byed ces pa la sogs nas rnam par bcad pa de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: spro byed ces pa la sogs nas rnam par bcad pa de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: “The one who emanates” and so on, up to “Homage to the one who severs.”

original: tsher ba gzhan de ni zhes gsungs pa'i phyir me'i khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid ni stong pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: tsher ba gzhan de ni zhes gsungs pa'i phyir me'i khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid ni stong pa gsum pa'o //
translated: Since it is said “that other feeling,” the fire element and the faculties and so on are the absence of obscuration, which is the third emptiness.

original: de nas stong pa bzhi pa ni 'du shes 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: de nas stong pa bzhi pa ni 'du shes 'gags pa ste /
translated: Then, the fourth emptiness is the cessation of discernment.

original: dkar po zhes pa la sogs pa nas thig le'i gzugs la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: dkar po zhes pa la sogs pa nas thig le'i gzugs la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: “The white” and so on, up to “Homage to the form of the bindu.”

original: 'du shes gzhan de ni zhes gsungs pa'i phyir chu'i khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid ni stong pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes gzhan de ni zhes gsungs pa'i phyir chu'i khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid ni stong pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The other perception is the water element, and the absence of obscuration of the sense faculties and so forth is the fourth emptiness.

original: de nas stong pa lnga pa ni gzugs 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: de nas stong pa lnga pa ni gzugs 'gags pa ste /
translated: Then, the fifth emptiness is the cessation of form.

original: sems tsam zhes pa la sogs pa nas rdo rje sems dpa' la yang phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: sems tsam zhes pa la sogs pa nas rdo rje sems dpa' la yang phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: From “mind only” up to “homage to Vajrasattva,”

original: gzugs gzhan de ni zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de'i rigs can sa'i khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid ngo //
analyzed: gzugs gzhan de ni zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de'i rigs can sa'i khams dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid ngo //
translated: the other form is the earth element of its type, and the absence of obscuration of the sense faculties and so forth is the fifth emptiness.

original: 'di'i rgyas pa ni dang po 'jig rten khams kyi le'u las brjod zin te des na 'dir ma bkrol lo //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyas pa ni dang po 'jig rten khams kyi le'u las brjod zin te des na 'dir ma bkrol lo //
translated: This is elaborated in the first chapter on the world systems, and so it is not explained here.

original: 'di ni stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga'o //
translated: These are the five unchanging great emptinesses.

original: de nas thig le stong pa 'gyur med drug ces pa ni /
analyzed: de nas thig le stong pa 'gyur med drug ces pa ni /
translated: Then, the six unchanging empty bindu are as follows.

original: 'di'i rten du gyur pa'i chos 'byung sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi mtshan nyid khams gsum dang / dus gsum po thams cad du 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rten du gyur pa'i chos 'byung sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi mtshan nyid khams gsum dang / dus gsum po thams cad du 'jig pa'o //
translated: The dharmadhatu that is the basis of this is the characteristic of the Buddha's form body, the destruction of all the three realms and the three times.

original: 'di'i 'gog pa'i phung po la sogs pa drug dang khams sum cu rtsa drug dang 'gyur pa'i ye shes sum cu rtsa bdun pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i 'gog pa'i phung po la sogs pa drug dang khams sum cu rtsa drug dang 'gyur pa'i ye shes sum cu rtsa bdun pa ste /
translated: The six aggregates of cessation, etc., the thirty-six elements, and the thirty-seven transformations of gnosis are the dharmakaya.

original: 'di rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid ni chos kyi sku chos 'byung du brjod cing rdo rje bzhi ni 'gyur med lnga ste 'di dag gi sprul pa ni sprul pa'i sku rdzu @296b 'phrul sna tshogs ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams sgrib pa med pa nyid ni chos kyi sku chos 'byung du brjod cing rdo rje bzhi ni 'gyur med lnga ste 'di dag gi sprul pa ni sprul pa'i sku rdzu @296b 'phrul sna tshogs ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The absence of obscuration in these is the dharmadhatu, which is said to be the dharmakaya. The four vajras are the five immutable ones. Their emanations are the nirmanakaya, which displays various miracles.

original: chos ston pa bo'i sgra ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ston pa bo'i sgra ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The sound of teaching the Dharma is the sambhogakaya.

original: de'i phyir gcig dang du ma dag kyang gcig cing mnyam dang mi mnyam pa yang mnyam pa zhes pa la sogs pas dbu ma ba'i grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig dang du ma dag kyang gcig cing mnyam dang mi mnyam pa yang mnyam pa zhes pa la sogs pas dbu ma ba'i grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Therefore, the Madhyamika tenets are stated by the words, “The one and the many are also one, and the equal and the unequal are also equal,” and so on.

original: gang zhig kun gyi rten gcig ces pa la kun ni mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: gang zhig kun gyi rten gcig ces pa la kun ni mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'o //
translated: The one support of that is the characteristic of space.🔽 The bhaga of the good is the nature of the qualities of Īśvara, etc.🔽 The supreme bhaga is the supreme of the three realms.🔽 I bow to you, O cause, with my head.🔽 To you is to Mañjuśrī.🔽 Bow is I pay homage.🔽 Now, the teacher of the Kālacakra and his qualities, etc., are described beginning with who is the one, which is easy to understand.🔽 🔽The one who is the sole support of all is the great unchanging bliss.

original: de'i rten gcig ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rten gcig ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The one support of that is the characteristic of space.

original: bha ga bzang mo zhes pa ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bha ga bzang mo zhes pa ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The bhaga of the good is the nature of the qualities of Īśvara, etc.

original: mchog gi bha ga ni khams gsum gyi mchog go //
analyzed: mchog gi bha ga ni khams gsum gyi mchog go //
translated: The supreme bhaga is the supreme of the three realms.

original: rgyu nges na khyod la 'dud de da spyi bo yis so //
analyzed: rgyu nges na khyod la 'dud de da spyi bo yis so //
translated: I bow to you, O cause, with my head.

original: khyod la zhes pa ni khyod la 'jam dpal gyis so //
analyzed: khyod la zhes pa ni khyod la 'jam dpal gyis so //
translated: To you is to Mañjuśrī.

original: 'dud ces pa ni phyag 'tshal bar gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dud ces pa ni phyag 'tshal bar gyur cig pa'o //
translated: Bow is I pay homage.🔽 Now, the teacher of the Kālacakra and his qualities, etc., are described beginning with who is the one, which is easy to understand.🔽 🔽The one who is the sole support of all is the great unchanging bliss.🔽 The one support of that is the characteristic of space.

original: da ni dus kyi 'khor lo'i ston pa dang yon tan la sogs pa ni gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: da ni dus kyi 'khor lo'i ston pa dang yon tan la sogs pa ni gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: The bhaga of the good is the nature of the qualities of Īśvara, etc.🔽 The supreme bhaga is the supreme of the three realms.🔽 I bow to you, O cause, with my head.🔽 To you is to Mañjuśrī.🔽 Bow is I pay homage.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stod phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las thabs sna tshogs kyis 'dul ba'i mdor bsdus chen po ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stod phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las thabs sna tshogs kyis 'dul ba'i mdor bsdus chen po ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth part of the great summary, from the Stainless Light, a commentary on the Concise King of Tantras, the Wheel of Time, which is a continuation of the root tantra in twelve thousand parts, is the chapter on the various methods of discipline.

original: ye shes kyi le'u'i rgyas 'grel rdzogs so /
analyzed: ye shes kyi le'u'i rgyas 'grel rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the chapter on pristine awareness is complete.

original: // / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ni lung bstan dpal ldan rigs ldan rgyal po 'jam pa'i rdo rje gang gis ni //
analyzed: // / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ni lung bstan dpal ldan rigs ldan rgyal po 'jam pa'i rdo rje gang gis ni //
translated: The glorious king of the Kalki lineage, Manjushri Vajra, who was prophesied by the perfect Buddha,

original: mchog gi thugs rjes rab mchog thub pa'i tshogs ni sangs rgyas lam la bkod cing shes rab dbang bskur ba //
analyzed: mchog gi thugs rjes rab mchog thub pa'i tshogs ni sangs rgyas lam la bkod cing shes rab dbang bskur ba //
translated: who, with supreme compassion, established the supreme assembly of sages on the path of the Buddha, and bestowed the empowerment of wisdom,

original: byin nas dang po'i sangs rgyas las phyung rgyud ni mda' yi le'u dus kyi 'khor lo 'di bstan te //
analyzed: byin nas dang po'i sangs rgyas las phyung rgyud ni mda' yi le'u dus kyi 'khor lo 'di bstan te //
translated: revealed this tantra of the Wheel of Time, the Arrow Chapter, which was extracted from the tantra of the primordial Buddha.

original: 'dir ni dpal ldan ka l'a ba ru mi yi bdag po grags pa'i sras po padma dkar po bdag / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ni lung bstan rab tu dga' ba'i yid can dpal ldan grags pas bskul ba yis //
analyzed: 'dir ni dpal ldan ka l'a ba ru mi yi bdag po grags pa'i sras po padma dkar po bdag / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ni lung bstan rab tu dga' ba'i yid can dpal ldan grags pas bskul ba yis //
translated: urged on by the glorious Yaśas, whose mind is filled with joy,

original: dpal ldan rtsa ba'i rgyud gsal rgyud kyi rgyal po la ni rdo rje'i tshig rnams tshol bar byed pa yi //
analyzed: dpal ldan rtsa ba'i rgyud gsal rgyud kyi rgyal po la ni rdo rje'i tshig rnams tshol bar byed pa yi //
translated: having searched for the vajra words in the glorious root tantra, the king of tantras, the clear one,

original: rgyas 'grel byas nas phyin pa las ni bsod nams yang shing shin tu dkar ba gang zhig thob gyur pa //
analyzed: rgyas 'grel byas nas phyin pa las ni bsod nams yang shing shin tu dkar ba gang zhig thob gyur pa //
translated: having composed this extensive commentary, whatever extremely white merit I have obtained

original: de yis 'jig rten mtha' dag rdo rje can gyi lam thob sangs rgyas rab tu thob par shog /🔽bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal @297a * //
analyzed: de yis 'jig rten mtha' dag rdo rje can gyi lam thob sangs rgyas rab tu thob par shog / bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal @297a * //
translated: by that, may the entire world obtain the path of the vajra holder and attain buddhahood.

original: po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba rdzogs so /
translated: The Stainless Light, a commentary on the root tantra, the twelve thousand chapter extensive commentary on the Kālacakra Tantra, the king of all tantras, is complete.

original: // / kha che'i pandi ta chen po so ma n'a tha dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba chen po 'bro dge slong shes rab grags kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa las /
analyzed: // / kha che'i pandi ta chen po so ma n'a tha dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba chen po 'bro dge slong shes rab grags kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa las /
